situation: "Listen!" An old man with a piercing gaze locks eyes with you, and you feel strange information squirming around in your head.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: A priest has been called in to counsel a particularly hopeless case. If you are
rest: Cursed or either your Stamina or Sanity is 2 or lower, he introduces himself as Father Iwanicki, and says, "I would like to offer my help, to make sure that no more suffer the same fate as this poor soul." Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, you may search the Unique Item deck for the Holy Water card and take it.

situation: Joe Osborn greets you as you enter his General Store, but lets you look about the shop in peace. you notice a stack of mail meant to be delivered to Dunwich's inhabitents. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check to look through some of the letters. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, Joe doesn't take kindly to snooping and you must move to the streets.

situation: "Care to join the Order?" Carl Sanford and several of his henchmen ask. If you accept,
rest: pay $3 and take a Silver Twilight Membership. If you decline, pass a Will (-1) check or lose 3 Stamina as the henchmen assist you out the door. Whether you pass or not, move to the street.

situation: "Care to ride on the carousel? It's like no other in the world!" You may
rest: pay $1 for a ride. If you do, make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, visions of the happiest moments of your life float serenely past you. Restore your Sanity to its maximum. If you fail, you witness your death. — a tragic and messy affair. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: "Care to ride on the ferris wheel? You can see the entire state from the top!" You may
rest: pay $1 to make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you learn a lot about the layout of Arkham by looking down on it. Search the Common Item deck for a Map of Arkham card and take it, if there is one. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: "Care to try your luck? You could win a prize. Just knock down the bottles. It's so easy, even a child could do it!" You may
rest: pay $1 to try one of the fairway games. If you do, pass a Luck (-1) check to draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: "Certainly, we'd love to have you," Carl Sanford says, "if you can do something for us."
rest: Move to the City of the Great Race and have an encounter there, then immediately return. If you passed a test or defeated a monster encountered there, take a Silver Twilight Membership and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: "Come one, come all! View the wonders of the House of Mystery!" You may
rest: pay $1 to go inside. If you do, gain 3 Clue tokens and roll 3 dice, losing 1 Sanity for each failure you roll.

situation: "Come see the freaks! Gaze in wonder upon Samson, the strongest man in the world! Look in terror upon Abraham, the fish-man! View the delights of Dulcinea and Aphrodite, the Siamese seductresses of the great kings of Spain! Hurry! Hurry! Step right up!"
rest: Pay $1 to see the freak show. If you do, gain 2 Clue tokens, but stay here next turn.

situation: "Do you seek the blessing of Dagon?" If you do,
rest: draw 2 Innsmouth Look cards and become Blessed.

situation: "Durn roof keeps leakin'... ruinin' my wares!" If you offer to fix the roof for the shopkeeper,
rest: make a Speed (-1) check. If you fail, you fall and lose 2 Stamina. If you pass, he is grateful, and offers to give you any Common Item in the deck with a value equal to or lower than your number of successes.

situation: "Enjoying yourself?" Turning to look, you see a portly man in a Ringmaster's outfit. "My name is Darke. I own this carnival, and I have a proposition for you..." Darke thinks you're perfect for one of his acts.
rest: Take a Retainer card.

situation: "Excuse me, stranger, but have you ever seen this symbol before?" A man standing near the house holds up an occult symbol.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, the man introduces himself as Thomas F. Malone, a police detective visiting Arkham on a case. He's impressed with you and offers to join you. Take his Ally card. If it's not available, he tells you some valuable information instead. Gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: "Father Michael?" You look into the back office, and see the priest being assaulted by a demonic servitor of Horus!
rest: If you have a Cross, Holy Water, or Blessing card, you drive it off. Father Michael is shaken, and asks you to assist in running the church while he atones. If you drove off the being, you may take the Anointed card.

situation: "Free. Help yourself."
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to repair the item you find beneath the sign. If you pass, draw 1 Common Item. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as you injure yourself.

situation: "Friendly game of pool?"
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check and consult the chart below. Successes:  0) You lose $3. 1-2) You notice that your opponent is cheating! If you confront him, he shoves $3 at you but scowls, telling you you'd better not come back here. You are Barred from Easttown. 3) You gain $3.

situation: "Get out!" snarls the surly janitor, shaking a fist at you as he pokes his head into the archive room. "We're closed!" As he moves off down the hallway, he shouts back over his shoulder, "If I come back and you're still here..."
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you succeed, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, move to the street.

situation: "Here, take a load off and I'll teach you a neat trick." Harney shows you a magical incantation.
rest: Draw 1 Spell.

situation: "Hey there! What are you doing here?" Will Critchett, a muscular, unpleasant worker demands that you explain your presence on the construction site.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or move to the Causeway.

situation: "Hey, psst. You look like someone who could use a little information." Looking over at the bartender, you see him holding out his hand. You may
rest: pay him up to $6, gaining 1 Clue Token for every $2 you pay him.

situation: "Hey, you dropped this!" A young street urchin hands you an item and then scampers off. You don't recognize the item, but the boy is already gone.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: "Hi there. I haven't seen you around here before, have I? Why not join me for lunch? I'm Elizabeth Brundage." She turns out to be a motherly figure, keeping tabs on the artists in Kingsport. "Terrible what happened to poor Charles Baxter, really. He was such a promising poet, and to take his own life like that." She sighs, and you continue
rest: drawing the local gossip out of her. Gain 1 Clue token and 1 Sanity from the pleasant company.

situation: "Hmmm, I may have something that'll help you out." If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: "I bought these back during the war. Maybe they'll come in handy for you." Harney pulls a stack of Liberty Bonds from a tin container and passes a few to you.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: "I reckon you've got some natural ability you don't even know about. You could be the best if you put a little work into it." Harney's words encourage you to expand your knowledge.
rest: Gain 1 Skill.

situation: "I'll swap you for one of these."
rest: Discard one Common Item or one Unique Item of your choice. Then draw one Item of the type you discarded.

situation: "I'm running out of room, I'm afraid." Neil is willing to sell some of his inventory for a discount.
rest: Draw 1 Unique Item. You may purchase it for $2 less than the list price, to a minimum of $1.

situation: "I've noticed some odd things about Innsmouth," says Brian Burnham, the teenaged manager of the store. You chat with him for awhile.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: "In a hurry?" Carl Sanford asks. He offers to guide you through the old tunnels that connect the Lodge to the rest of the city.
rest: Move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there, drawing 2 cards and encountering either of them.

situation: "Interested in earning a little extra cash?" Mr. Darke asks if you'd be willing to put up posters for his Carnival in other towns. If you agree,
rest: gain a Retainer card and move immediately to the Train Station or any depot location aside from Bishop's Brook Bridge. (Do not have an encounter in the new location.)

situation: "Is that you, Camilla?" a voice calls to you in the darkness. If you flee,
rest: lose 1 Stamina. If you answer, pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: "It is not too late," whispers the voice in the darkness. If the terror level is less than 6,
rest: draw a Spell.

situation: "It's a new treatment," says the doctor, as orderlies you didn't notice before grab your arms from behind. "It's very promising."
rest: Roll a die. On a success, restore both your Sanity and Stamina to their maximum values. On a failure, reduce them to 1.

situation: "Jazz" Mulligan, the head janitor at the college, catches you wandering around in a restricted area of the building and escorts you outside.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: "Make yourself useful or get out of here!" You may choose to help load papers onto trucks. If you do,
rest: make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, gain $2. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. If you choose not to help load the trucks.move to the streets.

situation: "Mr. Skin's the name, investigatin's my game," he says, with a friendly smile. But there's something about him that makes you feel like a helpless child before a ravenous beast. If you agree to let him come along, his form and face seem to shift...
rest: you may take any Ally of your choice, but you lose 2 Stamina and 2 Sanity.

situation: "Nothing interesting's happened here in a week," sighs a bored barfly as you step up to the bar. Taking stock of the mostly empty place, you believe it. As you think better and turn to go, the man takes a cue from the owner's dirty look and stands to go with you, asking "Where are you headed?"
rest: Take Ryan Dean's Ally card. If it's not available, draw two Common Items instead.

situation: "Oddities of nature and unspeakably bizarre creatures await inside! Not for the faint of heart!" Among the stuffed two-headed calves and exotic birds in the tent of scientific curios, you find the carcass of something truly unnerving.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to steal the thing. If you pass, claim 1 monster trophy at random from the cup, ignoring the Endless ability. If you fail, move to the street.

situation: "Oh, no sir. The bus won't be leaving today — mechanical difficulties. You'll have to
rest: spend the night." Do they know that you know? A sleepless night robs you of 1 Sanity.

situation: "Perhaps we can help each other." Oliver Thomas, the shopkeep, searches you face with a speculative look. "If you have some information for me, I could teach you something extremely useful." You may
rest: pay 2 Clue tokens to draw 1 Spell.

situation: "Please! My husband is innocent! He could never commit those atrocities!" Deputy Dingby refuses to listen to the woman, but her story explains much of what has been going on.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: "Please," says the man outside the bank. "We lost everything. Please help." For every $1 you give him,
rest: gain 1 Sanity.

situation: "Popcorn! Candy apples! Soda pop! Step right up!" You may
rest: pay $1 for some refreshments. If you do, gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. If you do not pay $1, nothing happens.

situation: "Pray for Arkham, my son."
rest: Make a Will (-2) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) The Dark Pharaoh hears your prayer. Each investigator must make a Will (-2) check or be Cursed. 1-2) New and old gods alike hear you. Each investigator gains 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity, but add 1 doom counter to the doom track. 3+) Hope is rekindled. You gain 2 Sanity, and each investigator may make a Will (-2) check in order to be Blessed.

situation: "Quickly, come here, I have news." A voice whispers to you from a nearly closed window.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to gain Clue tokens equal to the number of successes you rolled.

situation: "Sample this incredible miracle tonic, you'll be completely revitalized!" You may
rest: pay $1 to try a sample. If you do, make a Luck (-1) check and consult the table below: Successes  0) Lose 1 Stamina 1) Gain 1 Stamina 2+) Gain 1 Stamina and you are Blessed

situation: "Shine your shoes?" A young shoe-shine boy looks up at you hopefully. If you agree, he talks about all sorts of interesting topics while shining your shoes.
rest: Pay $1 to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: "So, what's your story, friend?" A smiling man inquires about your adventures over a glass of gin. You tell him your story. If you
rest: spend 3 Clue Tokens, he introduces himself as Ryan Dean and asks to join you. Take his Ally card. If it's not available, he gives you some useful items instead. Draw 2 Common Items.

situation: "Sure, Deputy, I've got a permit for that. Yeah, that too." You're lying through your teeth, but if you can sell it, he'll drop the issue.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you must discard all of your Weapon cards, and are arrested.

situation: "Take whatever you want, hon." The shopkeeper's wife is getting back at her husband for a fight they had this morning.
rest: You may either take $2, take a Clue token, or draw a Common Item. However, you are delayed by her lengthy tirade about the dangers of marrying young.

situation: "Testifying" Cooter Falwell talks about a group he's heard about up in Dunwich called the Believers. He wants you to stay away from them, claiming that they dance naked around the standing stones on the hills there and traffick with demons. Although most of what he says is nonsense, you manage to find a few useful kernels of truth.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: "The King in Yellow" director is looking for old junk to use as props, and the best junk is in the garbage.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. For each success, draw 1 card from the Common Item deck and note its cost. Then, discard all the cards drawn, but gain money equal to the list price of the most expensive item.

situation: "The thief went this way!" someone shouts, coming from the direction of the museum exhibit.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, you follow the thief into the graveyard and watch where he hides the stolen item. Draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item.

situation: "There's a train headin' to Kingsport that goes right by here." You may immediately
rest: move to Central Hill if you like and have an encounter there.

situation: "They say it's good luck to make an offering to this ancient stone statue. Originally it was a god of a Polynesian tribe." You may
rest: pay $1 to make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you are Blessed. If you fail, you are reduced to 1 Sanity. If you don't pay, nothing happens.

situation: "This is a stick-up, see? Nobody move!" Three men armed with tommy guns rob the bank while you're standing in line.
rest: Make a Combat (-1) check. If you pass, you drive them off. Nothing happens. If you fail, lose all of your money.

situation: "This must be where pies go when they die." If you want,
rest: pay $1 to enjoy a fine slice of cherry pie. If you do, gain 2 Stamina

situation: "This one's got some wisdom to him," one of the orderlies says as he shows you a withered old Egyptian scholar who was recently committed. "It's like he seen somethin', and if you look close in his eyes, you can see it too." If you look into the patient's eyes,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you gain 4 Clue tokens. If you fail, you immediately go insane.

situation: "Three rings for just $1. Toss a ring on to a peg and win a prize!" You may
rest: pay $1 to roll 3 dice. If you roll at least 1 success, you win a large stuffed toy and gain 1 Sanity.

situation: "Time to pay your dues, brother. We need a champion, and you've been chosen." You are handed a weapon and thrown through a doorway into oblivion.
rest: You may search the Unique Item deck and take the first magical weapon you find, but you are transported to R'lyeh.

situation: "Transcribe for us every knowledge you possess regarding this object," buzzes the conical being. "Disregard these others."
rest: Discard a Unique Item of your choice, then draw a Unique Item. If you have no Unique Items, lose all of your Clue tokens.

situation: "Tut-tut," says Carl Sanford. "A sound mind is essential for membership, I'm afraid."
rest: For each point of Sanity you have, you may roll a die. If you roll any successes, you may draw a Twilight Lodge Membership card. For each unsuccessful die you roll, you lose 1 Sanity.

situation: "We claim this as our own," the ghouls demand, "or we shall pain you greatly."
rest: Discard a Tome or lose 2 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: "Weather's changin'," say an old salt.
rest: Draw Mythos cards until you find an Environment (Weather) card. Place that card directly into play, ignoring the gate and monster movement information on that card. Discard the other Mythos cards you have drawn.

situation: "What a shame," a voice whispers, "such unused potential."
rest: Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find. If it requires a skill check to read, then you may immediately make a check to read it, without spending any movement points to do so.

situation: "What do you think of my work?" An artist shows a series of sketches of creatures too horrific to even consider.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. Then, if you are still sane, make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, you attack the man and are arrested for being a menace.

situation: "What is this? You reckon it's valuable?" One of the mariners received a package from a shipmate who still travels to exotic locations.
rest: Make a Lore (+1) check to identify the object. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. You may purchase this item for $1 less than the list price (to a minimum of $1). If you do not purchase the item, it is discarded.

situation: "What'll it be, hon?" Velma takes your order.
rest: Pay up to $6 to gain that many points split between Sanity and Stamina however you like.

situation: "Wow! That would look great next to the Babylonian scroll cylinders!" Neil offers to buy a Unique Item from you for $3 more than its list price.
"You all right?" One of the workers is concerned that you may have serious injuries.
rest: If you currently have 3 Stamina or less, he administers some first aid. Gain 1 Stamina. Otherwise, nothing happens.

situation: "You know anything about machines?" A carny, covered in grease and sweat, is working on the carousel engine.
rest: Make a lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain $2. If you fail, the frustrated carny kicks you out. Move to the streets

situation: "You may be on to something about that new play. See what you can find out." If you
rest: do not already have a Retainer card, you may spend a Clue token to gain one.

situation: "You must always be studying," Carl Sanford tells you.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you are delayed, and then draw 1 Spell.

situation: "You okay, fella? You're not making sense." Sheriff Engle wants to keep you out of trouble.
rest: If you currently have 2 or less Sanity, make a Fight (+0) check. If you fail, lose all your Weapons and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: "You seem like you've got a level head. Care to help me with an experiment?" If you
rest: pass a Lore (-2) check or discard Research Materials, Dr. Herbert West offers to join you in thanks for your assistance. Take his Ally card or, if it's not available, gain 3 monster trophies from the monster cup at random, ignoring Endless.

situation: "You there! Care to test your strength?" You may
rest: pay $1 to take a swing. If you do, make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, gain $4. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: "You there. Friend. You are from this town, yes?" A poor foreign student wants to enroll at the university and asks if he can use your name because tuition is cheaper for local residents. If you agree,
rest: gain $10, but place a Patrol marker on the street area of Miskatonic U. The neighbors find it suspicious to have two people with the same name.

situation: "You there. Friend. You are from this town, yes?" A poor foreign student wants to enroll at the university, and asks if he can use your name because tuition is cheaper for local residents. If you agree,
rest: gain $10, but you are Barred from Miskatonic U.

situation: "You want the regular pie, or the magic pie?" asks Velma, with no apparent trace of irony. You may
rest: spend $5 to gain 1 Stamina, 1 Sanity, and become Blessed.

situation: "You want to see what we're really about, then?" If you accept the Order's invitation, you are introduced to the Black Man.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check or be devoured. If you pass, take a Silver Twilight Membership card and gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: "You will be rewarded according to what you have learned," whispers the voice of a long-dead warlock.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina but take a Clue token for each Spell you possess.

situation: "You! You are the one who has stood against the evil that plagues this town. We are all so grateful!" A crowd surrounds you, expressing gratitude and adoration.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: "You're in my seat, friend," says someone behind you.
rest: If you succeed in a Will (-1) check, you stare him down and keep you chair. If you fail, his meaty associates toss you in their trunk and dump you somewhere. Draw a Mythos card and move to the Gate location shown on it, then have an encounter in your new location.

situation: "You've miscounted," says the teller, recounting your deposit and demonstrating that-- sure enough-- you had two dollars more than you thought.
rest: Gain $2.

situation: A Miskatonic entomologist has heard rumors of an exotic species of beetle, previously only found along the Nile, that has been spotted in the campus hedgerows.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to find it for her. If you pass, she gives you a $5 stipend for your work.

situation: A Sheldon Gang member tries to rob you.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check. If you fail, lose 1 item of your choice. If you pass, you rob him instead. Gain $3.

situation: A band of pirates attack!
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and discard one item of your choosing. If you pass, you steal their ship and return to Arkham!

situation: A barfly sits down next to you and shares boring and incoherent stories.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to endure these dull tales until he's finished talking. If you pass, he tells you, "You're a good sort," and offers you a gift. Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: A bit of dirt has been disturbed here, revealing an oddly shaped skull. Something warns you that touching it could be a bad idea, but it seems to glow with power at the same time. If you decide to touch it,
rest: draw 1 Skill and 1 Madness card.

situation: A black hood is thrown over your head and you are taken to the docks, where you are placed on a small rowboat. After some time, your bonds are removed and you are pushed roughly out of the boat and onto the ground. "Have fun!" the guards say, laughing. Pulling off your hood, you find yourself far out to sea on top of a reef.
rest: Move to Devil Reef and have an encounter.

situation: A black hood is thrown over your head, and you are taken to the docks, where you are placed on a small rowboat. After some time, your bonds are removed, and you are pushed roughly out of the boat and onto the ground. "Have fun!" the guards say, laughing. Pulling off your hood, you find yourself far out to sea on top of a reef.
rest: Move to Devil Reef and have an encounter.

situation: A boat approaches, but the sailors don't want to risk being smashed onto the reef by the waves. They shout at you to swim to them. If you do,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, move to Falcon Point and have an encounter there. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina swimming back to the reef.

situation: A boat approaches... but who's on it?
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, friendly fishermen offer you a lift to Falcon Point. If you accept, move there and immediately have an encounter. If you fail, the robed figures beat you and rob you. Lose 1 Stamina, 1 Sanity, and 1 item of your choice.

situation: A boat is about to set out with a number of people trying to get out of Innsmouth. The sailors insist their passengers are carrying too much cargo. In a panic, the passengers try to sell it quickly for a discount.
rest: Draw 2 Common Item cards. You may purchase 1 for $1 less than its list price Discard any items not purchased.

situation: A bored cat challenges you to a riddle contest.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. If you pass, the cat leads you to a cache containing 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: A brawl breaks out at the front desk and you get swept up into the fray.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A brawl breaks out between a couple of the regulars, and Jonas Rigg has to fire his .45 in the air to break it up.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or move to the street with most of the startled crowd.

situation: A bronze plate near Founder's Rock commemorates the establishing of the city. You notice that a line of odd symbols runs along the border of the marker.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to interpret their meaning. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: A bunch of fishermen risked a trip out to Devil Reef and have caught more fish than they would have imagined. If you wish to help them unload their catch from the boat,
rest: you are delayed. But as you help them, you find they've caught something more than fish. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: A captive has been bound to a pole above the natives' cooking fire. If you want to try to free him,
rest: make a Fight (-3) check. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina. If you pass, draw an Ally.

situation: A car looks to have driven off the side of the bridge. You find no sign of a driver or any passenger but the doors seem to have been bent open unnaturally.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the water has not yet washed away a package in the passenger seat. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: A cat brushes against your leg and meows.
rest: Regain 1 Sanity.

situation: A cat offers you some advice.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to see how well you interpret it. Gain 1 Clue token for each success. If you fail the check, lose 1 Sanity for taking a cat's advice.

situation: A chemical brew bubbles on a nearby Bunsen burner. It smells delicious. If you drink it,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, the strange liquid fortifies you. Roll a die and gain that many points, split between your Stamina and Sanity however you like. If you fail, the liquid turns out to be coffee. Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: A chemistry professor offers you a draught of an experimental new concoction. If you accept,
rest: roll a die and set your current Stamina to the result of your die roll or your maximum Stamina, whichever is lower. Then do the same for your Sanity.

situation: A child is struggling to bring an enormous jar of pennies to the teller. You may
rest: make a Fight (-1) check to help him out. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity and $1 for your efforts. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A clockwork fortune-telling machine catches your eye. The wood and bronze gypsy seems to leer at you mockingly.
rest: Pay $1 to have your fortune told? If so, roll a die. On a 6, a white card falls into the slot. "Blessings be upon you." You are Blessed. On a 1, a black card falls into the slot. "A curse dogs your steps." You are Cursed. On a 2 through 5, the machine seems to be broken. Nothing happens.

situation: A collapsed side passage looks like it was once a smugglers' hideout.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, search the Common Item deck and take the first item with a list price of $4 or more.

situation: A competitor to the Arkham Advertiser offers you money to sabotage the presses. If you accept,
rest: gain $5 and make a Sneak (-2) check. If you fail, you are arrested as well as Barred from Northside.

situation: A conductor grabs your shoulder as you step onto the train. "This train's reserved," he rasps. You all but leap back onto the platform as the train begins to chug out of the station, fading from existence before your eyes. Choose a monster on an open gate and return it to the monster cup.
A conversation with the teenaged manager gives you a much better grasp of the lay of the land.
rest: Search the Common Item deck for a Map of Arkham.Gladys shakes her head at you. "I'm sorry, dearie, I'm afraid my rheumatism has been acting up today. I really just want to lie down." Move to the street.

situation: A couple of friendly workers share their lunch with you.
rest: Gain 2 Stamina.

situation: A craftsman offers you some of his wares. The quality is excellent but the prices seem high.
rest: Draw 2 Common Items. You may purchase one of them for $1 more than the list price. Discard any items not purchased.

situation: A crate bobs by the dock.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to pull it from the river and draw 1 Common Item.

situation: A crazed, half-dead explorer attacks you.
rest: Pass a Fight (+2) check to overcome him. If you succeed, take 1 Common Item and lose 1 Sanity as you contemplate this poor soul's fate. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A customer is angrily demanding his money back for an item he claims is defective. The shopkeeper argues that there's nothing wrong with it. The customer shoves the item in your hands and storms off in a huff.
rest: Gain 1 Common Item.

situation: A dark creeping fungus flows randomly across the ground.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and set your Speed slider to its lowest possible value.

situation: A dark ocean laps at your feet, and you see gables of old-fashioned buildings across the water. Could this be Innsmouth?
rest: Your Luck slider is reset to the lowest possible number, but you gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A dark shadow fall across Founder's Rock, and then dissolves as the sun passes behind a bank of clouds. A monster appears!
A desperate looking young man approaches you asking for financial help. He assures you he is a hard worker with a good future and that he will pay you back with interest. You may
rest: pay $3 to take a Retainer card.

situation: A dirty, bedraggled man in Egyptian robes stops you on your way into the bank, and intones, "It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than it is for a rich man to enter heaven!" If you
rest: discard all of your money, you are Blessed.

situation: A distant drumming can be heard. Strangely, it gives you a sense of security and protection, as if it were warding away some evil.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: A doctor working on dream therapy asks if you'd be willing to venture into a patient's nightmares; he seems to be beset by dreams of animal-headed men, blinding sand, and strange pyramids. If you agree, you
rest: gain 3 Clue tokens but immediately move to the Dreamlands.

situation: A dog blazes past you, chasing a squirrel.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or discard a Food card to take Duke's Ally card, or, if it's not available, $3 for returning him to his owner.

situation: A famed escape artist is investigating the area's legends of an unearthly glow which permeates the area at night. If you give him
rest: 2 of your Spells (discarding them), he introduces himself as Erich Weiss; take his Ally card if it's available. If it's not available, he shows you a trick instead, and you gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A familiar name appears as you pore over the student files.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: A family of tourists is receiving one of Neil's tours. They are so enthralled and delighted by his stories you can't help but feel better.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: A famous occultist is in town giving a lecture. As part of his demonstration he offers to place you in a trance. If you agree,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. Gain 1 Clue token for each success. if you fail the check, lose 1 Sanity as you are assailed by traumatic visions from your subconscious.

situation: A fashionably dressed woman tells you that the boat she hired has left her here, but it's worth it for the adventure. She introduces herself as Erica Carlyle and seems intrigued by your tales of mystery.
rest: If you have $3 or less, she agrees to join you and help pay your way. Take her Ally card or, if it is not available, gain a Retainer card.

situation: A federal agent is questioning people down by the shore. Frustrated, he tells you that he needs some solid proof before he can do anything. You may
rest: discard 5 toughness worth of monster trophies or a gate trophy. If you do, gain 2 Clue tokens that you must spend to place on any 2 spaces of the Feds Raid Innsmouth track.

situation: A fellow Lodge member helps you perform a ritual designed to protect you and your friends.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check to see the deeper meanings. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: A few engineers are testing some of the radio equipment intended for use here. They're having some difficulty making it work.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to recognize the problem. If you pass, they want to put you on the payroll as a consultant. Take a Retainer card.

situation: A few fishermen have stopped by to chat with Basil Elton. They're willing to give you a ride on their boat if you'd like. You may
rest: move to any aquatic location and have an encounter there.

situation: A few fishermen stop by and offer to sell some of their catch. If you're willing to buy any, Basil Elton is willing to cook it. You may
rest: spend $1 to gain 1 Stamina.

situation: A few members of the Sheldon Gang are gathered in the corner. One of them notices you watching and confronts you. If you
rest: spend at least 5 toughness worth of monster trophies or 1 Gate trophy, they accept you into the gang. Take a Sheldon Gang Membership card. If you do not spend the trophies, they throw you out. Move to the street and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A few of the fishermen have come by to warn Basil Elton that there's something dangerous in the waters near Innsmouth.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token as they describe the creatures seen near Devil Reef.

situation: A few shady figures are hanging out around Falcon Point at night.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose all of your money. If you fail the check and have no money, choose 1 item to discard instead.

situation: A flash of insight- the method by which the members of this Great Race project themselves to the future!
rest: Choose another investigator and swap locations with him.

situation: A fluttering yellow leaf falls from the old oak in the center of the square, and you glimpse a design on its surface.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to catch it before it falls among the other leaves. If you pass, you see that the leaf's veins form the shape of the Yellow Sign: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A force from within the house threatens to take over your mind.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to avoid moving to the nearest monster's location and the encountering it. If there are no monsters in any street area or location, a monster appears!

situation: A foreign gentleman is examining the farm.
rest: If you have any Exhibit Items or your will is 2 or lower, he shows interest in your presence and introduces himself as Dr. Ali Kafour. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, listen to him share his theories on ancient beliefs and gain 2 Clue tokens.If you do not have and Exhibit Items or you Wll is more than 2, nothing happens.

situation: A foul wind tears through the great stone monoliths.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check. If you fail, choose 1 item to discard as the wind carries it off into the darkness.

situation: A foul-smelling ichor covers the ground.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina as the odor overwhelms you.

situation: A friendly looking man catches sight of you and asks if you're doing okay. He recommends borrowing his sketchbook and
rest: drawing what's bothering you. If your current Sanity is 2 or less, gain 2 Sanity. The man seems quite alarmed at the things you draw.

situation: A gate and a monster appear!
A gate opens suddenly and pulls you into a strange landscape. Move immediately to Y'ha-nthlei and have
rest: an encounter there.

situation: A ghastly monster appears!
A ghostly ship captain offers you passage home, for a price. Return to Arkham, but you are
rest: Cursed.

situation: A glass display case holds various trophies and certificates earned by students over the years. You notice one of the certificates is covered in text written in an ancient language.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to translate. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: A glass orb in this chamber contains a swirling fog. As you handle the sphere, the misty shroud parts to divulge what seems to be the future.
rest: Draw the top five cards from the Mythos deck and put them back on top of the deck in any order you desire.

situation: A gleam of metal
rest: draws your attention to the fireplace, which suddenly ignites! You may attempt a Speed (-3) check to pull an item from the fire before it is destroyed. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you attempt it and fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A glimmer of gold catches your eye.
rest: Gain $2.

situation: A glimpse of home gives you hope.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: A glimpse of something shining in the sun catches your eye. A golden brooch has been left behind here.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: A golden tiara on display is covered in bizarre and unnatural engravings.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: A gorgeous youth invites you into a meditation chamber. If you go in, you must
rest: lose a total of 4 Spells or Stamina, divided up as you choose, but you may search the Exhibit Item deck for the Mask of the Three Fates card and take it. If it is not there, gain 4 Clue tokens instead. If you do not go in, the young witch casts a hex to make others mistrust you. Place a Patrol marker on the street area of French Hill.

situation: A graduate student explains that this is a stable gateway to another world. Theoretically. There are some kinks to work out still, of course. If you go through the gate,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, move to the Other World of your choice. If you fail, move to the Woods and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: A group of boys play baseball on the public diamond, shouting and laughing. You stop to watch for a while, and find yourself both refreshed and heartened.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: A group of chanting voices echoes across the hillside.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to discern what they're saying. If you pass, gain 1 Spell

situation: A group of concerned citizens have come to harangue the proprietor and customers of the Magic Shoppe. You can calm them down
rest: with a Will (-2) check. If you succeed, empty the Outskirts returning all monsters in it to the cup. If you fail, the terror level is increased by 1.

situation: A group of cultists scampers through the night. If you follow them,
rest: make a Sneak (+0) check to watch where they bury their prize. If you pass, you may draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item. If you fail, they turn and smile: a monster surprises you from behind!

situation: A group of fishermen are staring at the water looking worried. "Not safe to be on Falcon Point tonight."
rest: Move to the streets.

situation: A group of women are collecting charitable donations on behalf of orphans and widows. If you contribute $3,
rest: regain 1 Sanity as they thank you profusely.

situation: A group of young local men standing by the shooting gallery challenge you to a contest to see who's the best shot. If you accept the challenge,
rest: pay $2 and then make a Fight (+0) check. For each success, gain $1.

situation: A guest lecturer provides a lengthy but informative presentation about his explorations of ancient sites. You may
rest: make a Lore (-1) check and stay here next turn. If you pass, gain 1 Skill.

situation: A haunting, beautiful melody
rest: draws you to the misty sea cliffs. It seems to be coming from out to sea, and it pulls at you with unrelenting pressure. Pass a Will (-1) check or roll a die and lose that much Stamina as you leap from the cliff before you come to your senses.

situation: A hideous monster appears!
A horrendous monster appears!
A horrible Monster appears!
A horrible monster appears!
A horrible scene captures your gaze. Creatures that mortals would call angels and devils cavort together, their bodies and laughter mingling in an unholy fusion. If you join their dance,
rest: take both the Tainted card and the Anointed card.

situation: A horrible shadow falls across you.
rest: Roll a die. On a 1, either lose 5 Clue tokens or you are devoured.

situation: A horrible visage captures your gaze.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check to look away or lose 1 Stamina and stay here next turn.

situation: A horrid monster appears!
A horrific stench
rest: draws your attention to the body of some bizarre marine creature, rotting on the edge of the docks. As you move towards it, an uneasy feeling grows in the pit of your stomach, as though you are meddling with something best left alone. Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. In either event, if you are not reduced to 0 Sanity, you find something clutched in its webbed hands. Draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: A horrifying monster appears!
A hot, sickly wind is blowing across the farmyard. You feel something seeping into your pores.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: A hypnotist selects you to be the volunteer for his show. He quickly puts you into a trance. When you awake, the audience is laughing uproarously, but you don't care. Your mind feels much more calm.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: A jar on the counter bears a sign proclaiming, "Guess how many marbles are in the jar and win a prize! $1 entry fee." If you want, you may
rest: pay $1 to make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you gain $5. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: A kindly fisherman offers you a ride to any aquatic location, where you have
rest: an encounter.

situation: A lab fire breaks out and the students are trapped inside! If you force your way in and save them,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, you rescue the students and one of the rewards you with a family heirloom. Draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: A large branch is floating slowly downstream. You can see some object caught in its limbs. If you wish, you may
rest: make a Speed (-1) check to grab the object as it passes the bridge. If you pass, gain a Unique Item. If you fail, you fall into the water and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A large cavernous entrance into the citadel is masked in shadow. But you gaze too long and see something gargantuan beginning to exit.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, draw a Madness card.

situation: A large dog lopes alongside you for a time, warding you from harm.
rest: No encounter.

situation: A large mirror stands before you. Your reflection bears an unfamiliar mark upon its forehead.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, the mark fades from the reflection. If you fail, it remains and you are Cursed.

situation: A large painting of historic Arkham hangs in the bank lobby. Examining it, you notice an unnerving circle of stones barely visible on the edge of the city.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A large stone disc is on display which bears ancient pictograms. As you examine it, the room seems to fill with whispering voices.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to resist being overcome by its power or you are lost in time and space.

situation: A little old lady stands in front of you in line counting out a bag of pennies to deposit.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A load of cargo, precariously balanced on the edge of the dock, goes into the river with a splash. If you dive in and try to retrieve it, a monster appears, and
rest: you suffer a -1 to your Combat checks. If you evade or defeat the monster, you may draw 2 Common Items.

situation: A local artist has just been commissioned to create work for a gallery in Boston. Overjoyed, he is
rest: spending money on anything he can find. You may choose 1 Common Item or Unique Item to discard in exchange for $2 greater than its list price.

situation: A local fisherman has left his boat just for a second.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to sneak aboard and pilot yourself to the aquatic location of your choice and have an encounter there.

situation: A locked cabinet seems to hold several antique, water-damaged texts.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to pick the lock. If you pass, search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: A loud roaring noise emanates from a laboratory. Rushing to investigate, you see a swirling vortex collapsing in on itself, giving you a quick glimpse of the worlds beyond.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. Whether you succeed or not, if you are not driven insane, gain 1 Unique Item that the spiralling anomaly transports into the room.

situation: A lovely young woman stumbles into you as you're searching for the library. "Pardon me," she says, "my name is Constance Hawberk. Have you seen my father?"
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to point her in the right direction. In return, she points you to the library and you gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A lurking monster appears!
A man approaches you with a business proposition. "The Bank won't give me any money, but I know I can make us a fortune!" If you're interested in investing, give him $5 and
rest: take a Retainer card.

situation: A man attacks Father Michael as he tends to the grounds!
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to drive the man off. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: A man dressed as a ringmaster approaches you and introduces himself as Darke. "Would you like to see some magic?" He shows you a few card and coin tricks and then offers to teach you a better trick.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: A man in a coat and hat takes your arm, and you find yourself leading the shadowy presence forward. All the reward you seem to need is his reassurance... perhaps you are being mystically controlled, but it's hard to care.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity, but take the Local Guide card.

situation: A man introduces himself as Tucker Jones and asks after your health.
rest: If you currently have 2 or less Stamina, he offers to help. Gain 2 Stamina. Otherwise, he talks to you about local history and you gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A man is being thrown violently by an unseen force. If you help,
rest: lose 3 Stamina as you suffer the same fate. Even if you are knocked unconscious, the man, David Packard, remembers your bravery. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, he offers you something to finish that thing off once and for all." You may search the Common Item deck for Dynamite and take it.

situation: A man is running up the hill, trying to escape vicious creatures that are attacking him. You may attempt to defend him if you wish. If you do,
rest: lose 3 Stamina. Even if you are knocked unconscious, the man, David Packard, owes you his life and intends to pay his debt. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, he gives you something "for protection." You may search the Common Item deck for Dynamite and take it.

situation: A man leaves his purchase on the counter. You grab it and follow him out the door, but he's nowhere to be seen.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: A man motions you over and points to a chalk outline in the atrium of the old house. He directs your attention to a trail of what seems to be green blood.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to offer useful assistance; if you do, take Thomas F. Malone's Ally card, or, if it is not available, take 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A man sets down a briefcase, muttering furtively. "Have you seen the yellow sign?"
rest: Pass a Lore (-3) check to draw the yellow sign in a pool of beer on the counter, at which he nods and leaves the briefcase. Search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find, and gain $10!

situation: A man wearing dirty and tattered clothing is loitering outside the bank. He offers to sell you his last possession to get some food money for him and his family. If you accept,
rest: pay $2 and make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, draw 1 Common Item.

situation: A man wearing exotic robes and a strange hat sits in a shaded clearing, seemingly in a trance. As you approach, he says, "Come sit with me," without looking at you. If you are
rest: Cursed or have any Mask items, he tells you that he is called The Messenger and is meant to aid you. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, gain 2 Clue Tokens.

situation: A man wearing exotic robes and a strange hat tells you that he can see your fate. If you are
rest: Cursed or have any Exhibit Items, he tells you that he is called The Messenger. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you are not Cursed and do not have any Exhibit Items, nothing happens.

situation: A man with a crate checks his watch outside the locked shop as you walk up. Seeing you, he turns. "Do you know anyone who might be interested in these? I just want to be rid of them."
rest: Turn over the top three Unique Item cards. Any players may buy them for their list prices. If players disagree about who may buy what, you decide.

situation: A man with an accordian is playing tunes and everybody is singing along. If you choose to stay late into the evening,
rest: gain 2 Sanity, but lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A massive wave crashes over you and washes one of your items out to sea. Choose 1 of your Common or Unique Items and
rest: discard it. If you have none, nothing happens.

situation: A member of the Lodge leads you into the Inner Sanctum and shows you a ring that can be used to fight against evil. As you slip it on, he directs you to concentrate on a target and try to overpower it with your mind. You may
rest: spend 1 Stamina to make a Will (-1) check. If you succeed, claim any non-spawn monster on the board as a trophy.

situation: A member of the Lodge ushers you into a side room, where he shows you a magic sphere and explains that it will provide answers to your question... if you are lucky.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, take Clue tokens equal to the number of successes you rolled.

situation: A member of the Sheldon Gang with a bottle of moonshine in hand stumbles upon you.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, he's in a good mood and shares his whiskey with you. Gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, he's in an ugly mood and robs you. Lose $4 and move to the street.

situation: A member of the inner circle explains that the Lodge sometimes supports the studies and explorations of the like-minded.
rest: Give any other investigator all of your Clue tokens. You are Blessed.

situation: A message in a bottle from someone trapped on Devil Reef washes up to shore.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A miracle! A boat appears, hailing from the nearby island of Ponape.
rest: Pass a Will (-3) check to convince them to take you back to the normal world. If you pass, immediately return to Arkham.

situation: A monster and a gate appear!
A monster appears and attacks you as you approach the front door!
A monster appears from the darkness!
A monster appears from the shadows!
A monster appears!
rest: across Founder's Rock, and then dissolves as the sun passes behind a bank of clouds. A monster appears!

situation: A monster appears! If you do not defeat it you are
rest: Cursed.

situation: A monster appears, bursting from the ground itself!
A monster appears, intent on your destruction.
A monster appears, leaping out of the shadows at you!
A monster appears, taking shape from the angle's curve!
A monster erupts from the ground and surprises you!
rest: You suffer a -2 to all checks against this monster, but you may discard Spells during this combat as if they were Clue tokens.

situation: A monster from the unmapped reaches appears.
A monster is attacking a huddled figure in the shadows.
rest: If you pass the first Combat check you make against the monster, you may draw a random Ally or Spell.

situation: A monster surprises you! After the battle,
rest: if you passed a Horror Check, draw Spells equal to the monster's Horror damage. If you failed a Horror check, you emerge with resolve: You may search the Skill deck for the Bravery card and take it.

situation: A muffled cry and some thumping comes from a nearby closet.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to open it and rescue whoever is inside, drawing a random Ally. If you fail, whatever trapped him attacks you too: A monster appears.

situation: A mugger emerges from out back, and sees you just as you see him. "Keep it quiet and we'll split the proceeds," he says, holding out a wallet. Either accept the stolen money and
rest: gain $3, or shout for the police and allow karma to reward you with 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina instead.

situation: A mutated monster appears!
rest: You suffer an extra -1 penalty on any Combat checks against it.

situation: A mysterious stranger visits one of the tenants in the middle of the night. In the morning, he finds he can no longer speak. You can see the fear in his eyes as he
rest: draws you a map of the places he's been. Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you don't understand, but the man's panic causes you to lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A mysterious woman warns you that you would be able to see all that you need to know if your mind were not clouded by the unnatural.
rest: Discard 2 Spells to gain 5 Clue tokens. If you can't or choose not to, gain 1 Sanity.

situation: A nervous-looking man is moving quickly through the crowd, with Sheriff Engle in pursuit. The anxious man bumps into you, falls to the ground, and drops a package.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to grab the package and escape before the sheriff arrives. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: A newly ordained member of the Lodge should be seen but not heard.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, the stern glares of the higher-ranking members at least give you motivation: You may search the Spell deck for the Stealth card and take it.

situation: A nightgaunt drops some hapless person from the darkness above. The victim did not survive the impact but he seems to be holding a book.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find. If you fail, search the Common Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: A nightmarish monster appears!
A pack of ghasts chase after you. Climb up to the sunlight as fast as you can!
rest: Make a Speed (+1) check. If you fail, gain an Injury card from their ferocious attack.

situation: A pack of ghouls are feasting on carrion. It is a truly repugnant sight to behold.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A package wrapped in brown paper sits on a table. Your name is written on the package. If you choose to open it,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, search the Unique Item deck for the first Tome you find and keep it. If you fail, the package was a trap. You are Cursed.

situation: A painter who specializes in calm landscapes has his works for sale on the sidewalk. You suddenly see someone stealing one of his paintings.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to catch the thief. If you pass, the artist offers you a small painting as gratitude. Althought not valuable, you treasure the painting for its purity and simplicity. You are Blessed.

situation: A pair of friendly picnickers share their lunch with you.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: A pale, ordinary man stares out the window at the peak of the Kingsport Head as if longing for something.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check or discard Lucky Cigarette Case to spark his interest in you and his surroundings. If so, he introduces himself as Thomas Olney. Take his Ally card, or if it's not available, remove 1 doom token from the Ancient One's doom track.

situation: A panicked man with sores all over him bumps into you as he rushes in the door.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to quickly wash your hands and face before you become infected. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A particularly ancient and tattered text provides vital information.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. Regardless of the result, lose 1 Stamina as the mold infiltrates your lungs.

situation: A particularly old sailor takes great delight in teaching you old seafaring superstitions.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, one of his tricks is much more effective than you would have imagined. Gain 1 Spell.

situation: A past-life believer offers to channel the spirits of the ancients. You may join in and
rest: make a Will (+0) check to draw Spells until you draw one with a Sanity cost of 0; keep that Spell and discard the rest. Alternatively, you may watch her technique, and make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you may take the Psychic card.

situation: A patient appears to be choking on something. But then, horribly, a swarm of locusts vomits forth from his mouth! If you flee,
rest: move to the street. If you stay to try to help him, the locusts burrow into your body. Lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity, but you may search the Spell deck for a Plague of Locusts spell and take it.

situation: A patient becomes irrationally possessive over one of your belongings.
rest: Make a Fight (-3) check. If you fail choose 1 Common Item or Unique Item and discard it.

situation: A pen and paper rest on a table next to your chair. Picking up the pen, you black out for an uncertain amount of time. When you regain your senses, the paper is covered with strange messages, not written in your handwriting.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. Then, whether you pass or not, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A pickpocket grabs your money and runs.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to grab and regain not only your money, but other stolen cash as well. Gain $3. If you fail, discard all your money.

situation: A piece of driftwood conceals a book washed onto the beach by the tide. Oddly enough, the book does not seem to be wet. As you flip through the pages, the words burn themselves into your mind.
rest: Draw a Spell and immediately lose Sanity equal to its Sanity cost. If you are not drive insane, keep the Spell.

situation: A pile of rocks seem too neatly stacked, as if done so by a human.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass you manage to unbury a hidden collection of strange golden jewels. Gain $3.

situation: A police car is abandoned here.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to pry open the trunk. If you pass, search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A polished mirror of some submarine material leans against the wall here. You gaze into it and
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the distorted world you see within grants you 1 Clue token. If you fail, draw one Innsmouth Look card as an awful truth becomes evident.

situation: A poorly shelved collection of books falls on you.
rest: Make a Speed (+1) check or lose 1 Stamina. Regardless of your success or failure, a book lands open on the floor to a strange passage. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: A porter drops what looks like an ancient relic on the tracks. If you want to try and grab it,
rest: make a Speed (-3) check. If you pass, you may draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you are reduced to 0 Stamina by the oncoming train.

situation: A portrait half obscured behind a bookshelf catches your eye. There's something strange about it, but you're in no mood to move the shelf. On the other hand, you'd be a fool to ignore the gnawing feeling that the pattern-- which you can just barely make out-- might be important.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you succeed, search the Unique Items deck for an Elder Sign.

situation: A portrait of one of Arkham's founding fathers hangs in Ma's sitting room. On the back of the painting is a series of symbols and numbers.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to interpret their meaning and gain a Clue token for each success.

situation: A powerful force is attempting to tear its way through the realities!
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check to slow it down. If you pass, remove 1 Dunwich Horror token from the board.

situation: A powerful wind scours away your memories, good and bad.
rest: Discard all of the following: Blessing, Curse, Detriment cards, and Benefit cards.

situation: A priest from the Esoteric Order of Dagon is here, blessing the equipment and the workers. He doesn't realize you're in the room as well. You are
rest: Blessed but Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: A priest from the Esoteric Order of Dagon is here, picking through a collection of strange foreign jewelry. The conspiracy begins to take shape in your mind...
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, and then pass a Sneak (-2) check to move to the street.

situation: A priest kneels at the gravestone of one Walter Gilman. Hearing you approach, he rises up out of his prayer and brushes off his knees. "A shame, a perfect shame." If you are
rest: Cursed or either your Stamina or Sanity is 2 or lower, he introduces himself as Father Iwanicki, and says "And yet, perhaps the good Lord led you here so I could save you, whereas I could not save him." Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, you may search the Unique Item deck for the Holy Water card and take it.

situation: A priest stands at the front door, hoping to offer spiritual help to those within. If you are
rest: Cursed or either your Stamina or Sanity is 2 or lower, he introduces himself as Father Iwanicki. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, you may search the Unique Item deck for the Holy Water card and take it.

situation: A professor of the occult asks you to hold a hideous statue that he believes to have strange powers while he reads a scroll. Energy shoots through your body.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, your spirit rises from your body and you feel that you have the power to switch bodies with another investigator. You may choose another investigator from the pile of unused investigators and bring it into play as a new character, discarding your current investigator (along with all of his items, skills, trophies, etc.). If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: A professor of the occult pays you to post signs throughout the campus that he claims will ward off danger. However, the signs carry their own danger
rest: Gain $4, but pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: A professor takes an interest in your presence and beckons for you to follow him. In a back room, he explains that he can provide you with knowledge that may be of use to you, although his experimental teaching method may cause other things to be unlearned. You may
rest: discard a Skill to draw a new Skill and take 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A professor with wild, bushy hair invites you to do the honors! He hurries out of the room and yells for you to pull the lever on his enormous, whirring machine.
rest: You may move any open gate from its current location to the unstable location of your choice.

situation: A protestor was arrested outside a performance of "The King in Yellow," and his ranting can be heard from the cells.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain a Clue Token.

situation: A pulsing void gapes behind a bookshelf, sending out waves of heat.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or it sucks you in, hurling you into the Abyss. Have one encounter there, then immediately return. A sale takes place. All players may participate. Turn over the top 3 Common Item cards and the top Unique Item card. Any player may buy one or more of these cards for their list price. If there is a disagreement over who gets to buy a certain card, you decide. Any items not sold are discarded.

situation: A pungent odor is emanating from the filthy jail cells.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A regular needs funds to get out of town, fast. He offers to sell you whatever is in his trunk.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check to convince him to show you his best goods. If you pass, draw a number of Common Items equal to the number of successes you rolled, and purchase any that you wish for their list price. Discard the rest.

situation: A repellent, tar-like appendage is dragging an item of interest quickly through the halls.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check. If you pass, draw 2 Unique Items and keep 1. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina as you are dragged across the floor.

situation: A reporter from the Arkham Advertiser offers you money to plant a dead scarab beetle in your soup bowl so he can get a story. If you do so,
rest: gain $3 but place a Patrol marker on the street area of Easttown.

situation: A reporter has disappeared, leaving only cryptic and ominous notes about the story she was investigating. If you can make any sense of them, the editor would gladly pay you.
rest: Make a Lore (-3) check. If you pass, gain $2 and 1 Clue token.

situation: A reporter staying at Ma's announces that he will pay handsomely for tales of the macabre. Take $1 for every elder sign token on the board as you relate your exploits.
A reporter will pay you handsomely, whether in money or information, for an exposé on the life of a monster hunter.
rest: Discard any number of monster trophies to gain $1 or 2 Clue tokens (in any combination) (errata: should be $2 or 1 Clue token) for each point of toughness worth of monsters discarded.

situation: A representative of the society is visiting a historic Arkham home to pick up old photos of the neighborhoods and invites you to tag along. If you accept,
rest: move to the Unnamable and draw 2 cards, encountering one card of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: A retired actor, once the favorite of European theater, gestures to you. "Take this, my young friend," he says. "You'll need it against what's coming." He hands you a collection of news articles regarding the run of "The King in Yellow" in Paris.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to sense an arcane pattern to them and draw a Spell. If you fail, you must discard 2 Clue tokens, if able.

situation: A revolting monster appears!
A ripple in the air passes over you.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or lose 1 Spell of your choice as it is burned from your mind.

situation: A rock slide has made this route unusable. Another path up the hill will have to be found.
rest: You are delayed while you find the new path.

situation: A row of vaguely humanoid sculptures lines your path. As you walk past them, you cannot help but think that some malevolent force is watching you through their stone eyes.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A rowdy dock hand doesn't like the looks of you and challenges you to a fistfight.
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check. If you pass, lose 1 Stamina, but you may search the Skill deck for the Fight card and take it. If you fail, the dock workers spit on you, and you run off. Lose 2 Stamina and place a Patrol marker on the street area of the Merchant District.

situation: A rowdy dock hand doesn't like the looks of you, and challenges you to a fistfight.
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check. If you pass, lose 1 Stamina, but you may search the Skill deck for the Fight card and take it. If you fail, the dock workers spit on you and you run off. Lose 2 Stamina and you are Barred from the Merchant District.

situation: A sale takes place.
rest: s behind a bookshelf, sending out waves of heat. Pass a Fight (-1) check or it sucks you in, hurling you into the Abyss. Have one encounter there, then immediately return. A sale takes place. All players may participate. Turn over the top 3 Common Item cards and the top Unique Item card. Any player may buy one or more of these cards for their list price. If there is a disagreement over who gets to buy a certain card, you decide. Any items not sold are discarded.

situation: A scrap of paper flutters into your hands, with the words, "this world was inhabited at one time by another race who, in practicing black magic, lost their foothold and were expelled from the allegorical garden..."
rest: Lose up to 2 Clue tokens due to this misleading information, if able.

situation: A seemingly-sane inmate is willing to pay you to help him escape. If you agree to help, you may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check. If you succeed, gain $3. If you fail, you are arrested.

situation: A series of primitive murals on the wall tell the story of an underwater city and the fish-like creatures that dwell there. The sight of them makes you very uneasy.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A shadow falls across you from no apparent source and you shiver with more than just cold.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: A shambling heap clambers from the river and engulfs you. If you
rest: pass a Fight (-2) check, you find a Common Item in the aftermath. Otherwise, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A sheaf of papers with hieroglyphics translations blows past you on the wind.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you fail, a young lady runs past you after them. If you pass, you catch them and are thanked profusely by Sarah Danforth, an archaeology student from Miskatonic. Take her Ally card. If it is not available, gain 1 Clue token instead as she chats with you about the visiting museum exhibit.

situation: A sickly monster appears.
rest: You receive an extra +1 bonus on any Combat check against it.

situation: A silent man brushes past you on the trail. Your arm goes numb with cold from the brief contact, and you whirl around to look at him, but he has disappeared.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina and pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity as well.

situation: A silver-tongued young painter tries to sell you one of his paintings.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose $3, if able. If you fail the check and have less than $3, he sells you the painting for whatever you have. Lose all your money.

situation: A slimy monster appears!

A sly, smiling man challenges you to a game of billiards. Incensed by his insulting manner, you accept. You bet either $2 or an item of your choice. Unfortunately, he turns out to be a pool shark and cleans you out. You
rest: lose your bet

situation: A small black plant grows here, where no other vegetation survives. Something about its smell compels you to eat one of its small red berries.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A small child has gotten separated from his mother. If you wish to help,
rest: you are delayed as you search for the woman. If you do so, her heartfelt relief and gratitude makes you feel better about the world and you regain 2 Sanity.

situation: A small collection of symbols was carved into the rock some untold number of years ago.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to interpret them. If you pass, you understand their occult significance and gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A small crowd is gathered around a patchwork tent. Inside, a brightly dressed clown encourages the suckers to try their luck. You step forward to get a better look at the weird scars beneath his face paint, and suddenly you find yourself with a coin in your hand, trying to land it on one of the arcane symbols painted on a low table within the tent.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as the coin lands on the yellow sign. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity as it lands on an elder sign.

situation: A smiling man greets you warmly. "It's nice to see you again!" You believe he has you mistaken for someone else, but he responds, "Nonsense! I've been meaning to return this to you." He hands you a package and leaves.
rest: Gain 1 Common Item.

situation: A squat little creature offers to serve as your guide.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) Lost in time and space 1) Move to the Abyss 2) Move to the Plateau of Leng 3+) Return to Arkham

situation: A staff photographer pulls you aside and offers to sell you some pictures he took that the paper won't publish.
rest: Spend $3 to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A stage magician is being heckled by someone who doesn't believe in magic.
rest: If you have at least 1 Spell, you may make a Lore (-1) check to prove him worng. If you pass the check, the stage magician gratefully offers you a strange curio after his show. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: A steamer ship looms out of the fog. If you jump on board, return to Arkham on the gate you entered and
rest: place an explored marker on it. Then make a Luck (-3) check. If you fail, they end up being pirates, and you lose all of your money and items.

situation: A store is selling a painting that depicts you in the way you are currently dressed, but in a completely different time period.
rest: Move to the first area of Another Time, have an encounter there and return here immediately.

situation: A storm strikes in the midst of rehearsals, and the actors flee for cover, leaving some of their props behind.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to realize that one of the props is real, and draw a Unique Item.

situation: A strange being pays you a visit, and test you.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. If you pass, you gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: A strange cloaked man comes into the store and buys some things, paying with weathered old gold coins. Asking the shopkeeper about them, you learn some things about the weird goings-on in town.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A strange creature stares at you with burning eyes. It is as if its gaze were stealing your soul.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or roll a die and subtract 2 from it (minimum 0), then lose that much Stamina and Sanity.

situation: A strange euphoria begins to overtake you. You are irrationally certain things will be okay.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity. Then make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, overconfidence leads you astray and you are delayed.

situation: A strange idol looms over the trail. Is it staring at you?
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, it was your imagination. If you fail, it's a monster, and it attacks!

situation: A strange little man speaks to you for a time, and after he leaves, you find yourself pondering his words.
rest: Roll 4 dice, gaining a Clue token for each success you roll, but losing 1 Sanity for each failure.

situation: A strange man in a turban tells you, "In Dylath-Leen, they will exchange anything for a ruby such as this." If you take the ruby,
rest: search the Unique Item deck for a card of your choice, but then you lose 3 Sanity and are Cursed.

situation: A strange man roams the aisles looking desperately for something, muttering to himself.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check, or he catches you watching him and attacks! Pass a Fight (+0) check to fend him off, or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A strange maze-like symbol has been carved in the wall. Do you dare to follow it with your eyes? If so,
rest: pass a Will (+0) check to gain a Clue token. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A strange rash has appeared on your skin, and you've developed a harsh, rattling cough.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A strange series of glyphs lines the walls. If you try to interpret them,
rest: make a Lore (-1) check and gain a Clue token for each success. If you don't roll any successes, you are Cursed.

situation: A strange serpent-face person in a hooded robe speaks at you in an ancient tongue.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to decipher his words and gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, he bites you, disgusted, and leaves. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A strange song conjures up images of a life you could have lived.
rest: Gain Clue tokens equal to your focus.

situation: A strange sound echoes through the halls. It may be praying or chanting. No one else seems to hear it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A strangely dressed man accuses you of trying to steal his book.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you succeed, you can take his book away. Take the first Tome in the Unique Item deck. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: A strangely-dressed man claiming to be a doctor offers to trade valuable information for an item he purports to need. You may
rest: discard any item that is not a Weapon and then gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: A stranger approaches and struggles to explain the nature of the creature inside the house.
rest: Pass a Lore (+0) check to understand his words and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A stranger buys you a drink.
rest: You may search the Common Item deck for a Whiskey card and take it.

situation: A stranger in a turban steps off the Boston local train with a crazed look on his face.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the man pulls a strange object from beneath his cloak and gives it to you. Draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, he pulls a poisoned blade out of his cloak and stabs you. Roll a die and lose that much Stamina.

situation: A student is angrily complaining about his research being called "too radical". He needs funds badly and would be willing to sell you his work. You may
rest: pay $5 to draw 1 Spell.

situation: A student mistakes you for the bursar. If you want to carry on the deception,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, gain $8 in ill-gotten tuition money. If you fail, you're arrested and taken to the Police Station.

situation: A student presents a detailed report on the history of the Dark Pharaoh.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you learn a great deal questioning her. Gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as she describes what it was like to live under the Pharaoh's reign.

situation: A subterranean monster appears!
A sudden clearing reveals a prehistoric circle of carved stones. Standing here, your thoughts are filled with the angry and fearful voices of those who perished or were taken to other worlds here.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: A suitcase that doesn't belong to you is underneath your bed.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, the case is filled with old, blood-stained clothes. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A surprising number of society's elite have checked in lately, and they need assistants to represent their interests during their "time abroad."
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to gain a Retainer card.

situation: A tall set of shelves containing hardware suddenly tips over!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: A tall tower seems to stretch up forever. A cool breeze from above makes you think it might lead back to the surface, but the stairs up are coated in slime.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to carefully make the long climb. If you pass, there's a boat not far from where you reach the surface. Move to any aquatic location and have an encounter there. If you fail, you slip and lose 2 Stamina as you fall down the steps.

situation: A tapestry in the corridor catches your eye as the patterns in its weave appear to shift; you think it may be possible to reach into the hanging. If you choose to try,
