rest: roll four dice. If you roll any failures, you are devoured as the patterns come alive. If you roll four successes, take a Doom token from the Doom track and place it on an unstable location of your choice as an Elder Sign token.

situation: A teller you've never seen before insists she just saw you come in and make a deposit the day before. She proves it by showing you your signature.
rest: Gain $5, but lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A terrible monster appears!
A terrible storm strikes the ship which carries you.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: A terrified young man staggers into the church seeking sanctuary. He tries to explain what has traumatized him, but it is difficult to interpret his ravings.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A terrified young student from Miskatonic University seems to have wound up here by accident.
rest: Make a Will (+1) check to keep him calm enough to safely guide him back to more familiar streets. If you pass, he gratefully offers you $2 for your assistance.

situation: A terrifying monster appears!
A terrifying storm rolls in just as you reach the lighthouse. Basil Elton, the lighthouse keeper, asks for your help keeping the beacon lit. If you accept,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, the light stays lit throughout the storm, and you are Blessed. If you fail or refuse to help, the light goes out and there is a terrible shipwreck. Many lives are lost and the terror level increases by 1.

situation: A thick mist comes rolling down the hill and envelops the entire construction site.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you fail, you take a spill down the hillside. Lose 1 Stamina and move to the Causeway.

situation: A thick mist is coming off the Lake of Hali, and as you try to navigate through it, you find yourself suddenly walking through the door of a house. Have
rest: an encounter at the Strange High House in the Mist (or use the location's ability, if able) and immediately return here.

situation: A thick pollen is infecting the air. You need to keep moving or you're going to pass out from breathing it in.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or you are delayed here.

situation: A thief attempts to rob you.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+0) check to notice him. If you fail, lose half your items (your choice) and half your money (rounded up).

situation: A tree, covered in blood and waving in the wind, stands before you. If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, it is just a tree. If you fail, it attacks you! Lose 1 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: A tremendous wind storm struck last night and all kinds of debris has blown here from Sentinel Hill. You may
rest: stay here next turn to search through it. If you do, make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: A truck driver at the bar has a flat tire and needs help changing it. If you
rest: pass a Fight (-1) check, you help him out and he offers you some of his cargo for free. Search the Common Item deck for your choice of a Lantern, Map of Arkham, or Dark Cloak, and take that card.

situation: A truck has stalled, blocking the narrow path leading away from the construction site.
rest: You are delayed while it gets moved.

situation: A truck is rolling down the hill out of control!
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to avoid being hit. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: A useful weapon sits here in the center of a pentagram.
rest: Search the Unique Item deck and look at the first Weapon you find. You may either keep it and be Cursed or discard it and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A vast stirring rumbles through the plateau.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+0) check or roll a die and lose that much Stamina.

situation: A very wise old man sits in a temple offering useful but cryptic advice.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain a Clue token for each success.

situation: A visiting scholar, Dr. Ali Kafour, gives a lecture on the preparatory procedures used to create mummies. If you watch the brain removal demonstration,
rest: make a Will (+0) check. For each success you roll, you may gain 1 Clue token; for every clue token you choose to gain, however, you must discard 1 Sanity.

situation: A voice - perhaps the house itself - begins whispering to you.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. Gain 1 Clue token for each success, but lose either 1 Stamina or 1 Sanity if you fail.

situation: A voice on the other side of a locked door sounds familiar. It seems like someone from your childhood, maybe a teacher or a friend of your parents. The voice calls out your name and promises you a slow, painful death.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: A vortex sweeps you off your feet and into oblivion.
rest: Pass a Fight (+0) check or you are lost in space and time.

situation: A wealth of experience can be
rest: gained by talking with these old-timers. You may stay here next turn to make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Skill.

situation: A wealthy foreigner steps off the train and mistakes you for his guide, handing you his baggage.
rest: Draw 1 Exhibit Item, 1 Unique Item, and 1 Common Item. Keep one of them and discard the rest. You must also take the Local Guide card.

situation: A weary old man holds out a stack of paper and says "It's a memoir of my travels along the Nile, but I doubt the world will last long enough for it to be published." If you wish to read it, remain here next turn and
rest: make a Will (+0) check. You may draw cards from the Skill deck equal to your number of successes, and may keep one of them.

situation: A weathered man comes up to you as you approach the Gardners' house. Introducing himself as Ammi Pierce, he tells you that it might be wise to steer clear of the house right now, and asks if you might have anything that might help the family's strange affliction. If you
rest: discard 1 Unique Item, Ammi joins you in gratitude. Take his Ally card if it's available. If it is not, remove 1 Dunwich Horror token from the board.

situation: A weathered man comes up to you as you approach the Gardners' house. Introducing himself as Ammi Pierce, he tells you that it might be wiser to steer clear of the house right now, and asks if you might have anything that might help the family's strange affliction. If you
rest: discard 1 Unique Item, Ammi joins you in gratitude. Take his Ally card if it's available. If it is not, remove 1 Dunwich Horror token from the board.

situation: A web of light surrounds the object on the pedestal. You may
rest: draw a Unique Item, but if you do, every other investigator loses 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: A well-dressed Egyptian man is visiting Basil Elton.
rest: If you have any Exhibit Items or your Will is 2 or lower, he takes an interest in your story as well. He introduces himself as Dr. Ali Kafour. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, listen to him discuss journeys into the underworld as described in assorted cultures. Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: A well-dressed gentleman approaches a group of children and begins to lead one away... and something tells you that he's up to no good. If you confront him, he transforms, and you are surprised by a monster. If you defeat it,
rest: draw 1 Exhibit Item, but you are Barred from Downtown for assaulting a respected citizen. If you mind your own business, the child is later found dead.

situation: A well-dressed gentleman approaches a group of children and begins to lead one away... and something tells you that he's up to no good. If you confront him, he transforms. A monster appears! Treat this monster as if it had the Ambush special ability. If you defeat it,
rest: draw 1 Exhibit Item, but place a Patrol marker on the street area of Downtown after being seen assaulting a respected citizen.

situation: A well-dressed man is standing on the platform. He turns and greets you by name. Although he seems oddly familiar, you don't remember ever meeting him before. Then he steps off the platform into the path of a speeding train.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, he vanishes as you leap right through him. On the ground, you find yourself clutching a scrap of paper. Gain 1 Spell. If you fail, he is obliterated before your eyes. Roll a die and lose that much Sanity.

situation: A well-dressed man is standing on the reef gazing out at the sea. He tells you that he's heard there's something miraculous under the surface. If you give him
rest: 2 of your Spells (discarding them), he introduces himself as Erich Weiss; take his Ally card if it's available. If it's not available, he shows you a trick instead and you gain 2 Clue tokens

situation: A white-haired professor offers to help you if you can prove the legitimacy of your mission. You may
rest: spend a gate trophy to take Professor Armitage's Ally card, or, if it's not available, draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: A window floats by, looking out on.. can it be Home?
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to return to Arkham.

situation: A window opens, and a strange, gentle man dressed in archaic clothes smiles at you. If you
rest: pass a Will (-2) check or discard Ancient Tome, he introduces himself as William Bain and offers you his help. Take his Ally card. if it isn't available, you are Blessed.

situation: A woman fleeing something runs right into you. As you try to help her up, she blindly attacks you.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to restrain her; if you succeed, take Ruby Standish's Ally card, or draw a Unique Item if it's not available.

situation: A woman is up on the hill with binoculars bird watching. She claims there's been some strange bird behaviors lately.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check to understand what she's explaining. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A woman poses by a window; the dim light revealing the outline of her beautiful figure, but hiding her face. "Will you paint me?" she asks.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you find a painting of the woman where she was standing. It has a Spell scribed on the back. Draw one Spell. If you fail, a monster appears!

situation: A woman stands on the docks waiting for her husband to return, six years after his boat sank. As she tells you her sad tale, she hears her name called out by a familiar voice. Her husband has survived and returned at last! She calls you her lucky charm and Blesses you from the bottom of her heart.
A woman walking down Water St. notices your interest in the house and warns you to stay away from it. She tells you what stories she's heard as you walk along with her.
rest: Move to the streets and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: A workman's wife is expecting a baby! Cigars are being passed around to celebrate and, without even knowing who you are, you are welcomed into the festivities.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: A wounded beast snarls at you, but it can't move. You don't think it's going to live much longer. If you want to wait around,
rest: you are delayed, but you may draw a monster from the cup and take it as a monster trophy, even if it has the Endless ability.

situation: A young man from Falcon Point has been snooping out here, but now finds himself struggling to stay afloat just off the reef.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check to pull him out of the water. If successful, gain 1 Sanity as you drag him to safety. If not, lose 2 Sanity as the man disappears beneath the waves.

situation: A young man is anxiously trying to arrange passage out of the city. Upon questioning him, he admits to horrific and revealing dreams of an impending doom.
rest: Gain 1 Clue Token.

situation: A young painter, who clearly has some talent, is trying to sell his works but looks dejected. When a passerby shows a little interest, you decide to help him make the sale.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to point out the strengths of the work. If you pass, the painter splits the money from the sale with you. Gain $2.

situation: A young student is walking away after receiving no response to her knocking.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to stop her before she disappears. If you pass, you introduce yourself to Sarah Danforth, an archaeology student from Miskatonic. She's been investigating gold coins that came from this house. Take her Ally card. If it is not available, gain 1 Clue token instead as she chats about the museum exhibit in Arkham.

situation: A young woman is examining the contents of a safe deposit box bequethed to her by her late mother. It is an ancient book written in a language she doesn't understand, and she asks you if you recognize the language.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens as you decipher the text.

situation: A young, shy anthropology student trips as she's walking past you, dropping the artifact she is carrying into your hands. She apologizes profusely, adjusting her glasses and keeping her eyes on the floor.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check; if you are a male investigator, it is a Will (+0) check. If you succeed, she is so embarrassed that she dashes off without taking the artifact. You may draw 1 Exhibit Item or Unique Item.

situation: A young, shy history student bumps into you, dropping the package he is carrying. He apologizes profusely, stuttering as he avoids making eye contact.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check; if you are a female investigator, it is a Will (+0) check. If you succeed, he is so flustered that he dashes off without picking up the artifact. You may draw 1 Exhibit Item or Unique Item.

situation: Abigail Foreman drops in for tea with Ma. You are invited to sit in as well. If you accept,
rest: gain 1 Stamina and 1 Clue token, and stay here next turn as you attend the tea party.

situation: Abigail Foreman set aside a book for you, but someone seems to have moved it.
rest: You are delayed while she searches for it. Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: Abruptly, you realize that you don't remember how to get back out of the woods.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: Abundance to the Black Goat of the Woods You must immediately fight Shub-Niggurath!
rest: Since there is only one player in this combat, you need one success to remove a doom token. If you are out of monster trophies, you are devoured. If you defeat Shub-Niggurath, she retreats into the void and you may escape to Arkham immediately. The gate to Yuggoth is sealed behind you, and you may take it as a trophy. If Shub-Niggurath is the Ancient One in play, do not fill up her doom track before this combat; also, successes allow you to temporarily flip over the doom tokens to their elder sign sides instead of removing them. Once the battle is over, regardless of the outcome, flip all of the tokens on Shub-Niggurath's doom track back to their doom token side and continue play.

situation: Accidentally, you find yourself face to face with the altar of Dagon. You are
rest: Cursed.

situation: After a brisk swim in the murky river, you emerge to find yourself covered in brown, bloated leeches. Shuddering in the cold morning air, you begin the laborious task of pulling the squirming, glistening parasites loose one at a time.
rest: Lose 3 points, divided between Sanity and Stamina however you like.

situation: After a long and terrifying night, the sunrise is a welcome sight.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: After a visit with William Bain, he performs a ritual prayer. Shortly thereafter, there is a knock at the door and he opens it to reveal grey, hoary Nodens. You explain recent events to him, and he frowns, fearsomely. Remove
rest: 2 doom tokens from the Ancient One's doom track, but lose 3 Sanity.

situation: After looking in the school records, you begin to feel a malevolent force has begun to follow you.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to shake the feeling. If you fail, take the Harried card if it is available.

situation: After meditating, you are prepared to try dreaming up an object. You may
rest: search either the Common Item or Unique Item deck for an item of your choice. However, after you've selected an item, roll a die and add the result to the item's list price. Lose a number of points of Sanity and/or Stamina equal to the total, divided however you like. If you are reduced to 0 Sanity or Stamina, the strain is too great, and you tear yourself apart. You are devoured.

situation: After seeing some of the objects you have brought with you, William Bain is interested in perhaps trading with you. You may either
rest: discard 1 Common Item to gain 1 Unique Item or discard 1 Unique Item to gain 1 Common Item.

situation: After stumbling over yet another piece of debris in this dry, barren expanse, you begin to notice a pattern in the way that a certain type of jagged black rock is strewn across the field.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: After supper while sitting on the porch you strike up a conversation with another guest: Ryan Dean, a traveling salesman. You may
rest: make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, Ryan has a deal for you. You may draw either 1 Common Item or 1 Unique Item and purchase it at list price. If you fail, stay here next turn listening to bawdy stories and tall tales.

situation: After walking around the house, you become aware of fine bits of a stange metal stuck to your clothes. You can feel the metallic dust emanating a strange energy.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token and then make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, a monster appears.

situation: All cities are but a reflection of Carcosa.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to remember the street's patterns from "The King in Yellow." If you pass, you immediately return to Arkham. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: All of the Asylum's patients begin speaking in the same strange tounge at once.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token as you realize that they're all speaking ancient Sumerian, a language that only a few scholars in the world know!

situation: All things of which humanity dreams are here.
rest: Pass a Luck (+0) check to gain $1 per success rolled. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Alone and far from home you've struggled.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Alone in the darkness with only your thoughts, you make what peace with yourself you can.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Along the shore, the cloud waves break.
rest: Pass a Fight (+1) check to gain 1 Stamina.

situation: Although it is not yet time to close, security seems to be kicking everyone out of the Library.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check or move to the street.

situation: Although you adhere to the belief that hospital food should be avoided, your body demands sustenance.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina and search the Common Item deck for a "Food" card.

situation: Although you believe that you've found a way home, the path looks perilous. You may
rest: roll 3 dice, losing 1 Stamina for each failure you roll. If you are not reduced to 0 Stamina, you may return to Arkham.

situation: Although you can't tell from where, the Hall is filled with the sound of chanting.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Although you try your best, you are unable to hang on any longer. If you are in the second area of this Other World,
rest: move to its first area. If you are in its first area, you are lost in time and space.

situation: Although your journey has been perilous, you've found a possible way to get home.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to return to Arkham.

situation: Ambling up the trail to the lighthouse, you knock on the door, but no one answers. Apparently you're not the only one out enjoying this brisk, clear day. Nothing happens.
Amid skeletons and tattered clothing, you find the logs of several ships from over the last 200 years. If you wish to consult them
rest: you are delayed, but if you do, gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: Among the collection, you see a small carving of a tree with branches that reach out threateningly.
rest: If you have a "One of the Thousand" Cult membership, gain 3 Clue tokens. If you do not have a "One of the Thousand" Cult membership, make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Among the papers in the archive, you discover some signed by Asenath Waite.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Spell. Whether you pass or not, you must then pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: An absentminded orderly hands you a clipboard containing the wrong form. You're about to point out his mistake when he snaps, "I haven't got all day! Are you the next of kin, or aren't you?" You sign the form to defuse his anger, and he hands you a bag containing some deceased soul's personal effects. Among them, you find $4.
An actor from "The King in Yellow" leads a theater course. It's amazing what skills an actor needs to master in order to look like the real thing.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to draw Skill cards equal to the number of successes rolled. Keep one, and discard the rest. If you fail, you learn something you wish you hadn't in the theater exercises, and are Cursed.

situation: An agent from the government is asking questions. The constables are trying to get him to go away.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check. For each success, you may spend 1 Clue token to place it on any space on the Feds Raid Innsmouth track. If you do not roll any successes, you are arrested and put in the Innsmouth Jail.

situation: An alien mind forces its way into your body.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to guess a way to drive it out, gaining 2 Clue tokens in the process, or else stay here next turn, serving as its host body.

situation: An almost-overlooked fragment of text reveals your best course of action.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, plus 1 extra Clue token for each Tome you have.

situation: An ancient woman makes her way slowly down the street, surrounded by chattering younger women who refer to her as Mother Bishop.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, she sees you, then smiles and walks up to you before touching your forehead. Abruptly, you learn something new. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail the check, she walks past without stopping.

situation: An angry, deformed man begins to scream and chase you. Preferring not to make a public scene, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: An archaeology professor shows you an item he recovered in an Egyptian pyramid.
rest: If you have 2 or fewer Spells, it glows in your hands and you find yourself outside, still holding it. Not wanting to confront the professor again, you decide to keep it. Gain 1 Unique Item and move to the street. If you have more than 2 Spells, nothing happens.

situation: An art shop is selling an old engraving that depicts figures engaged in some arcane rite. You recognize it illustrates the use of magic in detail. You may purchase it for $3. If you do,
rest: gain 1 Spell.

situation: An artist has set up his canvas and is preparing to paint. The focus of his piece appears to be an open grave. He remarks that he dislikes its emptiness and asks if you can provide anything to fill the scene. If you
rest: spend five toughness worth of monster trophies, he introduces himself as Richard Upton Pickman. Take his Ally card or draw a Spell if it's not available.

situation: An artist is sketching a woman sitting across from him. You can tell, just by looking as his rendering of her, the two are very much in love.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity from this heartwarming scene.

situation: An artist's address book lies on a table with a list of names: Lizzie Burke, Pinkie McCormick, Tessie. You feel like you know them all, or knew them, and feel a stab of sadness.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, but pass a Will (+0) check or lose 1 Sanity. Ever since you visited the witch house, you keep seeing a strange, rat-like creature out of the corner of you eye...and sometimes it looks like its face is almost human! Gain 1 Clue token, but take the Harried card.

situation: An attendant sees you admiring the sailing memorabilia. He tells you there's a lot more in crates stored downstairs.
rest: Make a Luck (-2 check. If you pass, draw 3 Common Items, choose 1 to keep, and then discard the others. If you fail, you are delayed while you search fruitlessly.

situation: An easel and paints have been left here, abandoned by the artist. Not far away is the still life he was painting.
rest: Draw a card from the Common Item deck. If it is a Weapon, discard it. Otherwise, keep it.

situation: An elderly blind man is running his hand along shelves, searching for a mysterious object. If you help him, he will gratefully offer to purchase something else in the store for you.
rest: Search the Common Item deck for one free item of your choice and be Blessed. Or instead, you can take the mysterious object for yourself. Search the Unique Item deck for one item of your choice to purchase for list price.

situation: An elderly patient asks you to sit and chat with her for a while. If you stay and listen to her,
rest: you are delayed as she talks nostalgically about her childhood and her family. You are then Blessed.

situation: An elderly woman walks up to the porch and strikes up a conversation with you. She tells you that this had been her home during a very difficult time in her life. You
rest: spend the afternoon in nostalgic conversation about Arkham history. Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: An empty rowboat drifts past. Wondering at its missing occupants, you decide that you have to act now. You may
rest: move to Falcon Point and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: An endless bookshelf!
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0-1) Nothing happens. 2) Gain 1 Spell. 3+) Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: An engraved golden disk is wedged among the black rocks.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to recognize the runes carved into it. If you pass, you leave it alone and don't touch it. If you fail, the moment your hand touches it, a jolt of energy parlyses you and you fall into the water. Lose 1 Sanity, move to Y'ha-nthlei, and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: An enigmatic traveler sympathizes with your cause and offers some good advice.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token. Then make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you are Blessed.

situation: An enormous pillar is carved in the image of the Dark Pharaoh. A powerful force is trying to compel you toward it. You may approach the pillar or try to walk away from it. If you approach,
rest: make a Will (-1) check to keep your composure as an ancient intelligence floods your thoughts. If you pass, take the Visions card if it is available. If you fail, discard all of your Clue tokens. If you walk away from the pillar, make a Luck (-1) check and gain 1 Sanity for each success. If you fail, you feel the Pharaoh's presence continue to haunt you. Take the Harried card if it is available.

situation: An enormous stone marker covered with arcane markings stands before you. Its true purpose is unclear, but you think you may be able to translate a small portion.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: An esteemed organist from the Church of St. Barnabe in France has been haunting South Church, disturbing the flock with his otherworldly playing. Father Michael asks you to convince him to leave.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to intimidate him into leaving and gain 2 Sanity. If you fail, he troubles your dreams, and you are reduced to 1 Sanity.

situation: An executive at the Bank of Arkham is also a member and offers to pull a few strings.
rest: You may choose any one player who currently has a Bank Loan and discard it without paying.

situation: An experiment on dogs has gone horribly awry and now a student is willing to pay to get rid of the evidence. If you agree to help,
rest: pass a Sneak (+0) check to gain $3.

situation: An important piece of machinery has broken down and the workers are rushing to get it fixed. In the ensuing confusion, you're able to examine the refinery's ledgers.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: An inmate confides in you that he is actually a reporter, investigating the conditions at the asylum. He fears he will not keep his sanity much longer and begs you to smuggle his notes to Editor Doyle Jeffries.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to receive $3 for your troubles. If not, the nursing staff confiscates the notes and burns them. You must move to the street.

situation: An irate orderly shoves a babbling madman at you, shouting "You deal with him!" before storming off.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to calm him down enough to decipher his ravings and gain 2 Clue tokens. Doctor Mintz has a maniacal gleam in his eye as he approaches. Pass a Fight (-2) check to escape. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and gain 1 Sanity under his new treatment. Doctor Mintz says that one of the patients has been specifically asking for you. The lunatic calmly offers to put you in touch with unearthly power in exchange for information. For each Clue token you spend, you may draw 1 Spell. Choose 1 Spell to keep from among those you draw and discard the others.

situation: An irritable stranger in ragged clothes is demanding money from Velma's diners. If you do not give him $1, he Curses you before Velma throws him out.
An odd, well-dressed man from overseas is examining the exterior of the Order.
rest: If you have any Exhibit Items or your Will is 2 or lower, he tells you it's not safe here and introduces himself as Dr. Ali Kafour. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, listen to him opine about similarities in the legends of island cultures and gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: An offering to the green pyramid, their buzzing voices command, lest you be lost for all time. You may
rest: discard a Unique Item to return to Arkham. Otherwise, you must discard a Common Item, or else become lost in time and space.

situation: An old gypsy man is being attacked by a mysterious robed figure.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to help fend off the assailant. If you pass, the gypsy insists you accept a token of his gratitude. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: An old man is trying to sell trinkets that he's found on the beach.
rest: Draw the top three cards from the Common Item deck. Each costs $2 more than its listed price. You may purchase as many of those three items as you wish and discard the rest.

situation: An old man sitting alone starts choking on his meatloaf.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to slap him on the back and dislodge the food in time. If you succeed, he tearfully thanks you and offers you his fondest possession as a reward. Draw one Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as you watch him pass away.

situation: An old man who looks to be near death gestures you toward his bedside. If you approach, he tries to hand you something as his last breath gurgles out.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, you catch the object; draw 1 Exhibit Item. If you fail, the ancient canopic jar shatters on the ground, and you are Cursed!

situation: An old man with a concertina sings an ancient ballad about creatures coming in the night. Listening carefully to its lyrics, the song's story is both terrifying and revealing.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: An old man with piercing eyes opens the door before you can knock. Meeting your gaze calmly, he says, "It's clear that you need my help, but do you deserve it?" If you
rest: spend 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity, the Terrible Old Man joins you. Take his Ally card, or gain 2 Spells if it's not available.

situation: An old professor from Earth teaches you a thing or two.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to draw 1 Skill.

situation: An old woman has just absentmindedly left the envelope the teller gave her behind. Will you return it to her? You may either
rest: gain $5 or become Blessed.

situation: An old woman leans up against the fence, gasping for air. "Don't mind me, young'un. These lungs are just old and worn out." Still, something deep inside tells you that you can help her out, if you're willing to make a sacrifice. If you
rest: discard 1 Skill, she smiles and says, "I don't know what you did, but I'm in your debt." Granny Orne joins you. Take her Ally card or, if it's not available, draw the top five Unique Items and keep one.

situation: An old-fashioned horse-drawn hearse creaks past on the road, and you just know that something wicked is coming. All Undead monsters in Arkham, the Outskirts, and the Sky
rest: move to this location. You must immediately evade or fight them.

situation: An old-timer sits down next to you and offers to teach you a trick in exchange for a drink. If you agree,
rest: gain 1 Spell for the price of $3.

situation: An older gentleman, calling himself Joshua Place, offers to teach you the art of dowsing. If you accept,
rest: gain 2 Clue tokens and stay here next turn.

situation: An older man named George Corey sees you examining the bridge's dubious construction. "It could use some repairs. The neighbors would be right grateful!" You may
rest: stay here next turn repairing it to gain $3.

situation: An oozing monster appears!
An open window seems particularly inviting. If you climb inside, you discover several sea chests.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to find something useful in them and gain 1 Common Item.

situation: An opulent crown rests on velvet within a safe.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, you see through the illusion and recognize it as a tin toy. If you fail, you become obsessed with becoming the kind and are lost in time and space.

situation: An orderly quickly closes the door to the morgue, but not before you catch a glimpse of what's inside.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token per success.

situation: An ugly young man with a goat-like look to him bars your way across the bridge. "If you know what's good for you, you'll stay out of Dunwich." As his eyes meet yours, there is a sickening lurch and you fall unconscious.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: An unruly gang has descended upon Abner Weems, the local drunk.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to chase them off. If you succeed, Abner gives you the object he took which got him in trouble in the first place. Gain 1 Common Item. If you do not succeed, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: An unshaven, down-on-his-luck painter sits on the street corner, selling some of his possessions to make ends meet.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item. You may buy it for $2, regardless of its list price. If you don't buy the item, discard it.

situation: An unspeakable monster appears!
Anna Kaslow gives you a tarot reading.
rest: Look at the top card of the mythos deck. If it isn't "The Story Continues," then you may choose to discard it to the bottom of the deck. If it is "The Story Continues," return it to the top of the deck.

situation: Another traveller starts up a cheery conversation with you.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Approaching the house, you notice three youngs boys crouching in the bushes by the side of the drive. Questioning them, you get nothing but variations on the rumors you've heard in town: One boy insists the place is haunted, while the other two maintain that Mrs. Gardner is a witch. However, just as you're about to give up in despair, one of them lets slip a detail of great importance to you.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: As Chief Constable Martin asks you "just a few routine questions," you become unnerved by his hoarse voice and unblinking gaze.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As a favor, you volunteer to head to the basement to have a look at the pipes. The steps are mostly rotten and are starting to fall apart under your weight.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to avoid injury. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: As a truck is driving away from the warehouse, you see a crate fall off the back. Unfortuneately, Joey "the Rat" saw it too.
rest: Make a Speed (+1) check to beat him to the crate. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: As far as the eye can see in any direction, the water is churning with large, fish-like creatures.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check to resist a state of pure panic. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens as you watch them head out to see.

situation: As soon as your eyes fall upon that cursed city, you know its name to be Carcosa. Looking down upon its empty streets, you are enlightened.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: As students start leaving town in fear of their safety, the University begins to offer discounts on tuition and services. You may
rest: pay $5 to draw 2 Skills, keeping one and discarding the other.

situation: As the dock workers switch shifts for the night, you notice an ornate money clip at your feet. You pick it up, telling yourself you will use the bills clasped within for the greater good. Take $2, but
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check or become Cursed.

situation: As the light dims on the shore of Lake Hali, you wander the streets of the forgotten city, alone and lost.
rest: Stay here next turn and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As the sun sets beneath the horizon, hundreds of whippoorwills begin to sing in a wild, frenzied chorus that tears at your mind.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As the sun sets, you see your own shadow twist and your thoughts begin to reshape it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As the walking dead unload cargo from a ship with no name, you notice a box of booty forgotten under the gangplank.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, draw one Common Item. If its value is $2 or less, draw an additional Common Item.

situation: As you approach the door to knock, a thin book is pushed out from under it. Obviously, someone wants you to have it.
rest: Take the first Tome from the Common Item deck.

situation: As you approach the house through the thick mist from the ocean, you discover a landscape unlike anything you expected.
rest: Move to the first area of R'lyeh, have an encounter there, and then return here immediately.

situation: As you approach the house, you hear something large and almost serpentine thrashing about inside.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to realize your danger and escape without rousing its ire. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as something huge and unseen bats you away from the Whateley farm.

situation: As you approach the house, you see an object falling down the side of the hill.
rest: make a Speed (-1) check to catch it before it disappears down the slope. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina scrambling across the rocks.

situation: As you approach the old Whateley farm, a man runs up to you. "For God's sake, don't go in there!" He introduces himself as Earl Sawyer, the Whateleys' nearest neighbor. You talk, and he reveals a dangerous plan for dealing with the strange goings-on. If you add
rest: 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board, he joins you. Take his Ally card if it's available. If it is not, draw 1 Spell, 1 Unique Item, and 1 Common Item.

situation: As you are climbing the cliffs in the underworld, your pocket gets caught and tears open.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or lose all your money.

situation: As you are climbing, a rock falls towards you.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and move to the Harborside streets.

situation: As you begin to cross the bridge, some drunken college boys in a Model T come roaring down the road at you.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to race to safety. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina. If you pass, nothing happens.

situation: As you begin to delve into the rare manuscripts, the proprietor of the shop coughs loudly and holds out his hand. You may
rest: pay $5 to search the Spell deck for a Spell.

situation: As you browse the aisles, you notice something not quite right for sale in the butcher's section.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As you brush up against Founder's Rock, a strange lethargy seizes your limbs.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: As you enter a darkened laboratory, a monster appears and attacks you!
As you enter the Department of Alchemy, a professor looks up in horror. He grabs an ancient artifact from a locked
rest: drawer in his desk and holds it up before your face, chanting and making symbolic motions with the item. If you are Cursed, discard the Curse. If you are not Cursed, then you are Blessed.

situation: As you enter the Magick Shoppe, Miriam Beecher doesn't even look up. "Sorry, we're closed right now. I'm performing a cleansing of the store. You'll have to leave."
rest: Move to the street.

situation: As you knock, the door swings open before you. Cautiously entering, you see a number of bottles containing lead pendulums. Gradually, but with increasing violence, the pendulums begin to swing, and voices whisper terrible secrets into your ears.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens, but you are reduced to 1 Sanity.

situation: As you leave the lodge, a green glow surrounds the door frame.
rest: Move to the street. All monsters in the sky immediately go there as well.

situation: As you look out across the waves, you feel strangely compelled to throw yourself into the ocean's watery embrace.
rest: Pass a Will (+1) check or you are Lost in time and space.

situation: As you look out of an upstairs window, you see an unfamiliar cityscape with twin suns setting over strange towers.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, but you must pass a Will (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As you pass by a game of horseshoes, a bad throw sends one straight at you.
rest: Pass a Speed (+0) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: As you pass through the entry arch on Peabody Avenue, all sound dissolves into a cosmic silence.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, the mundane noises of Arkham return. If you fail, you are drawn through the gate nearest this location, and you are Cursed.

situation: As you push through some hanging moss, dozens of black and red spiders fall on your head and neck.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you fail, you are bitten several times, reducing you to 0 Stamina. If you pass, you remain perfectly still until they crawl off, then you find an odd item beneath the moss. Draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: As you read the page, you realize that you have stumbled into a written trap.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or you are Cursed.

situation: As you row along the island's shore, a tree branch cracks and falls toward you.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check. If you fail, you are knocked out and wake up far downstream; move to the Graveyard and you turn ends.

situation: As you sip your drink, suddenly a fight breaks out in the bar!
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to make it to the door before the cops show up. If you fail, you're arrested unless you're the Deputy.

situation: As you sleep, you dream of vast underwater spaces filled with strange, horrific creatures.
rest: Draw one Innsmouth Look card.

situation: As you stand in line for the teller, the bank Vice President motions you over to his office. "We're aware of the good you've done. The Bank of Arkham thanks you." You may
rest: spend 10 toughness worth of monster trophies, 1 gate trophy and 5 toughness worth of monster trophies, or 2 gate trophies to either gain $10 or to discard any investigator's Bank Loan.

situation: As you stare out across the waters, a monster appears!
As you stare up at the unfamiliar sky, you hum a song that your mother used to sing to you, and it helps to hold the madness at bay.
rest: No encounter.

situation: As you start to climb back into your canoe and row to shore, you see a huge, shadowy shape disturb the water near the island. Waves of intense dread grip you, and you must
rest: pass a Will (-1) check or be Cursed.

situation: As you step forward into the store, a man in tattered clothing wordlessly hands you a map with strange notations on it. You may
rest: move to the Black Cave. If so, gain $2.

situation: As you step in front of the teller line, you see that there are two windows open. "Next!" both call out at the same time.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, your are Blessed. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: As you step into the grocery, glass crunches beneath your feet. The lights are out. Advancing cautiously, you find the young manager's corpse behind the counter with a note: "Too many questions."
rest: Move to the street and lose 1 Sanity. First National Grocery is closed for the rest of the game.

situation: As you stroll past a pale, dark haired woman, she mumbles to herself, "Charles, I'm sorry. It was all my fault." Concerned, you take a second look at her and see a young woman consumed with guilt and grief. If you talk to her,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you find out that her name is Corla Fistienne and her ex-boyfriend recently committed suicide. You leave feeling that you've helped alleviate her guilt and prevented her from doing anything stupid. Gain 2 Sanity. If you fail or do not try to talk to her, the terror level increases by 1 when news of her suicide reaches the newspapers the next day.

situation: As you stumble across this inhuman isle, you feel a rumbling beneath your feet. It has begun to sink beneath the waves!
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or you are lost in time and space. If you pass, immediately return to Arkham.

situation: As you trudge down a muddy path, a monster appears! If you kill it, take $5 (and the taxidermist's thanks).

As you trudge through the darkness, your eye catches a strange glint of blue-black. Steeping closer, you can make out a familiar rune engraved in the protruding rock. You place your hand on it and try to remember how to break the ward.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, draw a Spell. If you fail, you are delayed and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: As you try to get your bearings you bump into a gentleman dressed as a musketeer who begins to angrily berate you in French. You get the impression he's challenging you to a duel. If you accept the challenge,
rest: make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, you take the man's weapon as a trophy. Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, gain an Injury card. If you decline the challenge, you are hunted through the streets of Paris. Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you manage to find a safe place to rest and recuperate, restoring your Stamina to full. If you fail, you are discovered and stripped of your belongings. Choose 2 of your items to keep and discard the rest.

situation: As you turn a corner, a leering idol startles you.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or jump back and fall down a steep slope. If you fail, you lose 2 Stamina and are delayed.

situation: As you wait in line to buy something, a swindler with scars on his face and a strange accent gives you a wink, then steps in front of you and begins to distract the shopkeeper. If you leave without paying,
rest: draw 1 Exhibit Item or Unique Item, but you are Cursed.

situation: As you walk down the street, a tomcat rubs himself across your legs. "Hello there, puss. Where did you come from?" If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, you name the cat Foolishness. Take his Ally card or, if it's not available, remove 2 rift tokens from the Kingsport board.

situation: As you walk down the street, you are suddenly overwhelmed by a vision of Kingsport-- not as it is-- but as it was back when mighty sailing ships filled the harbor, and cars had yet to be invented.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: As you walk in the moonlight, you are struck by a curious sight. You are casting two shadows. Looking up, you are stunned to see two moons.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As you walk past a decrepit old house, an ancient but still vigorous man throws open the door and walks purposely up to you. "Take this. Wear it." He roughly presses a small fetish bag into your hands.
rest: Take this card. Instead of losing 1 Stamina, you may put a Clue token on this card. Return this card to the box if it ever has 3 Clue tokens on it.

situation: As you walk past a decrepit old house, an ancient, but still vigorous man throws open the door and walks purposefully up to you. "Take this. Wear it." He roughly presses a small fetish bag into your hands.
rest: Take this card. Instead of losing 1 Stamina, you may put a Clue token on this card. Return this card to the box if it ever has 3 Clue tokens on it.

situation: As you walk through the Dunwich cemetary, you notice a coffin has been unearthed. There is a small crystal window in it that allows you to see the corpse inside. Peering in, your sleeve snags the catch on the coffin and unlatches it. The coffin bursts open and a pungent alcoholic smell makes you stagger as the corpse screams and tries to crawl out of the coffin. After a moment of flailing, it falls over dead, but the shock causes you to
rest: lose 1 Sanity.

situation: As you walk through the halls of St. Mary's, a nurse shoves a wheelchair into your legs, forcing you to sit. She wheels you recklessly through the hospital, informing you frequently that you will be "good as new." Then, stopping abruptly, she tips you out of the chair and to the floor, and speeds off. Unbelievably,
rest: your Stamina is restored to full.

situation: As you wander into the back of the shop, you hear a noise.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or you look up just in time to see a descending club. Everything goes black. When you awaken, you are somewhere else. Draw a mythos card and move to the gate location shown on it, then immediately have an encounter there.

situation: As you're leaving the grocery, you are set upon by a gang of local toughs.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to move safely to the street. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and remain where you are.

situation: Ascending through the great valley, mountainous effigies portend even less knowable encounters ahead.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, then immediately have another encounter here.

situation: Assisting a professor in his research, you find a valuable Spell.
rest: Draw 1 Spell. However, you must make a Fight (-1) check or some sticky-fingered student steals one of your items. Lose 1 Item of your choice.

situation: At a small corner bar, you run into Derek Minot, who is busily getting drunk. Seeing a sympathetic ear, he tells you the tragic tale of his roommate, who recently killed himself. The tale is unpleasant and peculiar, making you suspect unnatural influences at work.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. In any event, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: At key points throughout this building are small plaques with strange symbols on them.
rest: If you have a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership, gain 3 Clue tokens. If you do not have a "One of the Thusand" Cult Membership, make a Lore (-1) check. Gain 1 Clue token if you pass.

situation: At night, no one wanders outside of their homes and you can hear strange, unnatural animal sounds echo across the village.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: At some point in your other-worldly travels, you began suffering from a fever.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. Then make a Will (-1) check to glean useful insights from your delirious dreams. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: At the end of the dock, an elderly gentleman graps a paper bag tightly, mumbling unintelligibly and pacing. He sees you and points, motioning for you to give him something. Not wanting to upset this strange hermit, you search for something to give him. You may
rest: discard 1 Common Item to draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: At the south gate of Thran, you are stopped by a red-robed sentry until you can tell three dreams beyond belief.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to tour the golden spires of Thran, gaining 2 Clue tokens in the process. If you fail, stay here next turn.

situation: At the top of the hill is an old stone well. You may toss $1 inside and
rest: pass a Luck (-2) check to be Blessed. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: Avalanche!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or lose 3 Stamina.

situation: Awakening, you find yourself in a Victorian masked ball. The night passes in a blur.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: Backing up against the cliff, you must either face the horrible creature in front of you or leap into the choppy waters below. If you face the monster,
rest: draw a monster from the cup. If it has less than 3 toughness, return it to the cup and draw again until you either draw a monster with at least 3 toughness or you have drawn 5 times, in which case you fight whatever monster you've drawn, regardless of it's toughness. If you jump, roll a die. On a success, you return to Arkham. On a failure, you are devoured.

situation: Baffled scientists show you a wax cylinder which has apparently recorded the voices of people in the future, warning of what is to come.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you may look at the top three cards of the Mythos deck and then return them to the top of the deck in any order you choose.

situation: Bandits with hooves and horns set upon you!
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to beat them off or lose 2 Items of your choice.

situation: Basil Elton calls you to the top of the lighthouse, quickly pointing to the water.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you see the strange ship he's pointing to. You may take the Visions card if it is available.

situation: Basil Elton invites you to tell him your story. If you wish to do so,
rest: you are delayed, but Basil offers a great deal of insight. Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Clue token.

situation: Basil Elton is able to explain much about the creatures you have encountered.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens for each monster trophy you have. If you have no monster trophies, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Basil Elton is chatting with several old fishermen. Listening to their friendly conversation, you
rest: gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Basil Elton tells you some tales of his adventures, offering you some advice on how to interact with the denizens of other worlds. You may immediately pay only 1 gate trophy or 5 toughness worth of monster trophies to
rest: gain the Captain of the White Ship card. If you cannot or will not pay, you lose the opportunity and will have to pay the normal cost if you later change your mind.

situation: Basil Elton, the lighthouse keeper, politely invites you in for dinner.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Basil Elton, the lighthouse keeper, talks with you about strange ships he's seen moored just off the island-- ships that no one else claims to have seen.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Basil Elton, the old lighthouse keeper, is visiting friends here and invites you out to see the lighthouse. You may
rest: move to the North Point Lighthouse and draw 2 cards, encountering one card of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: Basil keeps a trunk of odd items that have washed up on the shore over the years.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you recognize something. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Basil points out a location where, as stories tell, a ship carrying gold sank.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you find the legendary wreck! Gain $3.

situation: Bats! Hundreds of them!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to get out of the cave safely. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Before going to sleep, you decide to barricade the door with some of the room's furniture, just to be safe.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina in the process.

situation: Before the bridge, on the side of the road, a car has broken down. A woman watches worriedly as a frustrated man tinkers with the engine. Noticing you, she introduces herself as Catherine Carrington. She offers you $5 if you can fix their car. To do so, you must
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check. If you try and fail, they thank you anyway, but do not pay you for your services.

situation: Before this trove of knowledge, your mind unlocks, for must not all books reflect the singularity of fact here recorded?
rest: Roll a die for each Tome you possess. If you roll any successes, return to Arkham and immediately close this gate, which you may seal normally.

situation: Behind a bookshelf, you hear a woman whisper, "I have killed him I loved; the world's athirst, now let it drink." When you look down that aisle, there's no one there, but there is an item resting on the floor.
rest: Draw 1 Unique Item. You may purchase it for half list price (round up).

situation: Bill Washington comes up to you and offers to sell you a rail pass. "Just $3, and you can ride the train all you want for a month." If you accept,
rest: pay $3 and take a Common Item.

situation: Bill Washington moves the last of the baggage from his cart onto a truck and offers you a ride as he opens the driver's door. If you accept,
rest: move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Black stars shine upon you, and reality is reversed. If you were
rest: Cursed, you are now Blessed. If you were Blessed, you are now Cursed.

situation: Breathing hard, you stay huddled against the rock until the sounds of pursuit fade into the distance.
rest: No encounter.

situation: Brian Burnham, the young manager of the store, offers you a bargain.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item — you may purchase it for $1 less than its list price.

situation: Brushing up against a strange object in the hall, you feel stretched and thin, like your skin is too tight.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or you are Cursed.

situation: By quietly listening to the nurses talk, you are able to learn some useful information.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Carefully stepping inside a mausoleum, you are horrified to hear the door slam shut behind you, locking you in with the corpses and coffins. All night you remain trapped, jumping at every soft scratching sound and low moan of the wind.
rest: Stay here next turn. In addition, you must pass a Will (-1) check or search the Madness deck for a Necrophobia card and take it.

situation: Carefully, you avoid the gaze of a gigantic eye watching an alter. You may try to
rest: pass a Sneak (-1) check to steal a scroll from the dais. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you are racked by pain and lose 3 Sanity.

situation: Carl Sanford
rest: n the Order?" Carl Sanford and several of his henchmen ask. If you accept, pay $3 and take a Silver Twilight Membership. If you decline, pass a Will (-1) check or lose 3 Stamina as the henchmen assist you out the door. Whether you pass or not, move to the street.

situation: Carl Sanford accuses you of stealing from the Lodge.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to prove that you've been framed. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and your Silver Twilight Membership, and then move to the streets. If you pass, there is no effect.

situation: Carl Sanford does not trust you and at the climax of the monthly ceremony spits a spell at you.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or you are Cursed.

situation: Carl Sanford explains that membership in the Silver Twilight Lodge requires sacrifice, and that the Lodge has need of one of your friends.
rest: Discard an Ally to take a "Silver Twilight Lodge Membership" card and draw a Unique Item. If you can't or won't, you are cursed, and must pass a Fight (-3) check to avoid becoming lost in time and space.

situation: Carl Sanford has an important task for you.
rest: Take the first Mission card from the Unique Item deck. However, you'll have the Lodge's help completing it, so place 1 Clue token on it to begin (you may skip the first location on the card).

situation: Carl Sanford has taken an interest in your possessions.
rest: If you have a Unique Item, you may sell it for its list price. If you do not sell it, the Lodge's henchmen will try to take it by force. Pass a Fight (+1) check or discard a Unique Item of your choice. If you do not have a Unique Item, nothing happens.

situation: Carl Sanford places a powerful spell of protection on you. If you are
rest: Cursed, discard the Curse card. If you are not Cursed, you may search the Mythos deck for any two cards of your choice and return them to the box.

situation: Carl Sanford sits in the center of the room chanting while books and other small objects appear to be flying around the room of their own accord!
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to avoid being clobbered by these items and to understand what Sanford is saying. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you awaken bruised and sore. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Catching him in a rare moment of calm, you take some time to talk to Dr. Harris.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Certainly frail mortal creatures like you were not meant to see and hear such things.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Chanting neighbors keep you up all night.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose your choice of 1 Stamina or 1 Sanity

situation: Chief Constable Martin has been cut pretty badly by a suspect and Constable Ropes is at a loss for treating the wound.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you manage to successfully administer some first aid and the Chief Constable produces a small gold coin from his desk and tosses it at you. Gain $3.

situation: Chief Constable Martin tells you that you'll fit in just fine around here and offers you a job.
rest: Take a Retainer card and then draw 2 Innsmouth Look cards.

situation: Chief Constable Martin wants to question you and his integgogation methods are blood-chilling.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to talk your way out of the situation without angering him. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. Regardless of whether you pass or fail, you are delayed.

situation: Climbing up a steep hill, you find yourself near an old decrepit building surrounded by tombstones. A fading sign says that this is the old town meeting hall. Deciding to poke around a bit inside, you come across some very interesting papers.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Coming to, you find yourself strapped down to a table. One of the strange beings picks up a sharp metal instrument and brings it towards your eye.
rest: You are delayed and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Constable Ropes "doesn't like the look of ya."
rest: Pass a Fight (+1) check or lose 1 Stamina as he throws you out of the building. Regardess of the result, move to the street.

situation: Constable Ropes enters your cell with a wooden baton. Some time later, he wearies of his sport and leaves you laying on the floor.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. You are delayed, even if you are normally immune to being delayed.

situation: Constable Ropes has turned his back while the weapons locker is unlocked. If you wish to try covertly arming yourself,
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, you are arrested as you try to explain.

situation: Constable Ropes is implying that if you don't offer up a bribe, he's going to make trouble for you.
rest: Discard $5 or a Unique Item. If you cannot or will not discard either, you are arrested.

situation: Constable Ropes is trying to read some old book he took from a suspect, but seems to be struggling with the material. He asks if it makes any sense to you.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: Constable Ropes wants to play some cards to pass the time.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain $2 and 1 Common Item. If you fail, discard all of your money and 1 Common Item. If you have both no money and no Common Items to discard, you are arrested.

situation: Countless voices chitter and gibber in the caves, driving you to the brink of insanity and causing your arcane lore to become jumbled.
rest: Roll a die for each Spell you have, discarding it on a failure.

situation: Creeping forward, you see that the black shape near the pool is a mutilated corpse, ripped asunder by God-knows-what. But wait! There's something clutched among three of the fingers that remain on the right hand!
rest: Lose 2 Sanity, but draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: Cresting the hill, you come across a sight that is intended only for you, and it fills your heart with joy. Either restore
rest: your Sanity to its maximum value or discard one of your Madness cards.

situation: Crossing the bridge, you are startled to find that it doesn't lead to where it did yesterday.
rest: Draw a mythos card and move to the gate location on it, having another encounter there immediately.

situation: Crouching underneath one of the Lodge's windows, you listen carefully.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to overhear something important and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, security is sent to escort you off the premises. Move to the street.

situation: Cruel eyes glitter at you from the doorway. "What business have you here?"
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or invisible forces push you roughly into the street. Lose 2 Sanity, 2 Stamina, and move to the street.

situation: Crushing tentacles pursue you!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or you are reduced to 1 Stamina.

situation: Customers in the store are gossiping about a recent strange occurrence, and who or what may have caused it.
rest: Turn the top card of a location of your choice faceup. The next investigator to have an encounter at that location draws that card.

situation: Danny Houghton is eager to hear your story and believes your strange tales. It's good to talk to someone.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Danny Houghton pulls you aside and tells you to never put to sea without knowing a little something worth knowing. He teaches you a complex riddle that, at first, makes no sense.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to figure it out. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: Danny Houghton, half dozing in his chair, begins to talk, muttering about the horrible creatures he's seen during his time at sea.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Danny Houghton, one of the ancient mariners here, grabs your arm firmly and urgently whispers a tale of his youth in your ear. You hear how the Kingsport fishing fleettrespassed into Innsmouth waters and were attacked, finny hands pulling under the boats and their crews.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Dark tendrils grasp you!
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or be delayed.

situation: Darke calls you over to a game in which small mechanical horses race against each other. "You seem down on your luck. Try this. I think your fortune's about to change." You may choose to sit and play the game until you win, if you wish. If you do,
rest: pay $6, but after your horse wins you are Blessed.

situation: Darke is interested to hear of your stories and particularly of the artifacts you have collected.
rest: If the Darke's Blessing card is facedown, you may spend 2 gate trophies or 10 toughness in monster trophies to turn the Darke's Blessing card faceup. If the card is already faceup or you do not spend the necessary trophies, nothing happens.

situation: Deciding that you have to take the chance if you're to return home, you activate the strange device.
rest: Roll a die. On a success, gain 2 Clue tokens. On a failure, nothing happens.

situation: Deep ones! If you hide from them,
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check. If you fight, make a Fight (-2) check. If you fail whichever check you attempt, lose 2 Stamina and 2 Sanity. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item as you escape in the midst of all the chaos.

situation: Deputy Dingby accidently drops a case file as he makes his way past you.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+0) check to search the Common Item deck for a Research Materials card and take it.

situation: Deputy Dingby forgot to bring his lunch today, and if you help him out, he'll become very friendly and chatty. You may give the Deputy either the Food Common Item card or $1 to
rest: gain 1 Clue token in return.

situation: Deputy Dingby has been called out to investigate allegations that the games at the carnival are rigged.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to convince him that they are all legitimate. If you pass, the carnies gratefully pass you $3.

situation: Deputy Dingby has left the keys to the evidence locker sitting on his desk.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check and, if you succeed, search the Common Item deck for an item of your choice.

situation: Deputy Dingby somehow manages to handcuff the two of you together.
rest: Stay here next turn, but you actually gain some valuable information listening to Dingby prattle on until Sheriff Engle returns. Gain 1 Clue Token.

situation: Deputy Dingby stops by Ma's for breakfast. This is, as you might guess, an unmitigated disaster. After Ma shoos him out of her kitchen, everyone pitches in to help her clean up the mess.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: Deputy Dingby strides past you with purpose, heading for Osborn's.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, he trips over a stone and his gun goes off, nearly shooting an innocent bystander and sending women and men running. Sadly, it seems the Deputy has sprained his ankle. Sighing, you help him back to the Police Station. Move to the Police Station and have an encounter there. If you pass, he manages to avoid the stone, thanks to your warning, and tosses you $1 for your trouble.

situation: Deputy Dingby, excitedly cleaning his gun, fires a bullet from the chamber in your direction.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to avoid getting shot. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Descending into a dark mausoleum, you discover a vampire rising to feed. You quickly find yourself fighting for your life.
rest: Make a Combat (-2) check. If you pass, you defeat the vampire, gaining 1 Clue token and drawing 1 Unique Item. If you fail, roll a die and lose that much Stamina.

situation: Despite all the horrible stories you've heard, the desk clerk seems genuinely pleased to see you. "Welcome to Innsmouth," he says. "Welcome home."
rest: Draw two Innsmouth Look cards.

situation: Despite your protests, the doctors are certain that you should not be allowed to leave the hospital.
rest: You are delayed, but may then gain 2 Stamina, 2 Sanity, or 1 of each.

situation: Despite your sense of larger forces influencing your actions, more rational minds convince you that there is no such thing as blessings or curses.
rest: Discard any Blessing or Curse cards you have.

situation: Discuss the opportunity to sell a monograph with the President of the University.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to make the sale and gain $5.

situation: Doc Warren comes around to check up on the old timers here, and offers to take a look at you too. If you accept,
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check to gain 1 Stamina. If you fail, he makes a mistake due to his encroaching senility and you lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Dr. Mortimore eyes you with suspicion. "Excuse me, but who are you here to see?"
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to come up with a plausible excuse and remain here. If you fail, the Doctor has security escort you outside. Move to the street.

situation: During the night, a harsh voice says, "Bring the prisoner." You are dragged from your cell to a disused house near the docks with a hole in the floor. Looking into it, you see a horrible shapeless mass that murmurs, ""Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!" Gasping, you barely have time to scream as the guard pushes you down the hole.
rest: You are devoured.

situation: During the night, a harsh voice says, "Bring the prisoner." You are dragged from your cell to a disused house near the docks with a hole in the floor. Looking into it, you see a horrible shapeless mass that murmurs, "Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!" Gasping, you barely have time to scream as the guard pushes you down into the hole.
rest: You are devoured.

situation: During the night, a number of the graves in the cemetary were disturbed. You notice an object was unearthed as a result.
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, gain a Unique Item. If you fail, gain a Common Item.

situation: During the night, someone has broken all the windows and smashed all the furniture. Until repairs can be made, the tavern can't accommodate any patrons.
rest: Move to the streets.

situation: During the night, you have a dream of the Dark Pharaoh in ancient Egypt. You learn much by observing him.
rest: Gain 1 Spell and then make a Will (+1) check. If you fail, reduce your maximum Sanity by 1.

situation: Earn $5 for a story.
Earnestly, you try to convince Gladys Pickman to allow you to look through her home for old books.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, nothing happens. If you pass, you may then pass a Luck (-1) check to take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck.

situation: Eavesdropping, you hear the priest speaking to his congregation. You are shocked when he mentions you by name and there is an angry, croaking cry from the others. Add
rest: 1 uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track.

situation: Editor Doyle Jefferies is offering top dollar for anyone who can provide a first-hand account of the strange events plaguing Arkham. You may
rest: move to the nearest Gate. If you do, take a Retainer card and you are drawn through the Gate. If no Gates are open, nothing happens.

situation: Editor Doyle Jefferies is ready to publish what he knows about what's really going on in Arkham.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to talk him out of it. If you are unsuccessful, raise the Terror level by 1.

situation: Editor Doyle Jefferies offers you a Retainer in return for your fascinating stories.
rest: Take a Retainer card.

situation: Eerie purple lights begin wending their way towards you.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check or you are drawn to them and delayed.

situation: Elections are underway for class president and the competition has grown mean-spirited. You see a fight break out right in front of you.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to break it up. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as you can't stop the students viciously attacking one another.

situation: Emaciated cattle wander through the area, their hide turned grey by some unknown force.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token as you gain useful knowledge by studying these strangely afflicted creatures.

situation: Engrossed in your reading, you suddenly notice the Library is locking up for the evening.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check. If you succeed, move to the street. If not, you are delayed.

situation: Entering a stone crypt, you are surprised to find a beautiful fresco and some inspirational words upon the wall. There is an almost magical peace within the chamber.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: Entering one of the rooms, you see a chess set on a table. In growing horror, you watch as the pieces begin moving by themselves and shattering into splinters as they are captured. Fleeing the house, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: Entering the workroom, you see a smith working on an ancient heirloom. He says "Your piece is finished, you vulture," and throws it at you in disgust.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check. If you pass, you may search the Unique Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, you lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Equipment and materials have been stolen from the site, and the workers are constantly watching for strangers.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you fail, you're spotted and suspected of being a thief. Take the Wanted card if it is available.

situation: Erica Carlyle is browsing the art for sale and gets caught up in your stories of the unexplained.
rest: If you have $3 or less, she agrees to join you and help pay your way. Take her Ally card or, if it is not available, gain a Retainer card.

situation: Erica Carlyle is investigating the stories of the mysterious stone that fell from the heavens, and her interest is piqued by your tales of the bizarre.
rest: If you have $3 or less, she agrees to help you and help pay your way. Take her Ally card or, if it is not available, gain a Retainer card.

situation: Erica Carlyle is slumming it, and seems intrigued by your tales of mystery.
rest: If you have $3 or less, she agrees to join you and help pay your way. Take her Ally card or, if it is not available, gain a Retainer card.

situation: Even a brief visit sees the scales fall from your eyes; every word of recorded knowledge in all places and times is multiplied in your understanding.
rest: Take a Clue token for every Tome you possess.

situation: Even in such a strange locale, banditry is ever the same.
rest: Pay $2, or discard your most expensive item. If several equally expensive items qualify, choose one of them to discard.

situation: Even mind and memory stumble on such strange ground.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose a Spell.

situation: Examining a fragile vase, it slips out of your hands.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to catch it or Oliver Thomas makes you buy it for $3. If you fail to catch it and don't have $3, move to the street.

situation: Examining one of the haggard cows that shamble around the farm, you realize that something has been draining the creature's blood on a regular basis.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and move to the street.

situation: Examining the graves, you are startled to see so many list the same date as the day of death.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and then, if you are still sane, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Examining the outside of the house, you notice peculiar little symbols hidden in various pieces of the exterior woodwork.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to recognize them. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Examining the remnants of a recent magic ritual, you learn something important about the inner workings of magic.
rest: Draw 1 Spell and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Excellent! There seems to be a narrow passage leading back. Return to Arkham.

Exhausted and drained, you sit and listen to the choir for a while. Their beautiful singing helps get you back on your feet. Perhaps there's no meaning to the universe, but then again, perhaps we give it our own meaning.
rest: Gain 2 Stamina and 2 Sanity.

situation: Exhausted, you lay down and sleep for a while.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Exhilerated- and drenched!- by sea-spray, it's an effort of resolve to keep all that you have learned in mind.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or discard all but four of your Clue tokens.

situation: Exploring downstairs, you come across the door to the boiler room.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to slip in and gain 1 Common Item.

situation: Exposure and fear weaken your mind.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or you must lose either 2 Spells of your choice or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Facing its awfulness head-on is the only way to avoid madness.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 3 Sanity.

situation: Falling asleep beneath one of the ancient willows on the island, you dream of another life, one in which you called down strange entities and sacrificed in their name. When you awaken, you have retained some of the memories from that other life.
rest: Gain 1 Clue Token and 1 Spell.

situation: Father Michael convinces you that there are members of his congregation in greater need than you. Donate either half your money (rounded up) or half your items (your choice, rounded up) to the poor.
Father Michael directs you to the box for donations and tells you to take what you need. Take $2 or
rest: draw a Common Item.

situation: Father Michael is hesitant to walk back to South Church alone, saying that the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit has cast a pall upon Arkham. If you escort him, move immediately to South Church. Do not have
rest: an encounter there, but you may trade in monster and gate trophies to be Blessed as described at that location. If you escort him and have the Motorcycle or Map item or the Mists of Releh spell, you are Blessed for free.
