situation: Father Michael is impressed by your conviction in the fight against the rising evil. You are
rest: Blessed.

situation: Father Michael talks with you for a little while about your doubts and fears. You come away from the talk feeling a lot better than you did before.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: Father Michael's sermon is comforting, but a little dull, and you've dozed off.
rest: Stay here next turn and restore your Sanity to its maximum.

situation: Father Michael, sensing that some evil may be afflicting you without your knowledge, suddenly submerges your head in the font of holy water.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, restore your Sanity to its maximum. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Fear grabs you as the buzzing entities approach.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Fear has swept through the campus and a mob has gathered at the steps of the Administration Building.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to convince the students that everything is under control. If you succeed, gain $5 from a grateful University president. If you fail, increase the terror level by 1.

situation: Feeding her a line about a rat infestation in the neighborhood, you convince Gladys Pickman to let you inspect her basement. There, beneath an old wooden box, you find a concealed passage. Immediately
rest: move to the Causeway and have an encounter there.

situation: Feeling thirsty, you lower a bucket into the old well to
rest: draw up a drink. Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the bucket contains several gold coins. Gain $3. If you fail, the bucket is filled with blood and entrails. Lose 1 Sanity and move to the street.

situation: Finding a small, rusted mirror lying on the shore, you can sense immense power within it. If you want, you may gaze into the mirror. If you do so,
rest: draw 1 Madness card and become Blessed. If you do not gaze into the mirror, nothing happens.

situation: Finding an old object in the woods near Harney Jones' shack, you try to return it to him, but he just tells you to keep it.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: Finding an unusual book, you read a spell from it.
rest: You may move any elder sign token on the board to any unsealed, unstable location. If there is a gate there, it is immediately sealed, and any monsters there are returned to the monster cup. If there are no elder sign tokens on he board, take a Clue token.

situation: Finding yourself in a primordial jungle, you are attacked by savage hominids directed by a hovering brain covered in black tentacles. Either
rest: pass a Speed (-1) check or discard a Dynamite card to escape from them, gaining 2 Clue tokens in the process. If you do not escape, lose 2 Stamina and stay here next turn.

situation: Flight! You throw all behind you, lest all be lost!
rest: Discard a Spell and a Weapon or lose 3 Stamina.

situation: Flipping through the early edition, you are surprised to see that one of the classified ads begins with your name. Reading it, you realize that it contains several coded clues to the nature of the threat that faces Arkham.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: Following some smoke behind the shack, you find Harney Jones working an old still. "Here, have a sample on the house."
rest: Search the Common Item deck for a Whiskey card and take it, assuming any are left.

situation: Following the lake shore, you come to a place that looks familiar.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and then choose any aquatic location that does not have a gate marker on it. Have one encounter there (or use the location's ability, if able) and immediately return here.

situation: For a moment, the lighthouse illuminates some horrible creature in the water. When the light rotates around again, the thing is gone.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: For once, fortune is with you.
rest: No encounter.

situation: Fortune favors everyone, each according to his station. If you are
rest: Cursed, discard all of your items. If you are Blessed, draw a Unique Item.

situation: Free Egyptian grain bread to make the newcomers welcome!
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: From a bench in Independence Square you can watch the comings and goings of the town's major figures.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: From a ledge above you, a monster appears!
From atop the peak, you can see nothing, forever. You have
rest: no encounter.

situation: From down the fairway, you hear a shout, "Hey Rube!" Glancing up, you see a man running towards you in a panic, with several carnies chasing him. Thinking quickly, you stick out your foot and trip him. The carnies are on him in an instant. The leader thanks you and gives you a reward.
rest: Gain $2. However, you make the mistake of looking into the man's face as they take him away, and the absolute look of terror there unnerves you. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: From here you can see strange clouds circling around the top of Sentinel Hill.
rest: Starting with the first player, each player with 1 or more Corruption cards must choose 1 of his Corruption cards and trigger its effect as if the appropriate dimensional symbol had appeared on the appropriate background color during the Mythos Phase.

situation: From living blackness, a monster appears!
From outside, you can hear the congregation engaged in a loud ritual honoring Dagon. As horrible as it is, the sound exhilarates you and feeds on your weaknesses.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina. Then, if you have an Injury or Madness card, add an uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track and you are Blessed.

situation: From the catwalk above, you have a clear view of the assembly line and the shambling, monstrous workers.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to realize what they really are. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: From the darkest shadows, a monster appears!
From the shadowy depths, a monster appears!
From these alien heights, everything seems so clear...
rest: gain 1 Clue token, then pass a Will (+1) check to snap out of your reverie and descend to a safe elevation. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and continue making the check until you pass or are knocked unconscious. Each check after the first, the modifier decreases by one (0 on the second check, -1 on the third, and so on).

situation: From this strange mindscape you can see into the dreams of those sleeping in Arkham.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, you catch the delicate wisps of their thoughts, and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, their slumbering minds lash out at you, and you lose 2 Sanity.

situation: From your window, you
rest: spend the day watching the people of Innsmouth going about their business. Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you quickly notice some odd behaviors. Gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you are delayed as you spend all day watching, without noticing anything.

situation: Frustrated and alone, you cry out, and your voice echoes through the city streets. Instantly, you realize that you shouldn't have done that. You are
rest: Cursed.

situation: Furtively, you pocket some processed gold.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check and gain $1 per success. If you get no successes, you are discovered and tossed out into the street.

situation: Gazing at Devil Reef on the horizon, you are disturbed by the strange hopping of many silhouetted figures.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: George Cotton, the local stonecutter, stops in to say hello to some of the old salts. Afterwards, he talks about the strange goings-on at the nearby cemetary.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Getting lost as you wander the halls, you wind up in the basement just in time to see two orderlies toss a bodybag into the furnace.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you manage to quietly flee the asylum. Move to the street. If you fail, you cry out, attracting their attention. Fleeing through the halls, you eventually lose them, but not before hours have passed. Stay here next turn.

situation: Ghouls have feasted here and left behind a grisly mess.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Gibberish and obscenities are carved into the bark of some of the dead trees ringing the hopyard. You recognize occult symbols on the most twisted and deformed specimens.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to draw 1 Spell.

situation: Gigantic, four-armed creatures are fast asleep.
rest: Make a Sneak (+1) check. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and you are lost in time and space.

situation: Given your apparent knowledge of obscure histories, Neil offers you a discount on purchasing an item from his collection.
rest: Draw a Unique Item. You may purchase this item for the list price. For every Clue token you have, reduce the list price by $1, to a minimum of $1.

situation: Gladys Pickman is concerned that you're not looking well and makes you some hearty soup.
rest: Gain either 1 Stamina or 1 Sanity.

situation: Gladys Pickman is delighted to show you a photo album of her friends and family in Kingsport.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to recognize the occult symbols discretely displayed on some of the gentlemen's jackets. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Gladys Pickman wants to make up a new batch of cookies and asks your help in looking through her old recipe boxes.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you stumble upon something not in her handwriting. Gain 1 Spell.

situation: Gladys Pickman, a kindly old woman, notices your interest in her house. "A grand old house, isn't it? Why don't you come in for some tea and cookies and I'll tell you a bit about it."
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Gladys Pickman, noticing your interest, offers to sell you some of the old papers she found in her house.
rest: Pay $2 to gain 1 Spell and 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Gladys is selling off a few items she found around the house. A lot of people are here buying things.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw a Unique Item. You may purchase it for $1 more than the list price. If you fail, draw a Common Item. You may purchase it for the list price. Any items not purchased are discarded.

situation: Glancing behind you, you see that the beasts are still chasing you.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or be lost in time and space.

situation: Glancing over the shoulder of a dark-skinned man to see the book he's reading, you're startled to see that it's written in an ancient language that only a few people, including yourself, can read.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to absorb the information before he notices. If you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, he notices you too soon, shuts the book, and takes it with him out of the library.

situation: Good thing you had that camera with you earlier. You may
rest: spend 3 toughness worth of monster trophies to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Great Cthulhu spares the faithful. If you wish, you may
rest: attempt a Lore (-3) check. If you fail, you are devoured. If you pass, take this card. Discard this card the next time you would be devoured to instead be reduced to 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Halfway down the cliff, you manage to grab onto a stone outcropping. Looking back up to where you fell from, the question remains- climb back up or climb down? If you climb back up,
rest: pass a Fight (-2) check to safely reach the top and return to Arkham. If you fail, you are delayed. If you climb down, make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find a great treasure at the bottom. Draw 2 Unique Items. If you fail, a monster awaits you at the bottom.

situation: Halfway up the mountains, you come across a dark cave. Do you venture inside, or continue toward the golden city you saw atop the peak? If you enter the cave,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the cave wall has a glowing inscription on it. As you read it, it burns itself into your mind, and then you find yourself home once more. Draw 1 Spell, then return to Arkham. If you fail, a monster lurks in the cave. If you continue to climb, pass a Fight (-2) check to reach the top, where an order of monks teach you their secrets. Draw 1 Skill. If you fail, you fall and are lost in time and space.

situation: Hanging out with the old salts who live here for awhile, you play a few hands of bridge.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Harney hands you a jar of ointment. "Here, rub this on those cuts and bruises you got there. It'll fix you right up."
rest: Gain 2 Stamina.

situation: Harney hands you a knife and a piece of wood. "Sit a spell and whittle away with me. It's good for the soul."
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: Harney listens to your entire story with a concerned expression. "Well, a person can't here a story like that and just stand by and do nothing. I'll head in to town tomorrow and do what I can." You may remove
rest: 1 Dunwich Horror token from the board.

situation: Harney looks like he just got back from a trip. He claims to have "Been fishin'!" You may choose
rest: 1 monster token in any aquatic location and return it to the monster cup. If there are no monsters in an aquatic location, you may spend 1 Clue token to place a Clue token on any space on the Feds Raid Innsmouth track.

situation: Harney looks you over. "How would you like to do a bit of trading?" You may
rest: discard 1 Unique Item, Common Item, or Spell, then draw the top 3 cards of that deck and keep one card of your choice, discarding the other two.

situation: Harney offers you a bowl of thick and delicious mountain stew.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Harney reckons you've been fighting the darkness so long, you've started to take on some of it yourself. He talks with you at length about the simple, decent things that you're fighting so hard to protect. You may
rest: choose 1 Corruption card to discard. If you have no Corruption cards, you are Blessed instead.

situation: Harney reminisces with you for hours. His calm tone and fanciful tales soon put you into a deep trance. When you regain your senses you find your mind has grown more receptive.
rest: Take the Psychic card if it is available.

situation: Harney tells you old stories about his friends who worked for the railroad. "Just mention my name and they'll let you ride in the freight car for free."
rest: Gain 1 Rail Pass.

situation: Harney tells you that the critters have tried to break into our world before. He shows you a strange object of wood and stone, tied together by iron bands.
rest: Draw a gate marker from the stack of gate markers and keep it as a trophy, even if it is an Endless gate.

situation: Harney tells you that you need some rest. You may choose to
rest: stay here next turn to discard either an Injury or a Madness card. If you do not have an Injury or a Madness card, you may instead choose to stay here next turn and restore either your Sanity or or your Stamina to full.

situation: Harney's set a few snares to catch rabbits for stew. He's also hidden a few larger traps across the countryside, in the hopes of catching larger quaarry. You may
rest: choose 2 monsters in the Outskirts and return them to the monster cup. If there are no monsters in the Outskirts, gain 1 Clue token instead.

situation: Harney's shed is overflowing with odds and ends. "Take some of this junk off my hands," he says.
rest: Search the Common Item deck for any one non-Weapon card and take it.

situation: Harsh, buffeting winds force you to cling to the cliffside in terror.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Have
rest: ack hood is thrown over your head and you are taken to the docks, where you are placed on a small rowboat. After some time, your bonds are removed and you are pushed roughly out of the boat and onto the ground. "Have fun!" the guards say, laughing. Pulling off your hood, you find yourself far out to sea on top of a reef. Move to Devil Reef and have an encounter.

situation: Have you seen the Yellow Sign?
rest: Pass a Speed (+0) check to avert your eyes. If you fail, you are reduced to 1 Sanity.

situation: Having gotten permission to look through the archive in the basement, you come across a parchment signed by Eben Hall.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: Hearing an unwholesome flapping from above, you press yourself into the shadows. A nightgaunt flies overhead, not noticing you, and drops a sheet of parchment.
rest: Draw 1 Spell.

situation: Hearing someone approach, you quickly climb a tree. It turns out to be several members of the Sheldon Gang. Nervously, you listen as they start talking directly under the tree you're in.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check to remain unnoticed and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, they notice you and beat the tar out of you. Lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Hearing the sounds of approaching footsteps and tattered cloth blowing in the wind, you are abruptly terrified.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or you flee from this place as fast as you can. Return to Arkham, but do not gain an explored token.

situation: Hearing the stories of what's going on in Dunwich, William Bain seems unconcerned and tells you that it's not as bad as you make it sound. You may
rest: discard 2 Clue tokens to remove 1 Dunwich Horror token from the board.

situation: Heavy footsteps come charging up the stairs towards your room during the night.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to climb down the drainpipe on the outside of the building and move to the street. If you fail, you are arrested by Chief Constable Andrew Martin for unclear reasons and taken to Innsmouth Jail.

situation: Here in the Vale of Pnath, you discover a friend once thought lost.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw an Ally. If you fail, your friend is in no condition to return with you. Lose 1 Sanity and return the top card of the Ally deck to the box.

situation: High winds and higher waves buffet you as you struggle to cling to the reef.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Hissing and croaking, the barely-human congregation surrounds you.
rest: If you have an Elder Sign card, you may discard it to drive them back and seal this location. If not, you lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity and are moved to the street.

situation: Ho there, what's this?
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to gain a Common Item.

situation: Horrible man-shaped forms in the water are making a trade with the dark figures standing on the reef. You may
rest: attempt a Fight (-1) check to drive them off. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Hot peanuts are for sale at a pushcart. You may
rest: pay up to $3 and gain 1 Stamina for each $1 you spend.

situation: How can these winds of change blow so fiercely beneath the earth, where weather itself will not descend?
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or move all of your skill sliders to their leftmost positions.

situation: Humans are not the only creatures to dream.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, a monster appears. If you fail, a monster surprises you.

situation: Hurricane winds smash you against the cyclopean stones.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 3 Stamina.

situation: Hurry! You must choose the correct crystal soon, or the gate will open and release a terrible creature.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or a monster appears!

situation: Hurtled forward in time, you witness mankind's final moments.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or draw a Madness card.

situation: Ia, Ia, Tsathoggua! cry their voices as one. Ia! Ia! If Eihort is the Ancient One, become
rest: Cursed, or gain a brood token.

situation: Idly flipping open a tedious-looking novel, you discover that its binding is false — this is no novel, but something much more dire!
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: If Azathoth is the Ancient One, then
rest: make a Luck (+0) check. If you fail, you find yourself at the center of the universe and one look at the creatures there blasts your mind to jelly. You are devoured. If you pass, nothing happens.

situation: If Coded Messages is facedown, you come across the editor, Doyle Jefferies, in the hall and begin to tell hiim about the Mythos. "Hang on now. Do you have any proof?" You may
rest: spend 1 gate trophy, 1 monster trophy, and 1 Clue token to give him enough proof. If you do, turn Coded Messages faceup. "Okay, I'm convinced. If you need to get a message to your friends, just let me know." If you do not spend the trophies, nothing happens.

situation: If Coded Messages is facedown, you may pay the radio operators who are working on the site to help you out. You may
rest: spend $5 to relay information for you. If you do, turn Coded Messsages faceup. If you do not spend the money, nothing happens.

situation: If Cthulhu is the Ancient One, then a green, flabby arm reaches out of the shadows towards you.
rest: Pass a Speed (+1) check or you are devoured. If Cthulhu is not the Ancient One, nothing happens.

situation: If Hastur is the Ancient One, then you are in grave danger. The exiled King in Yellow is coming.
rest: Pass a Horror (+0) check or you are devoured. If Hastur is not the Ancient One, nothing happens.

situation: If Nyarlathotep is the Ancient One, then an elephantine shantak picks you up in its claws and deposits you before the Crawling Chaos himself. Laughing at the futility of your quest, Nyarlathotep hurls you away using his powers. You are lost in time and space. If Nyarlathotep is not the Ancient One, nothing happens.
If Shub-Niggurath is the Ancient One, then you are thrown back through the ages to a time when primordial ooze is the only life.
rest: Pass a Fight (+0) check to escape powerful grasping tentacles or you are devoured. If Shub-Niggurath is not the Ancient One, nothing happens.

situation: If Velma's Gratitude is facedown, a muscular man begins to tear up the joint. If your current Fight is at least 4, you may
rest: draw 1 Injury to throw him out. If you do so, turn Velma's Gratitude faceup. "Thanks so much, hon. You and your friends can eat here for free whenever you like."

situation: If Velma's Gratitude is facedown, you find Velma waiting for the bus back to Arkham. A couple big locals are looking at her threateningly and blocking her from getting out to the bus. If your current Fight is at least 4, you may
rest: draw 1 Injury to get them out of her way. If you do so, turn Velma's Gratitude faceup. "I can't thank you enough. You and your friends can eat at the diner for free whenever you like."

situation: If humans dream of monsters, do monsters dream of us? A monster surprises you, but seems terrified by your very humanity.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. For each success you roll, you gain a +1 to all checks during this combat.

situation: If only one of their onyx-laden caravans should pass by before the blizzard consumes you!
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. Your Stamina is reduced to the number of successes you roll.

situation: If only your hasty disguise will hold in this city of ghouls! The things you might learn!
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to gain 1 Clue token, 1 Stamina, 1 Sanity, and return to Arkham.

situation: If someone knew what he was doing, this would be the perfect opportunity for a robbery.
rest: If you have a Sheldon Gang Membership, gain $5. If you do not have a Sheldon Gang Membership, make a Sneak (-1) check instead. If you pass, gain $1.

situation: If violence is all it understands, then violence it shall have!
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to take a Clue token

situation: If you
rest: est has been called in to counsel a particularly hopeless case. If you are Cursed or either your Stamina or Sanity is 2 or lower, he introduces himself as Father Iwanicki, and says, "I would like to offer my help, to make sure that no more suffer the same fate as this poor soul." Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, you may search the Unique Item deck for the Holy Water card and take it.

situation: If you are currently
rest: Blessed and the Darke's Blessing card is facedown, then a meaty hand grabs your shoulder. "Good evening. My name is Darke. You and I could be of great use to each other." You may discard your Blessing card to turn the Darke's Blessing card faceup. "Excellent, excellent. I knew that you were the person I was looking for." If you are not Blessed, if the Darke's Blessing card if faceup, or if you do not want to discard your Blessing card, nothing happens.

situation: If you are hurt, one of the orderlies bandages up some of your wounds for you.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: If you can just climb this bizarre structure, you think you can reach your destination!
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to return to Arkham. If you fail, stay here next turn.

situation: If you can show Father Michael proof of the doom that threatens Arkham, he will agree to lead the congregation in a prayer to purge the streets of evil. If you
rest: spend 1 Gate trophy, you may remove all monsters from the Southside neighborhood.

situation: If you currently posses a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership, the Inner Sanctum has found out about your double life! You must immediately
rest: lose either your Inner Sanctum* of "One of the Thousand" card. Either way, you lose 2 Stamina. If you are not One of the Thousand, you have no encounter.

situation: If you look hard, you can find some real bargains here!
rest: Draw a number of cards from the Common Item deck equal to your focus (maximum 3). You may purchase any of the drawn items for $1 less than the list price, and must discard the rest.

situation: If you wish, you may
rest: oating slowly downstream. You can see some object caught in its limbs. If you wish, you may make a Speed (-1) check to grab the object as it passes the bridge. If you pass, gain a Unique Item. If you fail, you fall into the water and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: If you're carrying a Tome, a shady man in the corner of the library motions you over. "It just so happens that I've been looking for that book for some time. In exchange for it, I'd be happy to give you some information that could prove vital to you." You may
rest: discard a Tome to gain 3 Clue tokens. If you don't have a Tome, nothing happens.

situation: If you're healthy enough, Ma could sure use some help rebuilding the porch.
rest: If you have 3 or more Stamina, take a Retainer card.

situation: In a dark, disused corner of the jail, you find something that might come in handy.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: In a dusty and decaying roll-top desk, you find a mysterious manuscript. If you read it,
rest: make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, the manuscript is nothing but the insane babbling of a previous renter. Stay here next turn reading it, but gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: In a flash of insight, you realize the purpose of the bladed artifact. Shivering, you put it back where you found it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity but gain 1 Clue token.

situation: In a large round room with a glass ceiling, you are startled to discover an elderly man wearing exotic robes. He tells you that the gods have decreed that he should meet you in this strange place. If you are
rest: Cursed or have any Mask items, he tells you that he is called The Messenger and is meant to aid you. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: In a lonely spot on the cliffside, you are suddenly gripped by a strange, terrifying vertigo.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity and move to Harborside streets.

situation: In a quiet corner removed from every place and no place at once, you snatch a moment of respite, and have
rest: no encounter.

situation: In an old journal you learn some horrible eldritch secrets.
rest: Roll a die. Lose that much Sanity and gain that many Clue tokens.

situation: In despair, someone has thrown himself into the water.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, you manage to pull him out of the water without harm to yourself. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina wrestling the man back to shore.

situation: In each facet of the gem is a monstrosity waiting to be born.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you fail, a monster appears!

situation: In perfect unison, the loud and boisterous crowd suddenly falls silent, turns to you and all ask, "Have you seen the yellow sign?"
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: In response to your pitiful knocking, the massive gate of the Castle of the Great Old Ones swings wide.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity. If you are devoured as a result, the Ancient One immediately awakens.

situation: In some alternate history, you see a United States plunged into dictatorship. Suicide chambers are erected in city parks. This could be the shape of things to come.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: In the Doctor's study, you find a book of helpful notes gathered from inmate interviews.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check and consult the following chart: Successes:  0) Their stories fill you with horror even as you learn a few bits of knowledge. Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token. 1-2) You find several pieces of useful information. Gain 2 Clue tokens. 3+) One of the interviews contains vital information. Gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: In the attic is a large chest that no one can recall where it came from. There's no key, but you try to break it open.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: In the attic, you feel a force in your mind, trying to replace your thoughts with those of another.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to escape. If you pass, move to the streets. If you fail, lose 1 Spell, or if you have no Spells, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: In the center of the island, you come across an ancient stone well with bones littering the ground around it. Staring into its black depths, a feeling of such dread overwhelms you that you immediately flee the area.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and move to the street.

situation: In the dark, you stumble into a deep hole. Looking up, you see a gravestone bearing your name.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check to scramble out or lose 2 Sanity and be delayed.

situation: In the darkness you happen upon the remains of a previous spelunker.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) The body begins to bloat and splits open, releasing the horror within. Lose 1 Sanity and a monster appears! 1) The body has been ripped apart as if shredded by a powerful monster. Lose 1 Sanity. 2+) Searching the body you find something intersting. Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: In the dead of night, you see a figure lurking in the graveyard, carrying an ancient artifact. If you investigate, a monster appears, and
rest: you suffer a -1 on both Horror checks and Combat checks. If you defeat the monster with your first Combat check, draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item. If you defeat the monster after multiple Combat checks, the artifact falls to the ground, and its pieces hint at a diabolical scheme: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: In the entryway are several photos of important figures in the history of the Order. You notice one with a strong familial resemblance to yourself.
rest: Draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: In the far-flung future, you are witness to an Earth that lies in ruin, populated only by hideous beetles. You return wiser, but your mind is unhinged by the experience.
rest: Gain 3 Clue tokens, but lose 3 Sanity.

situation: In the hall, you can hear patients reciting lines from "the King in Yellow" back and forth to each other, seemingly unaware that they're saying anything at all.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: In the house of Shuggob, many dark secrets are known, and revealed to you.
rest: Draw a Spell.

situation: In the middle of the night, a voice says, "Hold the prisoner still." You struggle in the darkness, but a pungent liquid is forced down your throat, making your head swim. "That should do it," you hear, just before passing out. The next morning, you awaken in Sawbone Alley with a strange headache.
rest: Move to Sawbone Alley and draw three Innsmouth Look cards.

situation: In the middle of the night, one of the retired sailors gets up and begins walking toward the water.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check to stop him and get him back to bed. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as the man disappears beneath the waves.

situation: In the middle of the night, someone painted a Yellow Sign on the side of Joe Osborn's General Store. Joe will pay you if you can clean it off.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, gain $2.

situation: In the middle of the night, something in the dark is clutching at your chest!
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check and lose 2 Stamina if you fail.

situation: In the middle of the night, there's too many heavy footsteps and scraping noises to sleep.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to see if you can doze off. If you fail, you need to get some night air to relax. Move to the streets.

situation: In the middle of the night, you are suddenly confronted by the spectre of someone wrongly killed, whose body was buried in a shallow grave near here. If you recover his remains and give him a proper burial
rest: you are delayed and Blessed.

situation: In the middle of the night, you hear a strange noise coming from the graveyard. You've stumbled upon the Cult of the Black Goat! You may join them if you wish. To do so, you must
rest: discard at least 2 toughness worth of monster trophies, lose 3 Stamina, or an Ally. Take a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership card. If you cannot or choose not to join, pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: In the middle of the night, you hear the sounds of violent fighting in the room next to yours.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, you get next door in time to see a group of thugs surrounding a guest. They run away at the sight of you. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity when you find nothing but broken furniture.

situation: In the moonlight, you hear a local farmer muttering to himself and gathering the dirt from this area into a small pouch.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check to hear what he's saying. If you pass, you realize he's reciting an ancient ritual and you draw 1 Spell.

situation: In the night, you can hear something enormous high above you breaking through the branches of trees.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you make a mad dash for safety. Lose 1 Sanity and move to the streets.

situation: In the small office's library, you discover the Sumatra Queen's log. Reading it, you learn about Captain Obed Marsh's travels to the South Pacific and his contact with the strange creatures that live beneath the waves.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain a Clue token for each success.

situation: In the streets where flap the tatters of the King, you hear the maddening songs of the Hyades and are transformed forevermore.
rest: Discard 1 Skill, then draw 1 Skill and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: In the valley of Pnoth, where the dholes crawl and burrow nastily, you hear a slithering among the mountains of bone.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you fail, you are devoured. If you pass, gain 3 Clue tokens and return immediately to Arkham.

situation: In the waters of Lake Hali, you can see the dreams of people you know. You find yourself unconsciously manipulating the dreams.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, choose 1 rift progress marker and turn it facedown if its associated rift is open, or discard the token if its associated rift is closed. If you fail the check, raise the terror level by 1.

situation: In this alien place, mundane objects serve to remind you that Earth still exists, somewhere, somewhen.
rest: Pass a Will (-3) check to gain 2 Sanity. You gain a +1 bonus to the check for each Common Item you have.

situation: In this place, it's a stroke of good fortune when nothing terrible happens to you.
rest: No encounter.

situation: In this place, where all minds converge,
rest: you may trade Clue tokens with other investigators until the end of this phase.

situation: In this room, you discover a powerful weapon. If you dare activate it,
rest: roll a die for each monster on the board. On a success, the monster is returned to the cup. On a failure, nothing happens. Afterwards, roll a die for yourself and lose that much Stamina.

situation: In your wanderings through this city, you come across a strangely marked stone of onyx.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to read it and draw 1 Spell. If you fail, stay here next turn.

situation: Inching your way across a narrow ledge, you make the mistake of looking down at the dizzying fall below you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Inexplicably, William Bain walks in through a door that leads to a shear drop-off. Once inside he begins pulling items out of his large coat pockets. Most of it seems like random junk.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, he hands you something useful. Gain 1 Common Item.

situation: Inside a glass case you see a strange Egyptian object next to a painting of yourself taking it from the case. Will you take the artifact or not? If you take the artifact
rest: gain 1 Exhibit Item and 1 Madness card. You may then return to Arkham if you wish. If you leave the artifact, you see a duplicate of yourself open the case and take the object. Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you manage to have a conversation with yourself and learn much. Gain 3 Clue tokens. If you fail, the experience is too unnerving. Lose 1 Sanity and you are delayed.

situation: Inside one of the cells, an emaciated old man calls out to you. "I know I won't survive another night. But you might still escape! Take this and leave Innsmouth forever. He reaches into his shoe and pulls out some money.
rest: Gain $5.

situation: Inside the Gardners' house you find strange, erratic writings covering some of the walls. Most of it seems to be nonsense but hidden within the ramblings are some startling revelations. If you choose to investigate thoroughly,
rest: gain 3 Clue tokens, and you are delayed.

situation: Inside the General Store, Joe Osborn takes an interest in the objects you've collected.
rest: If you currently have a Tome, he tells you there's a man in town who would be interested in it. Gain 3 Clue tokens as he tells you all about Wilbur Whateley. If you do not have a Tome, gain 1 Clue token from the conversation.

situation: It appears as though no one's home. You may try to
rest: pass a Sneak (-1) check to snoop around and gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, shouting voices erupt from all around you. You are Cursed and move to the street.

situation: It is recommended to you to simply open a book at random to find the answers you seek. If you would like to give it a try,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If not, you still gain 2 Clue tokens but you are delayed.

situation: It is the little things that comfort you in your darkest hour. You think fondly of the mundane joys of your life.
rest: Regain 1 Sanity for each Common Item you possess.

situation: It looks like the barn has recently been repaired. Putting your ear to the door, you can hear something moving in there.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token. Then pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity as you come to understand what those awful noises are.

situation: It seems as though you've run out of options for now, so you must bide your time.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: It seems that bank interest rates are especially favorable today.
rest: You may take out a Bank Loan if you don't already have one. If you do so, Gain $15 instead of the normal $10. However, you still only need to pay back the normal $10.

situation: It seems that no matter where you go, there are always thieves waiting to prey upon the unwary.
rest: Lose $2.

situation: It seems that you are not the first to have come here.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token and $2.

situation: It seems you are in an entire forest of webs.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to avoid getting ensnared. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: It seems you are not the only one trying to get answers from Harney.
rest: You may take the Private Investigator card if it is available.

situation: It suddenly strikes you that you've never been so alone and so lost. It doesn't seem possible that you'll ever get back home.
rest: Pass a Will (-3) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: It takes you a moment to realize that the horrible screeching noise consists of English words spoken by something monstrous!
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but gain 1 Clue token.

situation: It was a diabolical trap, you suddenly realize... now that you're inside it!
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check or you are delayed.

situation: It's a dead end.
rest: You are delayed as you must retrace your path and try something different.

situation: It's a door! You must have walked by the other side of that door a hundred times back home.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity. Then make a Fight (-2) check to break the lock. If you pass, return to Arkham.

situation: It's a horrible collection of impossible things!
rest: Roll 3 dice. For each success, gain 1 Clue token. For each die that is not a success, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: It's a raid!
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to get out before the police round you up. If you fail, you are arrested for being in an establishment selling liquor.

situation: It's a slow night and the bartender, Jonas Rigg, strikes up a conversation with you. The stories he hears have been getting stranger and stranger lately. If the terror level is currently 4 or lower,
rest: gain 1 Clue token. If it is currently 5 or higher, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: It's a tough climb and you need a rest.
rest: You are delayed but gain 1 Stamina.

situation: It's cold, windy, and dangerous here. Fortunately, there's a ship headed for warmer climes. If you like, you may
rest: move to the Dreamlands.

situation: It's dinner time, and Ma has spread all the fixings. You resist the urge to sit down and have a meal, but the same can't be said of the rest of your party.
rest: If you have an Ally, discard it. Fortunately, another willing soul finds the prospect of helping you out exciting. Draw a random Ally. If the Ally deck is empty, nothing happens.

situation: It's easy to get separated in the winding tunnels.
rest: Return one Ally of your choice to the box. If do not have any Allies, nothing happens.

situation: It's lovely here, and perfect... so perfect you might stay forever.
rest: Make a Will (+3) check. If you pass, gain 2 Sanity. If you fail, you are devoured.

situation: It's mystery meat Monday at Ma's. As you walk into the kitchen, she shoves a spoonful of the unknown chow into your mouth and directs you to swallow.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you succeed, restore your Stamina to its maximum. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity, and your lunch.

situation: It's not safe this close to the edge of town.
rest: You encounter all monsters currently in the Outskirts, in the order of your choice. If you successfully evade any monster, you may choose to move to the street and your turn ends.

situation: Items in an abandoned warehouse are being auctioned off. The selection is quite good, but prices are running high.
rest: Draw the top three Common Items from their deck. You may purchase 1 of them for $1 more than the listed price. Discard any items that are not purchased.

situation: Jackpot! You find just what you've been looking for.
rest: Search either the Common or Unique Item deck and purchase any one item of your choice at list price.

situation: Jacob Marsh greets you warmly. "Of course I know you! My aunt is your grandmother!"
rest: Draw two Innsmouth Look cards.

situation: Joe Osborn calls you over to ask a favor. "These gentlemen are from Miskatonic University. They're looking for a tour of the area, and they won't take no for an answer." At least they're willing to pay.
rest: Gain $3 and take the Local Guide card if it is available. If it is not available, you do not gain the money.

situation: Joe Osborn is hoping to find someone who can explain to him the strange events taking place on Sentinel Hill.
rest: If you have 3 or more Clue tokens, Joe buys you a meal. restore your Stamina to full. If you have 2 or fewer Clue tokens, nothing happens.

situation: Joe Osborn offers to sell you a slightly used ledger. The first few pages are filled with accounting information. The last dozen pages are filled with strange notes regarding experiments into the world of magic. You may
rest: pay $4 to gain 1 Spell.

situation: Joe Osborn sees that one of your possessions is in dire need of repair. He says he has a brand new replacement if you'd like. Choose one of your Common or Unique Items. You must either
rest: discard that item or spend an amount of money equal to its list price. If you do not have any Common or Unique Items, nothing happens.

situation: Joe Osborn shows a letter to you. "This was suppose to go with today's mail.It's awful important. Can you take this to Innsmouth?" If you agree to help, move immediately to Joe Sargent's Bus Service and
rest: gain $3.

situation: Joe Osborn tells you he's been having a hard time getting in supplies lately. He'd be willing to pay well if you've got anything extra. You may
rest: discard one Common or Unique Item with a list price of $2 or more and gain an amount of money equal to $1 above the list price.

situation: Joe Sargent is waiting here before returning to his bus. If you buy him a little lunch he'll happily tell you what he knows about Innsmouth. you may
rest: spend $2 to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Joe Sargent is willing to give you a ride to Arkham in his bus, provided you haven't learned too much.
rest: If you have 3 or less Clue tokens, you may move to any location in Arkham and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Joe Sargent is wondering if you know anything about repairing bus engines.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you can tell the problem just by his description. Joe says he doesn't really have any money to pay you, but offers one of his few possessions. Gain a Common Item card. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: Joe Sargent tells you he's running some errands and he'd be happy to pick something up for you if he can find it.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. Draw a number of Common Items equal to the number of successes rolled. You may choose 1 to purchase. Discard any items that are not purchased.

situation: Joe Sargent's bus is waiting. You may
rest: spend $1 to hitch a ride to any Arkham location and have an encounter there.

situation: Joey "The Rat" Vigil slips into an empty chair at your table and whispers, "Pssst! Wanna buy something?"
rest: Look at the top 3 cards of the Common Item deck. You may purchase any or all of them for $1 above the list price. "Hey, I've got overhead!" the Rat explains

situation: Joey "The Rat" is huddled under the roof of one of warehouses. Seeing you, he waves you over. "Look, I think I've gotten in over my head this time. Ever since I got this thing weird stuff's been going on. I'll give you $5 to take it off my hands! Please, think of my wife and kids!" If you accept,
rest: draw 1 Common Item, gain $5, and become Cursed.

situation: Joey "The Rat" is sitting at the counter and motions for you to come over. "You looking for anything in particular?" He has several items for sale.
rest: Draw 2 Common Item cards and pay $2 more than the list price if you wish to purchase one or both of them. "Sorry, I got kids to feed, ya know."

situation: Joey "the Rat" is huddled in the shadows of the train station and motions for you to come over. He has an item for sale.
rest: Draw the top Common Item card and pay $1 more than list price if you wish to keep it.

situation: Joey "the Rat" is leaning against the bridge and motions for you to come over. "I've got something special for you today." He has an item for sale.
rest: Draw the top Unique Item card and pay $1 more than list price if you wish to purchase it.

situation: Joey "the Rat" waves to you from the side of the house. "I've got some information you might be interested in. Only $4." You may
rest: pay $4 to gain 2 Clue tokens "Hey, info like this don't come cheap, ya know!"

situation: Jonas Rigg hands you a tavern puzzle and offers you a free drink if you can solve it.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to get the metal ring free from the rest of the iron sculpture. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Jonas Rigg is curious about the exhibit of Egyptian antiquities. If you choose to tell him what you know, he picks up your tab at the end of the night.
rest: You are restored to your maximum Sanity, but are delayed.

situation: Jonas Rigg suspects you may not be in your right mind.
rest: Roll a die for each point of Sanity you currently have. If you roll at least 1 success, the bartender apologizes and offers you some free soup. Gain 1 Stamina. If you don't roll any successes, move to the streets and discard one Weapon if you are able.

situation: Jonas Rigg, the bartender, looks you over as you enter the dim, smoky tavern. "I'm guessing you want to buy something besides drinks."
rest: You may buy up to 3 Clue tokens for $2 each.

situation: King Kurantes would like a souvenir.
rest: If you have a Common Item, you may trade it to him for 2 Clue tokens. If not, nothing happens.

situation: Kneeling in one of the pews to pray, you come across an unusual book.
rest: Take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck.

situation: Knowing that you are engaged in God's work, Father Michael Blesses you.
Knowledge empowers the body and spirit for those who brave the stars to visit this place.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina for each Spell you possess.

situation: Knowledge is power, but more importantly, it is hope and endurance in this prison where you find yourself.
rest: Lose 3 Stamina and 3 Sanity, but you reduce this loss by 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity for each Clue token you discard (to a maximuum of three).

situation: Leaning against a wooden fence near the Whateley farm, you get some tarry black substance on your hand. Examining it gives you some insight into the nature of the Dunwich Horror.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Learn what these visions may tell at physical cost? Or flee, sparing your wits? You must choose to either
rest: gain 1 Stamina and lose 1 Sanity, or lose 1 Stamina and gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Loathe as they are to guide you across these trackless wastes, the Tcho-tchos are even less inclined to see you remain. You may
rest: spend 3 Stamina to return to Arkham.

situation: Local children are fishing along the edge of the bridge. They challenge you to see who can catch the biggest fish. If you accept the challenge
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, they are so impressed they offer you a secret treasure they've hidden in the marsh. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you are delayed as you don't cath a single fish.

situation: Looking across the clearing, you spy another shadowy figure watching the same malefactors you have your eye on. Although your surveillance proves fruitless, you later meet your counterpart on the beach.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to take John Legrasse's Ally card, or, if it's not available, to increase your Sanity and Stamina to their maximum values.

situation: Looking at one of the wanted posters, you realize that you've already taken care of that particular threat. You may
rest: spend 1 monster trophy with a moon dimensional symbol to gain $5.

situation: Looking at the sleeping guardian, you weigh the risks. If you choose to chance it,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw 1 Spell and 1 Common Item. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: Looking at the vast distances you still have to cross, you feel as though all is lost.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Looking closely at a mummified head in the shop, you are horrified to find it looking back at you!
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Looking down at your bank statement, it appears that the bank has made an error in your favor. When you try to bring it to the teller's attention, she primly tells you, "We don't make mistakes here at the First Bank of Arkham." Shrugging, you keep the money.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: Looking into a glass ball,
rest: you receive a vision of things to come. Turn the top card of one location deck of your choice face up. The next investigator to have an encounter at that location draws that encounter card.

situation: Looking into a mirror, you can see that being in Innsmouth is changing you. You may
rest: gain up to 2 Corruption Cards. Then draw 2 Innsmouth Look cards. reduce the number of Innsmouth Look cards you draw by 1 for each Corruption card you have (to a minimum of 0).

situation: Looking out the window, the water looks beautiful and luminous, while the land looks gray and drab.
rest: Draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: Looking over the lake of Yath and taking in the fragrent air, you find yourself comforted.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Looking through one of the older books, you come across note note in its margin written in a crabbed hand.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you are able to decipher it. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you return the book to the shelf, none the wiser.

situation: Looking through the
rest: drawers in one of the rooms, you come across a stunningly beautiful crystal. As you pick it up, it shimmers for a moment, then sinks into your hand. You convulse for a moment as new knowledge rushes through your mind, but no harm seems to have been done. Draw 1 Skill.

situation: Looking through the school's archive, you find papers detailing the 1722 raid on the Congregational Church. Fascinated, you read it carefully.
rest: Gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: Looking up at the night sky from the island, you see constellations that you've never seen before. The entire sky is different here!
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Looking up at the shrouded sky, you are startled to see two moons.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Looking up into the night sky, you are horrified to see large, black things circling overhead.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Luck finds those who need it. If you Luck is 1 or lower, you find a luck penny between the floorboards.
rest: You may search the Skill deck and take the Luck card.

situation: Luck is with you. You stumble on a cache of supplies.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: Luckily, it's just another quiet day in the Square.
rest: No encounter.

situation: Ma Mathison comments that you look pallid, and suggests some yard work to get you feeling fit.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to sneak a nap in the shed instead and gain 2 Stamina. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina from Ma's "tough love" prescription.

situation: Ma Mathison offers board as well as room; the bigger the boarder, the bigger the lunch.
rest: Search the Common Item deck and take the Food card. Then make a Fight (-1) check. For each success, you may place a token on the Food card; when you use the Food, you may discard the token instead of discarding the card.

situation: Ma Mathison offers you a free night's stay so that she doesn't have open rooms in case "one o' them actor types looks to board here." You
rest: regain 1 Stamina, but pass a Luck (-1) check or you lose 1 Sanity due to bad dreams.

situation: Ma Mathison serves her special soup at supper.
rest: Roll a die and gain that much Stamina

situation: Ma Mathison tells you that the best room on the house is available for the night. If you want,
rest: pay $3 to spend the night there. Gain 4 points split between Sanity and Stamina however you choose.

situation: Ma apologizes, but her kitchen is being redone. If you want, she'll give you a ride to Velma's Diner. If you go there, immediately have
rest: an encounter.

situation: Ma asks you to give her a hand moving a piano into the house. If you agree to help,
rest: make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, Ma gratefully tucks $3 into your pocket. If you pass (errata: should say "fail"), you lose 1 Stamina and are delayed by the frustrating struggle.

situation: Ma doesn't like the look of you and your "gang".
rest: Pay $1, plus $1 for each Ally you have, or move to the street.

situation: Ma runs a tight ship! You awake refreshed.
rest: Gain 2 points split between Stamina and Sanity however you choose.

situation: Ma sends you up to tell Mr. Ahrens that supper is ready. His door is ajar and as you push it open, you find that he has tied a noose to the rafters and taken his own life.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Ma's is full to capacity this time of year. Although Ma is known to become cranky with those who steal away her business, you
rest: spend some time getting to know the guests, looking especially for those who might be of use in your investigation. You may become Cursed to draw a random Ally.

situation: Magic seems to inherently manipulate your environment in unpredictable ways.
rest: If you have 3 or more Spells, this world rejects you completely and you are lost in time and space.

situation: Mail order! Each investigator may give you money to purchase a single Common Item of his or her choice at list price. Place the items facedown in front of you. If you enter the same location as the investigator who requested the item, give it to him and receive $1 from the bank as a delivery fee.

Making your way through the private wards, you come across a poor old soul who has recently passed away, but has not yet been noticed by the orderlies. Sitting on the table near him is a gold watch. You may
rest: gain $4, but if so, you must pass a Luck (-1) check or be Cursed.

situation: Marie Bishop, the local schoolmarm, approaches you as you rest on a bench. Chatting with her, you are surprised at the depth of her occult knowledge and her willingness to share it.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Maybe you shouldn't have eaten that strangely-colored fruit.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, then make a Fight (-1) check. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Meandering down a forgotten aisle of books, you come across an open tome lying on the floor. Do you put it back on the shelf, or read it? If you put it back on the shelf,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, a piece of paper flutters out as you pick it up. Reading it, you gain 5 Clue tokens. If you fail, the tome has an evil aura surrounding it. You are Cursed. If you read the book, you learn a new spell. Draw 1 Spell, discarding it and drawing another if you already have it.

situation: Membership has it privileges.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to draw Unique Items equal to the number of successes. You may purchase any of the items drawn, using any combination of money, Clue tokens (1 Clue token

situation: Mingling with the congregation proves easier than you thought it would.
rest: Draw one Innsmouth Look card and make a Sneak (+0) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Miriam Beecher claims to have a healing salve in stock and offers to sell you some. You may
rest: spend $3 to recover up to 2 Stamina.

situation: Miriam Beecher eyes you carefully. "Hmm, if we're going to survive, I'd better teach you this."
rest: Draw 2 Spells, keeping 1 and discarding the other.

situation: Miriam Beecher is kneeling by a grave, apparently talking to someone you can neither see nor hear.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to hear her half of the conversation. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Miriam Beecher looks deep into your heart. "Prove to me your courage and I'll do what I can to aid you." For every monster trophy you have,
rest: gain 1 Stamina or 1 Sanity.

situation: Miriam Beecher looks up as you enter the shop. "It's about time you arrived. I have a job for you to do."
rest: Take the first Mission from the Unique Item deck.

situation: Miriam Beecher offers to cast a particularly potent and dangerous spell for you...for a price. If you are willing,
rest: spend $5 then draw a monster at random from the monster cup. If it has a moon dimensional symbol, discard it and draw again. Otherwise, return that monster and all monsters that share its dimensional symbol to the cup.

situation: Miriam Beecher offers to cleanse your aura and restore your mental well-being, for a price. If you
rest: discard 1 Unique Item and pay $3, you are Blessed.

situation: Miriam Beecher offers to teach you the spell you need. You may
rest: pay $5 to search the Spell deck and take any one Spell you want. If you turn down her offer, nothing happens.

situation: Miriam Beecher offers to trade spells with you. You may
rest: discard 1 Spell to draw a new one from the Spell deck.

situation: Miriam Beecher talks to you for awhile, explaining some very interesting theories she has concerning the Mythos.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Miriam Beecher thrusts a book into your hands. Taking a cursory glance through it, you notice that several pages are blank. She explains that a dark presence is erasing the knowledge it contains.
rest: Take a number of Clue tokens equal to six minus the number of elder sign tokens on the board.

situation: Miriam Beecher, the shopkeeper, peers closely at your face, then screams, "They've marked you! Get out! Get out!" and throws you out.
rest: Move to the street and lose 1 Sanity from this unsettling incident.

situation: Miriam looks into your face, and you feel as though you're being judged. "I see. Your heart is in the right place. Tell me of your travels, and perhaps I can help you in return."
rest: Gain 1 Clue token for every gate trophy you have.

situation: Mixed in with the other trash from the site, you spot an oddly-shaped object wrapped in canvas.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to retrieve it without drawing attention to yourself. If you pass, search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. Clearly someone was trying to hide the evidence of a criminal activity. If you fail, you decide not to risk being caught and leave it alone.

situation: Monsters lurk everywhere.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check or stay here next turn.

situation: Move quickly, or you'll be surrounded before you can escape with your prize!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to draw a Unique Item. If you fail, you are devoured.

situation: Moving quietly through the underbrush, you overhear a young woman talking to herself. She is fretting about some money her uncle owes to a rather unsavory character. If you wish, you may
rest: give her $5 to pay the debt. If you do, she introduces herself as Corinna Jones and asks if she can help you in any way. Take her Ally card if it's available. If it is not, gain 1 Skill as she teaches you something useful in exchange for your help.

situation: Muttering a quick prayer, you hope that the grate is weak enough to remove, since it's the only way forward that you've found so far.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or stay here next turn.

situation: Near the cells, you find a small medical kit. It appears as if it's never been opened.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: Neil buys a worthless, but odd-looking trinket from you.
rest: Gain $1.

situation: Neil has taken a liking to you, so he gives you the extended tour.
rest: You are delayed while he goes into painstaking detail. But you do learn a lot. Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Neil is amazed to see you, saying he just had a dream about you last night.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, his prescient dream proves useful. Gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, the nightmare he describes unnerves you. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Neil is wondering if you would be willing to trade. You may
rest: choose 1 Unique Item of yours to discard. Then gain 1 Unique Item. If the list price of the item you gained is less than that of the item you discarded, gain an additional Unique Item.

situation: Neil is worried that people are blaming him for all the strange things that are happening. He's very upset, and it takes a lot of convincing to assure him that he's not the target of a lynch mob.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Neil offers to sell you a book. You may
rest: pay $3 to take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck.

situation: Neil rambles on as he gives you the guided tour. It's entertaining, but ultimately useless. Nothing happens.
Neil rubs an ancient carving. "Those who've touched it say they can feel its power." You may
rest: pay $1 to touch it. If so, pass a Luck (-3) check to gain 1 Skill. If you fail the check, lose 3 Sanity. If you don't pay, nothing happens.

situation: Neil shows you a dried out cat-thing in a jar of alcohol. You may
rest: pay $1 to examine it closer, making a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you gain 3 Clue tokens. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity. If you don't pay, nothing happens.

situation: Neil shows you a grey, warty thing in a jar. As you stare, it slowly opens it eyes and meets your gaze. You may
rest: pay $1 to pass a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you gain 2 Clue tokens and draw 3 Spells, keeping 1 of them. If you don't pay or fail the check, nothing happens.

situation: Neil shows you his collection of primitive items. Something among them catches your eye.
rest: Draw 1 Unique Item. You may buy it for its list price plus $1.

situation: Neil shows you his collection of unusual stuffed animals. Seems he likes to practice taxidermy in his spare time. Silently, you resolve not to accept anything to drink from him.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token from examining the animals.

situation: Neil tells you that there was a strange man from Dunwich here asking about rare books.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to recognize the names of the books. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: Nephren-Ka places your soul upon the Balance of Thoth, and finds you lacking. First
rest: discard Stamina or Sanity, whichever is higher, until your Stamina and Sanity are equal. Then you are surprised by a monster. If you defeat it, you may draw 1 Exhibit Item.

situation: Nets Foster tries to sell you one of his wooden carvings. They're worthless, but he's a convincing salesman.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose $2.

situation: Next to a weathered chair in front of the Whateleys' home is a torn up scholastic journal about ancient books. the language is a bit dense but you struggle through.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Night falls, and you witness the vegetation of the area glowing and squirming of its own accord.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: No one appears to be home, and you've heard tales that the old man who lives here has a stash of money. You may choose to
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you discover some of it. Gain $10. If you fail, you are caught in the act. Move to the street, and you are Cursed.

situation: No one is manning the shop, but an intriguing item is sitting on the counter.
rest: Draw 1 Unique Item. You may either discard it, keep it and pay its list price, or keep it without paying for it and be Cursed.

situation: No path can be discerned and the towering peaks make it difficult to keep your bearings.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, you have lost your way. Move to the first area of the Dreamlands and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: No sound is allowed in the great library but the rustling of pages and the whisper of thoughts.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check or you are delayed.

situation: No wildlife of any kind will approach this barren field and the silence is unnerving.
rest: Make a Will (+1) check and lose 3 Sanity, reducing the amount of Sanity lost by 1 for each success rolled (to a minimum of 0).

situation: Noatalba is performing a ritual to open the doors between Carcosa and other places. You may come closer to learn what he's doing or stay a safe distance away. If you approach,
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you learn his secret. Search the Spell deck and take the Control Gate spell, if it is available. If it is not, gain 3 Clue tokens. If you fail, you disturb his ritual and a monster appears. If you stay a safe distance away, you learn much, perhaps too much. Roll 3 dice and gain 1 Clue token for each success. If all 3 dice roll successes gain a Madness card.

situation: Nodens wishes to thwart the forces of the Ancient One. You may
rest: choose 1 monster in Kingsport and 1 in Dunwich, each with 2 or less toughness, and remove them from the board. Then discard 1 item, if able, which Nodens claims as tribute.

situation: North of where these Dreamlands intersect those of alien reaches, you must
rest: make a Luck (+0) check. Your Sanity is reduced to the number of successes rolled.

situation: Not only have you not been provided with a key to your door, but the deadbolt has been removed.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to find somewhere else to sleep and move to the street. If you fail, you are delayed and lose 1 Stamina and 2 Sanity when they come for you...

situation: Nothing but emptiness.
rest: No encounter.

situation: Noticing a glint on the floor, you discover a silver dollar someone must have dropped.
rest: Gain $1.

situation: Noticing an older gentleman slip on the trail up ahead, you
rest: move to catch him. If you pass a Speed (-1) check, he introduces himself as Basil Elton, and-- seeing something in your eyes-- offers his services. If his Ally card is available, take it, then close the North Point Lighthouse for the rest of the game and move to the street.

situation: Noticing you eying the holy water, Father Michael tells you, "Take what you need, my child."
rest: You may search the Unique Item deck for a Holy Water card and take it.

situation: Nuguth-Yug demands homage be paid to Nodens, his lord.
rest: Discard any number of Clue tokens, then roll that many dice. Your Sanity and Stamina are reduced to the number of successes you roll. If they are reduced to zero, or if you had no Clue tokens to discard, you are devoured

situation: Nurse Heather accidentally injects you with a sleeping draught. You may
rest: make a Fight (-2) check to resist. If you fail or choose not to resist, lose your next turn and gain 2 Sanity from the prolonged rest. If you pass, nothing happens.

situation: Nurse Heather is coming!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to hide in time. If you pass you see her drop something as she walks by. Draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, she throws you out. Move to the street.

situation: Nurse Sharon asks for your help in organizing some records that were accidentally dropped and scattered.
rest: Pass a Lore (+0) check to gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Nurse Sharon offers to bandage up your wounds.
rest: Gain 2 Stamina.

situation: Nurse Sharon slips something into your hand when the doctor isn't looking.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to keep anyone else from noticing. If you do, you later examine the object and find it to be an old parchment with a spell scratched on it. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, an orderly takes it away from you and you gain nothing.

situation: Obscene fungal growths tower above, but all is silent. Nothing happens.
Of what use, in such a place, is but a single thread, to suspend such a vital thing as your lucid thinking? Better to surrender than to dangle in such a precarious state.
rest: If you have only 1 Sanity, you are devoured.

situation: Old Ben James is visiting St. Eramus's Home for Retired Mariners to spin an entertaining yarn for the old sea dogs.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to recognize a helpful fact buried in the story and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Old Harney Jones sits on his porch whittling a piece of wood. You sit and chat with him a while,
rest: gaining some valuable insights into Dunwich. Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Old Sadie Sheldon, leader of the Sheldon Gang, is here. "Hmm. Do you think you have what it takes to join my gang?" If you
rest: spend at least 5 toughness worth of monster trophies or 1 gate trophy, she accepts you into the gang. Take a Sheldon Gang Membership card. If you do not spend the trophies, she has her boys throw you out. Move to the street and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Oliver Thomas has an extremely rare book on display, but it is not for sale. He's willing to let you have a look at it.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to quickly memorize as much as you can of this informative text. Gain 1 Clue token for each success you roll.

situation: Oliver Thomas, the owner of the Curiositie Shoppe, stops by with a gift for Ma. "Landsakes, what do I need with more knickknacks? Here, you give it someone who can actually use it!"
rest: Draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: Oliver Thomas, the shopkeeper, greets you enthusiastically. "There was an item here earlier that I just knew was meant for you. I'm not sure where it went, but I imagine if it was meant to be, you'll be able to find it."
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: Oliver Thomas, the wizened old owner of the Curiositie Shoppe, offers you a fortune cookie. Thanking him, you open it, only to be overcome by a wave of dizziness as a hazy vision of the future rushes past your eyes.
rest: You may search the mythos deck for any one card and return it to the box.

situation: On a high shelf is a puzzle box. You may
rest: spend $1 to purchase it and then pass a Lore (-1) check and consult the following chart to determine what's inside: Successes:  0) Nothing 1) Gain $3 and a Clue token 2+) Draw a Spell and gain $5

situation: On the Healing of Mind and Spirit is the title of the book you find sitting, unattended, on one of the end tables in the lounge. Intrigued, you flip through its pages. Restore
rest: your Sanity to its maximum and gain a Clue token.

situation: On the face of one of the granite mountains, in letters larger than any house you've ever seen, a message is written in a language you are somehow able to interpret. The message informs you of how to warp reality and control the doors between reality, but it also warns of terrible dangers that threaten any who do so. If you attempt to control the doors between realities,
rest: make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass the check, search the Spell deck for the Control Gate spell and take it. If the spell is not available, nothing happens. If you fail the check, draw a monster for each open rift and place the monster on the rift's current location. If there are no open rifts, nothing happens. If you do not attempt to control the doors, gain 3 Clue tokens and you are Cursed.

situation: On the far side of this cavern is a glittering idol that you're certain is important, if only you can reach it.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you may take your choice of 1 Unique Item or 3 Clue tokens. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina, move to the first area of R'lyeh and are delayed.

situation: On the front lawn a group of children hold hands and circle around a dead bird, chanting words you don't recognize.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass draw 1 Spell.

situation: On the horizon, you see the hazy silhouette of the Ancient One.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose all your Sanity.

situation: On the loading dock you investigate a large crate with strange markings.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you find a very unusual item in the crate. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, Deputy Dingby catches you breaking it open. You are arrested and taken to the Police Station.

situation: On the wall is a map of the city with pins marking the places where incidents have occured. Imagining lines between these points, an unnerving symbol is revealed to you.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Once you are standing on the front step, you feel yourself start to sway as if you were at sea. A cool breeze brings the scent of the ocean and you feel refreshed.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: One glimpse at the sky and things fall into place for you.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: One of the Lodge brothers has a valuable opportunity for you.
rest: Take the first Task card from the Common Item deck. However, thanks to your connections in the Lodge, place 1 Clue token on it to begin (you may skip the first location on the card).

situation: One of the Lodge brothers notices your distress and casts a spell to help you. Restore either
rest: your Stamina or Sanity to its maximum. If both are already at your maximum, then you are Blessed instead.

situation: One of the Lodge brothers pulls you aside after a meeting. "I had a very disturbing dream last night. It told me that something terrible would happen unless I gave you this." So saying, he presses $5 into your hands.
rest: Gain $5.

situation: One of the Society members is heading over to the library to do some research and offers you a ride. If you accept,
rest: move to the Library and draw 2 cards, encountering one card of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: One of the Wireless Station workers is driving up in a truck. If you wish, you may
rest: make a Speed (-1) check to grab the back. If you pass, move to the Wireless Station and immediately have an encounter there. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: One of the bags unloaded from the train into Dunwich doesn't seem to have anyone claiming it. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check to discretely open it up and see what's inside. If you pass, you discover $3 inside. If you fail, you are spotted and arrested for attempted theft.

situation: One of the bigger men in the bar challenges you to a game of darts. You must
rest: pay $1 to play, since bets are placed up front. Then, make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you win with a big bullseye. Gain $3. If you fail, the big guy claps you on the shoulder and says, "No hard feelings, eh? I'll buy you a drink." Gain 1 Sanity. If you cannot pay, nothing happens.

situation: One of the campus police overhears you talking about the occult and gently escorts you off campus, leaving you in Independence Square. Immediately
rest: move to Independence Square and have an encounter there.

situation: One of the classrooms is closed today and students are not allowed to go in. Inside you find animal blood was painted on the walls as part of some horrific rite.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the doctors is struggling to wrestle an object from the grip of an unmoving man on a gurney. "I'm sorry. We're a little short on staff right now. Could you help me?" If you help,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check to pry the item free. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, gain 1 Common Item and lose 1 Sanity as the man's hand comes loose from his arm.

situation: One of the doctors seems especially interested in your dreams. "Dreams are the key to the subconscious, and you clearly have some very deep-seated issues." Amazingly, telling someone else about your nightmares seems to free you of them.
rest: Stay here next turn and restore your Sanity to its maximum value.

situation: One of the doctors tells you about an experimental treatment that might help you. It's expensive, however. You may
rest: pay $5 to roll a die. On a success, discard one of your Injury cards. On a failure, gain 2 Stamina.

situation: One of the doctors tries hypnotic therapy to allow you to tap into your subconscious. You have strange visions of faraway places and times that allow you to reach a greater understanding of yourself.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 2 Clue tokens.

situation: One of the fishermen has had too much to drink and is muttering to himself about monsters in the water. If you
rest: spend the time to take care of him, yo are delayed. If you do so, he tells you more and more of his experiences on the sea. Make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success.
