situation: One of the fishermen tells you it's a dangerous business you've gotten mixed up in and he offers to sell you something to help. You may
rest: spend $3 to search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find.

situation: One of the foremen asks if you're one of the engineers.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to pass yourself off as a technical specialist. If you fail, move to the Causeway and have an Encounter there.

situation: One of the headstones has a strange riddle inscribed on it.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to interpret it. If you pass, you press a button hidden among the various symbols adorning the grave to reveal a secret compartment and gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: One of the jail's "guests" decides to end it all rather than face justice, and Deputy Dingby offers you a pick of his belongings.
rest: Pass a Luck (+0) check to draw a number of cards from the Common Item deck equal to the number of successes rolled. Keep 1 card and discard the rest.

situation: One of the janitors receives strange gifts from the faculty every Christmas. He offers to sell you " one o' them thar kooky books 'r thingamajigs." If you
rest: pay him $5, you may draw 1 Exhibit Item or Unique Item.

situation: One of the kind old men who live here offers you a strange carving.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: One of the men in the holding cells tries to intimidate you with stories about the things he's seen.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue Token. If you fail, move to the street and lose 1 Sanity as the man laughs at your retreating back.

situation: One of the neighborhood men is throwing out some old papers, and you catch a glimpse of something interesting. "Mind if I look at these?" you ask politely. Scowling a bit, the man shrugs, "Suit yourself, it's just trash."
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: One of the night watchmen takes you by surprise!
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check. If you pass, you leave bruised and humbled. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: One of the old salts says he can predict a change in the weather because his knee hurts.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you may discard the Environment Mythos Card currently in play.

situation: One of the other customers in the bank recognizes you and offers you a lift.
rest: Move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: One of the other guests tells you about the shocking news from Dunwich.
rest: Roll 1 die for each Dunwich Horror token on the board. For each die that results in a failure, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the prisoners carefully searches your face for any sign of pity, "Please, you gotta get me outta here! Something's coming to Arkham! Something horrible!" You try to laugh away his concerns, but the abject terror in his voice sends a chill down your spine.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the prisoners claims to be a reporter trying to tell the truth about Innsmouth. He says he won't get free but the important thing is that his notes make it to the newspaper.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to get you hands on them. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: One of the sailors looks at you curiously. "You got family in Innsmouth?"
rest: Draw an Innsmouth Look card.

situation: One of the sailors speaks to you as if you were a shipmate from years ago. He mentions strange sea creatures.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: One of the sailors tells you a horrible story about large fish creatures pulling men under the water.
rest: If there are 3 or less uprising tokens on the Deep Ones Rising track, gain 1 Clue token. If there are 4 or more uprising tokens on the Deep Ones Rising track, gain 2 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the silhouetted forms on the horizon begins to move. A monster appears!
One of the speakers that is not currently attached to any radio equipment begins broadcasting a voice that speaks directly to you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the staff physicians talks some sense into you. You are disabused of certain crazy but accurate notions.
rest: Lose 1 Clue token.

situation: One of the steps leading upstairs has rotted through.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: One of the strange creatures wants to take one of your items.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to hold onto it. if you do not, choose 1 Common or Unique Item and discard it.

situation: One of the students has received a letter from her home in Dunwich. She's very concerned about the events that are being described.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token for each Dunwich Horror token on the board. Then lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the students volunteering at the Office of the President slips you a note concerning a strange occurrence at the Library.
rest: Move to the Library and draw 2 cards, choosing one of them to encounter, and discarding the other.

situation: One of the villagers has a prized possession of unknown origins.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+1) check to successfully claim it as he sleeps. Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: One of the warehouse foremen could use someone who's good with numbers.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. If you pass, gain $3 for every success you rolled. If you fail, he throws you out hard enough to make you bounce after checking your numbers. Lose 1 Stamina and move to the street.

situation: One of the workers catches sight of you. He looks concerned for a moment, but then just waves at you.
rest: Draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: One of the workers falls backwards into the molten metal. His screams and the foul burning smell are horrifying.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: One of the workers sneaks over to you and offers you gold in exchange for an item of yours. You may
rest: discard 1 Unique Item to gain $4.

situation: One of your Arkham acquaintances walks out of Osborn's General Store in front of you. "Hello there! Fancy meeting you here. Need a ride?" If you accept,
rest: move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Only brute strength will get you out of this stone trap.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check or you are delayed.

situation: Only the strongest of will may enter the Lodge's prized library.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you gain 3 Clue tokens and may search the Spell deck for any one Spell and take it. If you fail, you lose your Silver Twilight Lodge Membership.

situation: Other customers are intrigued by your knowledge of the items in the shop. The more you describe the histories of these objects, the more people purchase.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. If you pass, Oliver Thomas is so grateful for your help with sales that he offers you $3 for your efforts.

situation: Others' nightmares are not meant to be witnessed, even indirectly.
rest: Lose either 2 Sanity or 1 Stamina.

situation: Out of the darkness, a monster appears! If you defeat it, return to Arkham.
Outside the cave, someone hung a package from a tree, presumably to keep it safe from curious wildlife.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check to see if the contents have been left alone. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: Outside the door of this house you see light reflecting off something small that's half-buried in the dirt.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find an old Spanish douloon. Gain $3. If you fail, it's just a bit of broken glass.

situation: Outside the house, you feel youself slipping away, as if your very soul were being pulled out of your body.
rest: Make a Will (+1) check to resist. If you fail, the experience leaves you permanently affected. Draw 1 Madness Card.

situation: Overdue book fines of $4. Pay up, or
rest: move to the street!

situation: Painted faintly upon a stone, you see an image of a primitive figure invoking otherworldly forces. Suddenly, an ominous shadow moves across the stone.
rest: Gain 1 Spell and then a monster appears.

situation: Part of your clothing has gotten wrapped up in one of the gears of the foundry.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check to free yourself. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as the gears bite into you.

situation: Participating in the monthly ceremony, you witness great power and great evil.
rest: Lose up to 3 Sanity and gain that many Clue tokens.

situation: Passing a thin, pale artist who has a nasty twitch, you glance at one of his paintings and your horrified gaze is immediately captured.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity and become delayed as you faint upon seeing the nightmarish creature he has depicted.

situation: Passing by a mirror, you are startled to see yourself wearing a mask. You feel terrified to take the mask off. If you leave it on,
rest: lose 1 Sanity. If you take it off, draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: Pausing to wipe your brow, you make your way to the bathroom. Happily, the water still works, so you wash your face. However, after a moment, the cool water turns hot and sticky. Opening your eyes, you find that you are washing your face in blood pouring from the faucet and let out a shriek of terror.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or draw 1 Madness.

situation: Pausing, you stop to admire the clear blue sky. Nothing happens.
Pay your monthly dues of $3 or
rest: lose 2 Sanity from strange dreams sent to you by Carl Sanford when he kicks you out of the Order. If you are kicked out, lose your Silver Twilight Lodge Membership.

situation: Peering around the corner into a back alley, you watch in horror as a mass of white worms crawls out of a gnarled old man's body. They envelope a hobo tied up nearby, disappearing into the man's flesh and eating him alive.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or roll a die and lose that much Sanity. Even if you pass, lose 1 Sanity unless you are immune to Nightmarish.

situation: Peering up at the towers of the city, the rising moon appears to you to be in front of them rather than behind.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: People have been complaining that Harney has snapped and has been shooting his gun off into the air. Harney tells you that his mind is as sound as ever, but that he has been firing his rifle. Choose 2 monsters in the Sky and return them to the monster cup.
rest: If there are no monsters in the Sky, gain 1 Clue token instead.

situation: People have been disappearing off the coast.
rest: If you have 3 or more Clue tokens, you're fairly certain you can explain what's going on, and the fishermen are willing to help however they can. You may move to any aquatic location. If you do, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Perhaps there's something of use here?
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to either draw 1 Unique Item or draw 1 Common Item and gain $2. If you fail the check, nothing happens.

situation: Perusing the county records, you discover something horrifying about your family tree.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Picking your way between the dead plants, you come across an old man gathering some strange fungus. He introduces himself as Zebulon Whateley and ask if you know the Art. If you
rest: discard 1 Spell, take his Ally card. If it's isn't available, gain 4 Clue tokens instead.

situation: Picking your way between the dead plants, you come across an old man gathering some strange fungus. He introduces himself as Zebulon Whateley and asks if you know the Art. If you
rest: discard 1 Spell, take his Ally card. If it isn't available, gain 4 Clue tokens instead.

situation: Placing your hand on the ancient cave painting, you have a vision.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Posted to the tree trunk is a poster with your picture on it in relation to a crime you know nothing about.
rest: Take the Wanted card, if it is available.

situation: Pretending to be asleep, you listen to Constable Ropes and the other guards talk.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens and you are delayed, even if you're normally immune to being delayed.

situation: Principal Miles invites you to have lunch in the cafeteria.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: Principal Miles is hesitant to allow you in the students' lockers.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to convince him. If you pass, you discover one student's notes on a foray into the arcane arts. Gain 1 Spell.

situation: Principal Miles is looking for guest lecturers. If your Lore is currently 4 or higher,
rest: gain a Retainer card.

situation: Principal Miles is suspicious of your presence at his school.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or be arrested and go to the Police Station.

situation: Principal Miles is very interested in acquiring more books for the library. You may
rest: discard 1 Tome in exchange for $2 more than its list price.

situation: Principal Miles shows you the work that the students have been creating in their art class. You can see one student has talent well beyond her years and a strange insight into creatures from beyond.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success as you examine her work.

situation: Professor Laban Shrewsbury shows you some of the secrets of the Great Library.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Prohibition failed to influence the proprietor of Hibb's. You drink heavily while quizzing the locals about the strange goings-on in Arkham.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you hold your liquor and learn something. Gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you pass out. Move to the street and either have 1 item (your choice) or all of your money stolen.

situation: Pulling up next to you, Sheriff Engle turns on his lights and siren. "I'm sorry, but I've had a complaint and need to take you in." You are arrested.
Pulling yourself up the cliff, you come face to face with a snake.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity, 1 Stamina, and move to the Harborside streets.

situation: Rain makes the trail slippery and treacherous.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and over to the Causeway.

situation: Reading one of the bibles in the pews, you seek spiritual guidance. Letting it fall open to a page, you read, "The Lord helps those who help themselves." Oddly, it makes you feel better. You may
rest: spend 2 Clue tokens to discard the current Environment from play.

situation: Representatives from the Cult of the Black Goat are here to learn more of the Deep Ones! You may join the cult if you wish. To do so, you must
rest: discard at least 2 toughness worth of monster trophies, lose 3 Stamina, or discard an ally. Take a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership Card. If you cannot or choose not to join, pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Researching the dimensional gates that have been opening up in town, you find an arcane ritual for redirecting them.
rest: You may move any one open gate from its current location to any other unstable location without an elder sign token. Any monsters at the gate's new location are returned to the cup, and any investigators there are drawn through the gate.

situation: Resting beside the cobbled lane as the shadows grow long in the abandoned streets you wonder if you'll live to see this thing through.
rest: No encounter.

situation: Riding a spear of light, you flash through a thousand times and places.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to return to Arkham. Any monsters in the location you return to are automatically defeated and collected as trophies.

situation: Rising from the watery depths, the corpse of a murder victim floats to the surface.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but gain $3 from the grateful police who are working on the case.

situation: Rocks shift in the strange light.
rest: If you have a Lantern, you may move to the first area of any Other World of your choice. Otherwise, if you fail to pass a Luck (-2) check you are lost in time and space.

situation: Rotten food in a shipping crate has attracted a multitude of maggots. Under the repulsive feast, you see a wad of cash.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to reach through the writhing mass and take $3 per success. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and move to the street.

situation: Rotting floorboards give way beneath you.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Rowing the small boat across the turbulent lake, you are nearly pulled into the water by a grasping tentacle. As it is, you
rest: lose an item to its clutches. Lose 1 item of your choice.

situation: Run! Run for your life!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check and lose 3 Stamina, less 1 per success.

situation: Sailors from all over the world are at Falcon Point tonight. The many different languages are difficult to interpret but the wide variety of stories provide much information.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 4 Clue tokens.

situation: Scuttling surrounds you in the dark as the creatures attack.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. Alternatively, you may light a torch to drive them back and lose no Stamina, but upon seeing them, your mind recoils, and you lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Searching the school's archives, you read about the history of Kingsport.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Seeing a wooden box drift by, you seize your chance and cling to it. Only halfway to shore do you realize that the box is a coffin.
rest: Move to Falcon Point. Once ashore, you may look inside. If you do, lose 2 Sanity and draw 1 Unique item.

situation: Sensing that fortune favors you, the Sages among Zoog-kind in the Enchanted Wood turn their attention to your troubles. If you are
rest: Blessed, gain the Young Zoog Ally card, or take 5 Clue tokens if it is unavailable.

situation: Several Mi-Go up ahead are working on a strange device. They are blocking your path, so you must either pretend to be a human slave or take the long way around. If you pretend to be a slave,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, they are fooled by your act and you slip past, quietly pocketing an odd device as you do so. Draw 1 Unique Item and return to Arkham. If you fail, one of them shoots you with a strange ray-gun. You are lost in time and space. If you go around, pass a Luck (-1) check or a monster appears! Either way, you are delayed.

situation: Several blocks away, you see a group of people walking, wearing elaborate masks. You chase after them.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, they've disappeared but dropped a few gold coins. Gain $2.

situation: Several dead fish are floating in the river. Investigating, you find that it is sea water rather than fresh water.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to try to find answers. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: Several of the fish creatures are trying to chase you toward a pool of strange dark water.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to prevent yourself from being forced into the pool. If you fail, move to the first area of R'lyeh and you are delayed.

situation: Several people have complained of farm animals disappearing in the night. They're suspicious and angry, and they don't seem like they're going to let you go.
rest: You are delayed. However, if you are a member of the "One of the Thousand" Cult, you use this time to steal some farm animals and perform informative rites, gaining 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Several shuffling figures crawl out of the water near you.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to avoid their notice. If you fail, they spot you and drag you beneath the waves. Lose 1 Stamina, move to Y'ha-nthlei, and have an encounter there.

situation: Several strangely shaped footprints lead from the waterline into Innsmouth.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Sharp claws dig into your skin and pull you down into the water.
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check to free yourself. If you pass, you make it back to the reef safe and sound. If you fail, you suffered grievious harm in the process. Draw an Injury card.

situation: Sheriff Engle blocks the door into the Police Station. "Sorry, I've got to lock up for a bit. I'll be back later". Everyone in the Police Station (but not the Jail Cell) is moved to the street.
Sheriff Engle comes by to see his dear old mother and Ma cooks up a huge mess of grub for everybody.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Sheriff Engle eyes you suspiciously. "Hey, you were part of that trouble earlier."
rest: Pay him $3 or spend the next turn delayed answering his questions.

situation: Sheriff Engle is training security guards for performances of "The King in Yellow," but the training is rigorous.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to qualify. If you pass, you may search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, you lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Sheriff Engle listens to your tale. He's ready to take action, assuming that he believes you.
rest: Pass a Will (-3) check to convince him. If you do, choose one location or street area and return all monsters in it to the cup as armed law enforcement officers storm in.

situation: Sheriff Engle nods to you as you enter the Police Station. "Something I can help you with?" If you
rest: spend 3 Clue tokens, you convince him that Arkham is in danger and he issues you a weapon. Take the first Weapon from the Common Item deck.

situation: Sheriff Engle notes that you're carrying an awful lot of weapons. Either
rest: pay him $5 or discard all of your Weapons.

situation: Sheriff Engle pulls up next to you. "You're certainly off the beaten path tonight. Need a ride?" If you accept,
rest: move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Sheriff Engle trusts you and asks you to step into his office to discuss the recent strange events.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to convince him to take you into his confidence and give you something to help you out. Draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: Sheriff Engle wrestles a prisoner into the lobby of the Police Station. The handcuffed man bumps into you and whispers, "I can't be found with this."
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Common item.

situation: Shivering, you feel the light of a baleful star upon you, but upon looking up, you see only darkness where you know the star to be. Either
rest: lose 3 Sanity or you are Cursed.

situation: Shuggob will share his secrets, but won't you sample his fine meats? You may
rest: draw a Spell if you wish, but if you do, lose Sanity equal to the drawn Spell's Sanity cost.

situation: Sickly-colored steam begins to rise from invisible fissures in the earth.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to cover your mouth before breathing it in. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Silence and warmth, for a change.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Since there are no other customers in the store, the teenaged manager, who introduces himself as Brian Burnham, shares his lunch and passes an hour in pleasant conversation with you.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: Sipping coffee at a small cafe, you suddenly grasp your throat. You've been poisoned!
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to stave off its effects. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Sitting by the dock, you freeze in silent horror as something slowly rises from the water. You cannot make out what it is, but judging by the number of stars it blots out with its bulk, it is considerably bigger than a whale. After an eternity, it slowly sinks beneath the waves once more.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Sitting comfortably at an outdoor table in front of a picturesque cafe, you doze off. Have
rest: one encounter in the Dreamlands, then return here.

situation: Sitting down to chat with Gladys Pickman, you discover that the legs of your chair are uneven. She apologizes and offers you a small book to put under the chair leg.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the book is very interesting to you. Gain 1 Spell. If you fail, the book is unremarkable, but it does prevent the chair from wobbling.

situation: Sitting next to Basil Elton on the edge of a sea cliff, he tells you stories about his adventures in the Dreamlands on a White Ship, and his fateful search for fabled Cathuria-- a search that left him unable to dream ever again.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Sitting on one of a table, you find a silver whistle and a small scrap of paper with some unusual writing on it. If you
rest: pass a Lore (-1) check, then you may search the Spell deck for a Summon Shantak card and take it. If you fail, you leave the whistle there, not realizing its value.

situation: Sitting on the edge of a sheer sea cliff, Basil Elton clutches a mostly empty whiskey bottle and sings melancholy songs. Worried, you stay to make sure nothing happens to him.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Sliding into a booth, you sit on something. Picking it up, you realize that someone left an item behind. If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, it may prove useful to you. Gain 1 Common Item.

situation: Slip on wet stones and slide into a pit.
rest: Pass a Luck (+0) check to climb out. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and stay here next turn.

situation: Small, but precious stones are embedded into the wall.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: Sneaking into an open basement to snoop around, you come across an underground labyrinth of passages beneath the city. Before you can get too far, however, a monster attacks you! The nearest monster moves here and encounters you.
Sneaking into the file room, you begin looking through the patient interviews for information that could be of use to you. If you
rest: pass a Lore (-1) check, then roll a die and gain that many Clue tokens. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: Snooping around you've set off a shotgun trap!
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Some Innsmouth locals have cornered a man. If you decide to defend him,
rest: lose 3 Stamina. Even if you are knocked unconscious, the man, David Packard, is impressed by your brave act and offers you his help. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, he gives you something "for protection." You may search the Common Item deck for Dynamite and take it.

situation: Some archaeology professors seem to be having a wager, and they call you into the room to have fun at your expense. "Be a good sport, and try to pick out the antique from these fakes we made up, will you?" If you
rest: pass a Lore (-1) check, you may draw and keep 1 Unique Item.

situation: Some of the locals are cooking up some fish stew in the fireplace. After a wary glance, you are invited to join them. Restore
rest: your Stamina to its maximum.

situation: Some of this food doesn't seem very wholesome...
rest: Pass a Luck (+0) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Some prisoner from decades gone by has scrawled something on the wall.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to decipher it. If you succeed, gain a Spell.

situation: Somehow, as you race through this area, every piece of art you see has a yellow sign somewhere on it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Someone bumps into you at the crowded bar.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose $3, if able. If you don't have any money or you fail the check, nothing happens.

situation: Someone has
rest: broken into the house and ransacked everything. Make a Luck (+1) check to see if they found anything important. If you fail, add 1 doom token to the doom track.

situation: Someone has broken into the house and ransacked everything.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check to see if they found anything important. If you fail, add 1 doom token to the doom track.

situation: Someone has left a package unattended in the waiting room.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to draw 1 Unique Item before the hospital staff finds it.

situation: Someone has left their mathematics homework lying on the dining room table.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to see the deeper meanings. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: Someone has sent an anonymous package to the paper. Whatever is inside is leaking a dark, sticky fluid. Upon seeing what's inside,
rest: lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Someone has taught the locals to read ancient tongues. If you appease them by
rest: discarding a Tome, they offer you food and shelter: Gain 2 Stamina. If you do not, you lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Someone hid a precious treasure where they believed no one would dare go. Yet they did not leave it unprotected.
rest: Gain 1 Unique Item and you are Cursed.

situation: Someone left a box of donation items at the Church's doorstep. You notice an odd, grotesque idol.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: Someone left the door to the basement unlocked! There's an abundance of texts and artifacts hidden away down here, but most of it is useless to you.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Someone sneaks a book in with your other belongings.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Spell. If you fail, it is a text that describes the agonizing horrors befalling humanity. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Someone was here the night before and left behind smoldering ashes, candles, and a few drops of blood. If you
rest: pass a Luck (-2) check, you stumble upon something important and may draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: Something about the angles in the attic room opens your mind to the myriad possibilities of other, nearly identical universes.
rest: Search the Spell deck for a Spell you already have, and take another copy of it. Then, as you continue to stare into the impossible angle, a Hound of Tindalos appears!

situation: Something about the smell of this hotel is both distasteful and yet, somehow, familiar.
rest: Draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: Something about the water here terrifies you in a completely irrational way.
rest: If you have a Madness card or if your Sanity is currently 2 or less, move to the streets.

situation: Something about your presence is disturbing William Bain and he may ask you to leave, one way or another.
rest: If you have 1 or more Corruption Cards, you are lost in time and space. If you do not have any Corruption Cards, but you currently have 3 or less Sanity, move to the Wireless Station and have an encounter there. Otherwise, nothing happens.

situation: Something calls to you from the island's heart... if only you could find it!
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check or exhaust the Find Gate spell, Dynamite item, or Gate Box item to automatically pass. If you pass, you manage to create a tunnel down into the earth. Gain 1d6 Clue tokens. If you exhausted an item or spell to pass the check and gained more that 3 Clue tokens, you must discard the item or spell used.

situation: Something followed you here... if there are any monsters in the same location as the gate you entered, they appear. If they are not defeated, they remain in their original location.
Something has turned all the food in the store rancid. The shopkeeper offers to pay if you help him throw it all away. You may
rest: make a Will (-2) check to give it a try. If you pass, gain $2. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Something horrid and vast, a creature all of green and tentacles yet horribly human, lies in state in the mausoleum before you. Creatures cast from the same mold, yet merely man-sized, swarm over it in the hundreds.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens and lose 2 Sanity, then pass a Sneak (-1) check. If you fail, a monster appears!

situation: Something impossibly huge and ominous lurches across the horizon.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or its gaze, with eyes the size of planets, falls upon you, and you lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Something is here, frozen beneath the snow.
rest: Draw a monster from the cup and take it as a monster trophy, even if it has the Endless ability.

situation: Something is racing after you!
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Something offers you a deal. Either all other investigators
rest: lose their choice of 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina, or you are reduced to 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Something small bites you and flies away.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Something small scurries away from you, carrying 1 of your Common Items with it.
Sometime in the middle of the night, someone broke into the store and created arcane designs on the floor with lines of salt.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to recognize the significance. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Sometimes, violence is the answer.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to break free of your captors and return to Arkham.

situation: Somewhere in the city you hear the gentle sound of metal striking against metal. You find it very soothing but completely
rest: lose tack of time. Restore your Sanity to full. You are then delayed

situation: Somewhere in this room is something valuable!
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to find it and draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina from what you do find.

situation: Speaking with Miriam Beecher, she tells you she would be willing to trade for items, if you have anything of interest.
rest: Look at the top card of the Unique Item deck. If you want to keep it, discard one of your Unique Items or Spells.

situation: Spotting a glint of light from a nearby pile of rubbish, you
rest: move to investigate. Pass a Luck (-2) check to gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Spotting a glint of metal on the ground, you pick it up and dust it off, only to reveal a gold coin!
rest: Gain $2.

situation: Spying a strange bottle sitting in the window, you walk towards it for a closer look, only to have it begin to shake by itself, projecting an aura of malevolence towards you. Stumbling backwards in sudden terror, you
rest: lose 1 Sanity and move to the street.

situation: Squire Whateley has been robbed and you're under suspicion.
rest: Make a Loe (-1) check to establish your innocence. If you fail, you are arrested.

situation: Stairs wind upward, yet descend downward- ascend, or fall?
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: Standing before the bas-relief of Nodens in his temple in the Vale of Pnath, the air turns louder and darker at the edges of your perception.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, either lose all of your Clue tokens or roll a die. If you roll a die and get a success, nothing happens. If you roll and fail, you are Devoured.

situation: Standing before the keep at the Castle of the Great Old Ones, a gong reverberates below your ability to hear. If you are
rest: Cursed, add 2 doom tokens to the Ancient One's doom track.

situation: Standing next to one of the dead trees, near the hopyard, you look up and see a decayed noose hanging from one of the branches. You take it as a bad sign.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: Standing outside at the top of the lighthouse, the railing suddenly breaks.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to catch yourself. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina from the fall.

situation: Staring at a painting in one of the rooms, you find yourself
rest: drawn into it. Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, move to The Dreamlands. Have one encounter there and immediately return here. If you fail, move to the Abyss. Have one encounter there and immediately return here.

situation: Staring into the depths of the river, you know that you can go no further today.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Staring into the presses is like watching the flow of history passing by you. You begin to see a strange pattern to it all.
rest: Take the Visions card.

situation: Staring out across the placid waters, you look at the stars reflected in their depths and let the soft sound of the waves comfort you.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity

situation: Staring out across the sea, you see a dark ship that gleams like obsidian pass between two islands, driven by oars. After rubbing your eyes, the ship is gone.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Starving, you consider eating some of the glowing mushrooms. If you decide to do so,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, roll a die and lose that much Stamina. If you succeed, roll a die and gain that much Stamina.

situation: Stepping into one of the disused upstairs rooms, you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. Enter Another Time and have
rest: an encounter there, then immediately return here.

situation: Stinging insects swarm about you!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to find shelter. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Stopping awhile in the town of Inganok, you are presented with a small onyx statue said to bring luck. You are
rest: Blessed.

situation: Stopping to rub your aching feet, you find a silver dollar stuck to the bottom of your shoes!
rest: Gain $1

situation: Strange coins have been strewn about the glade, forming an odd symbol that pains you to see.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check to gain $1. You may continue checking until you fail, gaining $1 each time, but with the modifier decreasing by -1 with each check. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity for every $1 you've gained from this encounter.

situation: Strange currents of mystical energy flow through this area. If 2 or more rifts are open, add
rest: 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board.

situation: Strange instruments of metal and glass surround you.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you are delayed. If you pass, you may discard any number of Clue tokens, all at once, then draw a number of cards from the Unique Item or Exhibit Item deck equal to the total number of Clue tokens discarded. You may take one card from among those drawn, then discard the rest.

situation: Strange symbols are carved into the black surface of the reef.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain a Spell as you examine them.

situation: Strangely, you feel you know exactly how to navigate the twisting caverns to find the object you are sinking.
rest: Gain 1 Unique Item and draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: Strength- and knowledge?- in numbers.
rest: Take a Clue token for every investigator, including you, currently in an Other World.

situation: Strolling along the lane, you run into Gladys Pickman out weeding her garden. She takes a liking to you and the two of you
rest: spend several hours discussing the latest neighborhood gossip. You are delayed.

situation: Strolling down a quiet street, you are startled to see your mother, dead these many years. She laughs and flirts with a young man you recognize as your father. Smiling, you watch them talk awhile before going on your way. Restore
rest: your Sanity to its maximum value.

situation: Struggling to hold your breath, you cannot seem to find the surface of the mysterious sea.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: Stumbling around in the dark, you tumble down a sheer cliff.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to avoid losing 1 Common or Unique Item of your choosing.

situation: Stumbling into the church, you look up in horror to realize that you've just interrupted someone's funeral. Stammering an apology, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: Such travel 'cross the stars, these strange fungi declare, is a service for which they would have good and valuable recompense.
rest: Discard a Unique Item worth $5 or more, or else you are lost in time and space.

situation: Suddenly you notice something that you had previously missed.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Suddenly, an artist's face lights up as he sees you. "Perfect! You're just what I need for my next painting! Please, sit for me, won't you? I can't pay much, but I'll make it worth your while." If you agree,
rest: you are delayed and gain $2.

situation: Suddenly, the ground collapses underneath you!
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and move to the Causeway.

situation: Suddenly, the things you've seen make sense!
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Tak, the Vampire Prince of Karoth, deems you no threat to him. You have
rest: no encounter.

situation: Taking a shortcut through the cemetary, you are horrified when something grabs your foot.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity before you realize that you've snagged yourself on a root.

situation: Taking a wrong turn, you wind up in a supply closet and the door locks behind you.
rest: You are delayed while you wait for someone to let you out.

situation: Talking to Basil Elton about his past, he tries to teach you certain powerful rituals he witnessed during his travels.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. For each success, draw 1 Spell. Choose 1 of the Spells to keep and discard the rest.

situation: Talking to the editor, Doyle Jefferies, you realize that he could be a good source of information.
rest: You may either buy up to 3 Clue tokens for $2 each, or sell up to 3 Clue tokens for $2 each.

situation: Talking with one of the professors, he seems very interested in your intellectual potential and offers to sponsor you for a partial scholarship. You may
rest: pay $4 to draw 2 Skills, keeping one of them and discarding the other.

situation: Talking with the locals, you hear the curious tale of Enoch Conger, a local man who once claimed to have caught a mermaid. If you
rest: pass a Will (-2) check or discard a Whiskey card, you hear the more disturbing version of the story, which ends with webbed footprints leading into the sea. Gain 3 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Ten thousand worlds lie arrayed before you;
rest: you are delayed.

situation: Tentacles pull your body in an infinite number of directions... or is that your mind they are shattering, instead? Either
rest: your Sanity is reduced to 1 or your Stamina is reduced to 1.

situation: Terrible stone edifices loom above you, horrifying in their non-Euclidean splendor.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check and lose 2 Sanity, less 1 for every success.

situation: That is not dead which can eternal lie, and with strange eons even death may die! You must immediately fight Cthulhu!
rest: Since there is only one player in this combat, you need one success to remove a doom token. If you reach 0 Sanity or 0 Stamina, you are devoured. If you defeat Cthulhu, he retreats back into slumber and you may escape to Arkham immediately. The gate to R'lyeh is sealed behind you, and you may take it as a trophy. If Cthulhu is the Ancient One in play, do not fill up his doom track before this combat; also, successes allow you to temporarily flip over the doom tokens to their elder sign sides instead of removing them. Once the battle is over, regardless of the outcome, flip all of the tokens on Cthulhu's doom track back to their doom token side and continue play.

situation: That's it! That's the document you need! Quietly, you reach for it, trying not to disturb its guardian.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, search the Spell deck and take 1 Spell of your choice. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: The Ancient Ones will offer you a bargain.
rest: You may take personal power at the possible expense of the rest of humanity. If you accept the bargain, gain 1 Spell and you are Blessed. Then add 1 doom token to the doom track. If you do not accept the bargain, you are Cursed

situation: The Black Man lays his book before you. If you wish to open the book,
rest: pass a Luck (-2) check to gain 5 Clue tokens. if you fail, you are devoured.

situation: The Bloated Woman makes you an offer.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, then you may discard any amount of money, all at once, then draw a number of cards from the Unique Item deck equal to the total amount of money discarded. You may take one card from among those drawn with a value equal to or less than the amount of money discarded, then discard the rest.

situation: The Cult of the Black Goat has vandalized the church, and Father Michael asks for your help in painting over the blasphemous graffiti and cleaning up the damage. If you wish to help,
rest: you are delayed by the effort, but Father Michael Blesses you for your hard work.

situation: The Dean introduces you to an anthropology professor who gives you some insight into your investigation.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The Dean would like you to escort the visiting Dr. Ali Kafour around Arkham and show him the sights. If you agree, you
rest: gain $3 as spending money, but must take the Local Guide card.

situation: The Doctor escorts you behind a curtain where the body of some other unfortunate investigator has been laid. The corpse has been torn to shreds.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity. If you pass, you may also search the body and find a helpful item. Draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you run away screaming. Move to the street.

situation: The First National Grocery is well-stocked today. You may
rest: spend up to $3, gaining 1 Stamina for each $1 you spend.

situation: The First National delivery truck is about to leave. If you wish, a little fast-talking and $3 will get you a ride to any location in Arkham. Immediately have
rest: an encounter at your destination.

situation: The Head of the Order, Robert Marsh, has caught you snooping around!
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you endure the encounter unharmed. If not, you are Cursed.

situation: The High Priest at the great stone temple demands a sacrifice.
rest: Discard your most expensive Unique Item. If several equally expensive items qualify, choose one to discard.

situation: The Historical Society is holding more educational discussion groups than normal, thanks to the buzz of the "King in Yellow" performances.
rest: Make a (+0) check in your lowest current skill. If you pass, draw 1 Skill.

situation: The Inner Sanctum asks for your help in a banishing ritual.
rest: Discard one monster trophy with a dimensional symbol other than moon to return all monsters in Arkham with the same dimensional symbol to the cup.

situation: The Librarian seems entranced by a book whose pages ripple as if in the wind, even when she's not touching it. As you approach, she slams it shut and tells you to mind your own business. "But madam," you begin...
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck. If you fail, move to the street.

situation: The Lodge Members have gathered to perform a powerful banishment ritual.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you may either gain 2 Clue tokens or choose one monster in the same location as an open Gate and return that monster to the monster cup.

situation: The Lodge has a strange and compelling oil painting on display. Its alien landscape both fascinates and nauseates you.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The Lodge has decided to clean up the town. Choose one dimension symbol other than the moon and return all non-Spawn monsters in Arkham with that symbol to the cup.
The Lodge is always eager to trade lore.
rest: Discard any number of Spells. Gain a number of Clue tokens equal to the total Sanity cost of the Spells discarded.

situation: The Mi-Go abruptly abandon their pursuit of you. Something had scared them off. You don't plan on waiting around to find out what it is.
rest: Pass a Speed (+1) check or be devoured.

situation: The Mi-Go offer immortality... of a sort. If you accept,
rest: you are devoured, except that you keep all of your Spells, Skills, and Clue tokens, to be used with your next investigator. Then close and seal a gate to Yuggoth, if one is open.

situation: The Order of the Silver Twilight casts a banishment spell in their monthly ceremony.
rest: Spend 1 Sanity to make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, claim any one monster on the board as a trophy. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: The Psychology Department would like to perform some deep hypnosis experiments on you. If you agree,
rest: make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you make contact with a strange alien intelligence and gain 1 Spell. If you fail, the incident traumatizes you and you lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The Sea of Pitch roils, and your balance shifts as the world spins around you.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or you are delayed. The sickly phosphorescence that permeates this place does not continue into the chambers ahead. You may try to collect some of the strange substance to light your way as you continue. If you collect the eerily glowing material, you find your way out of the Underworld, but the phosphorescence burns your skin. Return to Arkham and then lose 1 Stamina. If you stumble forward into the dark without any light, make a Luck (-1) check to make your way. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: The Sheldon Gang is looking for new recruits. If you want to prove how tough you are,
rest: spend either at least 5 toughness worth of monster trophies or 1 gate trophy. If you spend the trophies, take a Sheldon Gang Membership card. If not, they rough you up and tell you to hit the road. Move to the street and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The Sheldon Gang needs someone to distribute the "product" from their hidden still.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you fail, you are arrested. If you pass, you gain $3 and may search the Common Item deck for the Whiskey card and take it.

situation: The Society members are bird watching in the woods. The janitor offers you a ride there. If you accept,
rest: move to the Woods and draw 2 cards, encountering one card of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: The Steward Who Watches denies you entry. Return to Arkham, but
rest: do not take an explored token.

situation: The University is hosting their annual fundraising gala. It costs $3 to attend. If you do,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check and consult the chart below. Successes:  0) A pleasant, but uneventful evening. 1) The Head of the Anthropology Dept. is feeling chatty. Gain 1 Clue token as he elaborates on his recent work. 2+) You've won the door prize! Draw a Common Item.

situation: The Zoogs are making so much noise you don't hear the other creatures in this forest. A monster appears. Treat this monster as if it had the Ambush special ability.
The air becomes viscous and toxic.
rest: Pass a Fight (+0) check to push your way free. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and make the check again. Continue making the check until you are free or you are knocked unconscious.

situation: The air here is too noxious. You don't think you can make it.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The air here tastes sour and burns your lungs.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The air-filled cavern you're in begins to fill with water as the tide shifts. You
rest: lose 1 Stamina and are delayed as you wait it out.

situation: The ambulance crew is heading home for the night and offers you a lift.
rest: Move to any street area or location in Arkham. If you choose to move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: The amount of fresh fish for sale is frankly suspicious. You can
rest: spend $2 to bring some samples outside, where careful investigation yields as many Clue tokens as you gain successes on a Lore (-1) check.

situation: The ancient witch Keziah Mason appears before you.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, she teaches you something of value. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, she casts a terrible spell upon you: You are Cursed.

situation: The atmosphere here is stifling.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity. If you are reduce to 0 Sanity or Stamina, you are devoured.

situation: The bank Vice President tucks something into your pocket as he passes by. "A bit of help for you and your friends," he whispers in your ear. All investigators
rest: gain $1.

situation: The bank guard starts making friendly conversation with you about the people he sees every day.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, his manager interrupts him before he can share anything useful.

situation: The bank hosts a fund drive for the arts. If you
rest: spend $1 to make a donation, you are entered in a lottery. Pass a Luck (-2) check to draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: The bank offers a special incentive to anyone who opens an account: Take out a loan and get free tickets to the next performance of "The King in Yellow."
rest: You may take out a Bank Loan if you don't already have one, gaining $12 from the loan instead of $10. However, if you do so, you also lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The bargain struck, the strange creature melds into the recesses of your consciousness.
rest: Take this card. You may pay the Sanity cost of any Spell by placing a Clue token on this card each time you would otherwise lose 1 Sanity. Discard this card when it has 3 Clue tokens on it.

situation: The barrel of a gun pokes out of a window aimed at you. "You got muh book?" You may
rest: discard a Tome. If you do, the unseen figure strikes up a conversation with you. Gain 3 Clue tokens. If you do not, you are ordered off the land. Move to the streets.

situation: The barriers between worlds have grown too thin. If two or more rifts are open, you are lost in time and space. If one or fewer rifts are open, you manage to use it to your advantage and return to Arkham.
The bells ring ten, eleven, then midnight. But what does time mean, here? If
rest: your Sanity is 3 or less, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The bodies of the drowned clutch at your ankles.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The book is a detailed account of your life. Every place you've been and everything you've thought is recorded within.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or you notice that you are perilously close to the end of the book. Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The book seems to be on every shelf you turn to examine. Finally, seeing no other option, you take it with you. You are
rest: Cursed, and take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck.

situation: The book seems to be the key to it all, but the old man asks a steep price for it. You may
rest: pay $5 to gain 1 Clue token and return to Arkham.

situation: The book you are reading is a vacuous tome of oblivion, and it begins to suck you into its pages!
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check or you are devoured. Spells may be discarded as if they were Clue tokens for this check.

situation: The book's images are so familiar, but the strange language is frustratingly indecipherable.
rest: Make a Lore (+1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. Then lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The brook is covered in a thick mist tonight. Peering into it from the bridge, you see a large shape moving through the mist, circling beneath you. Not wanting to find out what it is, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: The bruising winds make movement difficult.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The buzzing creature asks if you would prefer to see your past or your future. If you choose to view your past, the creature shows you a kaleidoscope of images from your life, many of which you had forgotten.
rest: Roll a die and gain that many Clue tokens. If you choose to look at your future, take this card. At any time, instead of rolling for a skill check, you may discard this card to get 3 automatic successes on that skill check.

situation: The buzzing language of your captors begins to make sense to you.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens. The you must pass a Luck (-1) check to avoid hearing about the origins of mankind and thereby lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The buzzing speech of the natives echoes from nearby.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to remain hidden. If you fail, the creatures find you. You wake up in St. Mary's Hospital with no memory of your trip to Yuggoth; discard 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The cafeteria food, while tasteless, is quite nutritious.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: The campfire-talk of the strange traders with their onyx-wagons proves enlightening and profitable. Either
rest: draw a Unique Item or take 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The carnival is frequently plagued by pickpockets. You must
rest: discard all of your money to a maximum of $3.

situation: The carnival is gone, with no hint that it has ever been here.
rest: No encounter.

situation: The causeway ends here at a precipice that overlooks the sea, and for one mad instant, you long to hurl yourself from the cliff.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The caverns split.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0-1: Move to the Black Cave 2: Move to The Dreamlands. 3+: You enter a dark temple. Pass a Luck (-1) check to draw a Unique Item.

situation: The ceiling beam suddenly buckles.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, move to the street. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: The chess game with the strange serpent seems to go on for days.
rest: Pass a Lore (+2) check to gain $1 for each success you roll. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: The child is wracked with pain and begins to mutate.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to gain Sanity equal to the number of successes rolled. If you fail, a monster surprises you and you suffer a -2 to all Horror checks against it!

situation: The church is having a bake sale! Everything smells delicious.
rest: Spend $1 on treats to regain 1 Stamina.

situation: The city is filled with unnerving alien angles.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to avoid touching them or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The climb across the jagged landscape is brutal. Every stone surface you touch cuts into your flesh.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The clouds overhead begin to spiral.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to make out the symbol of the Yellow Sign and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The cold air pierces through you.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. Then, if you are still conscious, make a Will (-1) check to keep moving. If you fail, you are delayed

situation: The cold chills your soul and steals your memories instead of your warmth.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or discard 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The cold winds off the ocean are taking a toll on your health.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The college's head janitor, "Jazz" Mulligan pauses in his sweeping to look you over. "Hey, I found something pretty interesting that they were throwing out of the library. I'll let you have it for $3." You may
rest: pay $3 to draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: The colors are blinding.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or stay here next turn.

situation: The conical beings here try to speak to you.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you fail, you are delayed. If you pass, you learn that they are enemies of the Ancient Ones; gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: The conical creatures wish you to return an item to your own world. They have no need for it.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: The conical entity tries to teach you some magic.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to draw 2 Spells.

situation: The constables are questioning a member of the Sheldon Gang. You think you could provide enough evidence to secure his release. If you
rest: spend at least 5 toughness worth of monster trophies or 1 gate trophy, the constables begrudgingly let him go. Impressed, the gang member tries to recruit you. Take a Sheldon Gang Membership card. If you do not spend the trophies, the constables arrest him and throw you out the front door. Move to the street and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The constables arrive in the morning to find the bars of the cell bent and all their prisoners missing. A few bloodied strips of the prisoners' clothing is all that remains. The constables do not seem notably bothered.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The constables take a keen interest in one of your more unusual possessions and are willing to trade information for it. If you
rest: discard 1 Unique Item of your choice, you may gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: The corpse you are examining isn't quite dead yet. It reaches out and grabs you by the throat.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. Then, you must fight the corpse. If you pass a Combat (-1) check, you defeat it and gain 1 Clue token. Otherwise, move to the street.

situation: The creature demands a toll.
rest: Discard a Tome or lose all of your Clue tokens and you are delayed.

situation: The creature exchanges its mind with yours for a time. You may choose to
rest: lose 1 or more Sanity, gaining an equal number of Clue tokens.

situation: The creature here demands tribute. Add to the library by
rest: discarding 1 Spell and be rewarded with 2 Clue tokens. If you do not, the creature's anger costs you 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: The creature that acts as librarian here is asleep.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to pilfer important documents and gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The creature waves its hand at you. "Blessings upon you."
rest: If you have a Curse card, you may discard it.

situation: The creature's grip is like steel!
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to break free and escape. If you fail, the creature's grip tightens with a sickening pop. You are lost in time and space.

situation: The creatures are engaged in some sort of ritual! You are immediately sucked through the open gate with the most difficult modifier (your choice if there are two equally difficult gates).
rest: If there are no open gates, nothing happens.

situation: The creatures have terrible ray guns!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to sprint for cover. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The creatures indulge in experimental surgery to find out how adaptable the human mind is.
rest: Lose 2 Sanity. Then, if you're still sane, draw 2 Spells. Choose one to keep and discard the other.

situation: The cultists thrust you forward, and the God of the Bloody Tongue surprises you! You
rest: gain a +1 to all skill checks against this monster for each Unique Item or Exhibit Item you have.

situation: The cylindered head mocks your hopes. "You'll never return home!" it cackles.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The darkness claws at your mind, obscuring what was once so clear to you.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. For each success you roll, you may keep 1 Clue token, losing the others.

situation: The darkness here is absolute.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The darkness seethes in pursuit,
rest: gaining... gaining... If your Speed is currently 2 or less, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The delighted squeal of children's laughter helps to take your mind off all of the darkness that has occupied it for so long.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: The desk clerk stops you as you go by. "This just came in for you." He hands you a telegram that reads "GET OUT OF INNSMOUTH STOP YOU KNOW TOO MUCH STOP." If you heed the telegram, move immediately to the Train Station. If you ignore it, further investigation
rest: yields 1 Clue token.

situation: The diary of an early immigrant settler in Arkham mentions a band of pagans that resided in the Woods, worshipping a vile Black Goat. If you currently possess a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership,
rest: gain 3 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity. If not, simply gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The diner in the next booth suddenly checks his watch, stands, and rushes out the door. When Velma comes over with his blue-plate special and you explain his absence, she offers it to you, on the house. "No sense throwing it out," she says.
rest: Search the Common Item deck for a Food card and take it.

situation: The dock workers are short-handed and offer you a job as a stevedore for the day.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check. If you pass, gain $3 for every success you rolled. If you fail, the boss gets tired of your lollygagging and throws you out. Lose 1 Stamina and move to the street.

situation: The docks are overloaded with shipments coming in to support the museum exhibit. No one will notice if something goes missing.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. For each success, you may draw 1 Common Item. You may keep any non-Weapon cards, and must discard the rest.

situation: The doctors allow you to observe the therapy session of one of the asylum's most disturbed patients.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to maintain your wits enough to garner useful information from his story. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. Then, whether you pass or not, lose 1 Sanity after learning of his bone-chilling experiences.

situation: The doctors insist on treating you! Ignoring any protests, they anesthetize you and start patching you up. When you come to, you're physically fine but your thoughts are pretty foggy.
rest: Gain 2 Stamina but lose a Clue token if you have any.

situation: The doctors know that something strange is going on, but don't have time to talk. If you want to question them, you'll need to look like you need medical aid.
rest: For each point of Stamina you are below you maximum, you may roll 1 die. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: The door closes with a bang! You bolt upright from the book you fell asleep over. The library is closed for the night, and you are locked in.
rest: You are delayed. However, you may search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: The door is locked and there's no answer. Seeing nothing here of further interest, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: The door slams shut behind you!
rest: Spend a turn delayed as you search for another way out.

situation: The door slams shut behind you. You are in total blackness.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check, otherwise you are delayed.

situation: The door to the Castle of the Great Old Ones opens.
rest: Pass a Will (+1) check or your fragile mind snaps. Draw 1 Madness card if you fail the check.

situation: The door to the basement seems unattended. You may
rest: attempt a Sneak (-2) check to try to investigate. If you pass, you find your way to the worship area and draw 1 Unique Item. If not, lose 1 Stamina and move to the street, as you are escorted outside by robed figures.

situation: The dust and mold on many of Neil's displays make it difficult to breathe.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to resist having a reaction to the fetid air. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The earth shakes-- is the city sinking?
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to escape. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The editor asks you to answer phones on a busy night. You pick up one call and hear nothing at first. Then you hear your name being whispered by something that can't possibly be human.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity. Then make a Speed (-2) check to activate a call trace in time. If you pass, you learn that it came from the museum exhibit. Gain 2 Clue tokens

situation: The endless forest refuses to give up its mysteries.
rest: No encounter.

situation: The enormous silhouette of some unthinkably large creature looms on the horizon. You prudently choose to travel in a different direction. You have
rest: no encounter.

situation: The entire city whispers and laughs, but the source of the sounds- if they originate anywhere at all- remains always beyond the edge of your vision. You must
rest: lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina for each Clue token you wish to keep; otherwise, discard them all.

situation: The environment here adamently refuses to conform to logic or reason.
rest: For each Clue token you have, roll a die. If the result is a "1", discard that Clue token.

situation: The faces of those you have failed erupt from the earth around you, accusing, pleading, hating.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to take the Psychic card. If you roll only 1 success, you must take either the Tainted or Harried card, and if you roll no successes, you must take both the Harried and Tainted cards.

situation: The faculty at Miskatonic is all abuzz about rumors of an invasion of exotic insect species in town. They have no time for you. You may immediately
rest: move to the Administration Building or the Library and have an encounter there.

situation: The feeble glow and warmth of the candle is enough to restore you a bit.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: The fishermen at the tavern are happy to tell some tales, provided you're picking up the tab. You may
rest: discard a Whiskey card or spend $5 to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The fishermen prove to be friendly and raucus.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity but lose 1 Stamina as they keep you awake all night with their songs and stories.

situation: The floor is crumbling beneath you!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check or be lost in time and space.

situation: The fog fills your lungs, trying to change you.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to resist or gain one Corruption card.

situation: The fumes in the air here make you feel woozy and you have to sit down.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: The fumes overcome you at last, causing you to sink into a dreamless sleep.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: The further back you look, the more the school's records are incomplete and disorganized, but you find some remarkable things among the paperwork.
rest: Draw 2 Spells, choose 1 to keep and discard the other. But the long search results in you being delayed.

situation: The gable room faces east and brings in clean air from the sea. You
rest: gain 1 Stamina immediately, and may stay here next turn in order to gain an additional 2 Stamina.

situation: The gazebo seems to swell with menace and you dare not approach.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or move to the street.

situation: The ghouls show you a secret tunnel under the graveyard. Return to Arkham, but
rest: lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The ghouls want to transform you into one of them!
rest: You may either fight them or allow their corrupting influence to affect you. If you attempt to fight against them, make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity as you free yourself from their foul influence. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina in the course of the struggle. If you allow yourself to be exposed to their corrupting influence, gain 2 Corruption cards and increase your maximum Stamina by 1.

situation: The gold bars are still searing hot, but no one is around. You may
rest: lose up to 3 Stamina. Gain $2 for every 1 Stamina you lose.

situation: The golden city of your dreams is threatening to become an obsession.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or stay here next turn to hunt for it.

situation: The graffiti on the walls is actually Egyptian hieroglyphics.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. You may draw cards from the Spell deck equal to the number of successes, and keep one of them.

situation: The granite peaks are nearly impossible to pass.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina and then make a Fight (-1) check. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: The great mountain chain shakes, and every corner of your reality with it.
rest: Roll one die for each open gate. For every failure, discard either a Clue token or an item.

situation: The ground beneath your feet gives way suddenly and you drop down for what seems forever.
rest: Move to the first area of the Underworld, have an encounter there, and then immediately return here.

situation: The ground has been dug up in several places, and you think you may be able to find tracks of the creature that was digging.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token if you pass.

situation: The ground is covered with a strange luminescent substance.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check to keep yourself safe from its damaging effects. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: The ground is giving way!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to escape; otherwise you are delayed.

situation: The ground is littered with typed notes from a play that mentions you by name as a character! The pages provide directions for you. Will you follow the script? If you do follow the script,
rest: lose 2 Sanity. Then, if you are still sane, return to Arkham. If you do not follow the script, make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, a monster appears.

situation: The ground shakes and a crevasse opens beneath you, threatening to swallow you.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: The ground shifts under you feet, sending you tumbling head over heels.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The guards leave you alone for a while, so you examine your cell wall. Pushing aside some loose stones, you crawl out the tight opening to freedom and then replace the stones.
rest: Move to Sawbone Alley.

situation: The guards leave you alone for awhile, so you examine your cell wall. Pushing aside some loose stones, you crawl out the tight opening to freedom and then replace the stones.
rest: Move to Sawbone Alley.

situation: The guards of the sanitarium are aware that there is an intruder.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to escape. If you pass, move to the street. If you fail, you are arrested and taken to the Police Station.

situation: The gypsies are singing and dancing. You may join them.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens as you realize what they're singing about. If you fail, the gypsy spell is completed and a gate appears!

situation: The halls are too crowded with students to proceed.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: The heavy, fetid musk of the fungus drives you down towards unconsciousness. You must
rest: pass a Will (-2) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: The hideous whistling fills your ears.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The home was formerly a mansion in the early days of Kingsport. One of the caretakers points out graffiti scratched into the basement's stonework from the 18th century.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, the city's history becomes cleare to you. Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The hooved, wide-mouthed traders of this land are wealthy, but dangerous. You may
rest: make a Lore (-2) check to trade with them. If you pass, gain $6. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The horror within erupts from your own throat and attempts to choke you. You
rest: lose Stamina equal to the number of points of Sanity you are currently short of your maximum.

situation: The hospital has a ward for special cases, but it is off-limits to the public.
rest: Make a Sneak (-3) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success you roll.

situation: The house calls to you. If you follow its voice, it tells you which floorboards to pry up. You may
rest: draw 1 Unique item or Exhibit Item, but must also take the Tainted card.

situation: The house suddenly fills with terrible wails and screams.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The huge book opens noiselessly at your approach. If you choose, you may read it, in which case you must
rest: pass a Fight (-1) check to defeat its guardian. If you do, draw 3 Spells and keep 2 of them. If you fail, lose 3 Stamina.

situation: The humidity and heat is exhausting.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The ice beneath your feet begins to crack. You need to move fast to get back on solid ground.
rest: Make a Speed (+1) check. If you fail, large chunks of ice smash into you as you fall endlessly into the darkness. Lose 2 Stamina and you are lost in time and space.

situation: The ice bridge begins to crack.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or fall into the icy depths. If you fall, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The icy weather has damaged one of your items beyond repair.
rest: Discard 1 Common or Unique Item of your choice. If you have no items, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The icy wind howls through the endless tunnels with no sign of relief.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The icy winds bite at you as you struggle through the deep snow. You have to find shelter, and soon. Do you enter a nearby cave or follow a plume of smoke? If you enter the cave,
rest: pass a Luck (-2) check or 2 monsters appear! If you defeat the monsters or they do not appear, draw either 2 Common Items or 1 Unique Item. If you follow the smoke, you are led to a small hut. Inside is a strange, dark-skinned corpse wrapped in thick furs. If you take the furs, you are Cursed but return to Arkham. If you do not, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The icy winds tear at your flesh, and the palins seem endless.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina, and pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity. If Ithaqua is the Ancient One, the modifiers for these rolls are both reduced to -3.

situation: The inhuman ghosts of Sarnath grope and grasp at your flesh as you run through the city in terror.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The inmates begin to chant in unison, screaming about the "black Kem of Re and Amen, Isis, and Osiris!" It nearly drives you mad - but that which doesn't kill you only makes you stronger.
rest: If your Will is 1 or lower, you may search the Skill deck and take the Will card.

situation: The insanity of this place finally hits you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The island has begun to sink back beneath the waves. If you do not hurry, the ocean will swallow you as well!
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or you are reduced to 0 Stamina.

situation: The item you have been hoping to purchase has already been sold.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to sneak a peek at the ledger to see who purchased it. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: The journey proves fruitful.
rest: Draw 1 Spell.

situation: The landscape around you begins to shift and reshape itself.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you recognize this place and may move to the first area of any Other World and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The last guest to stay in your room had to leave in a hurry and left something behind.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: The leading lady of "The King in Yellow" arrives via a steamer packet from the coast. She confuses you for a porter and hands you her bags to carry.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, she leaves one of them with you as a souvenir. Draw 1 Common Item. If you fail, she accuses you of trying to steal it and you are arrested.

situation: The librarians are nowhere to be seen.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to draw Unique items equal to your successes, keeping any Tomes that you draw and discarding the rest.

situation: The library has come into possession of an unidentified gramophone record. It is a recording of a strange language no one on the staff can interpret.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to see if you can make sense of the message. If you pass, you gain 1 Spell.

situation: The light filtering down through the forest trees is fading rapidly, but the clearing gives you an uneasy feeling. Camp here or press on in the dark? If you camp, a monster attacks you as you settle down for the night.
rest: You automatically fail any Evade checks you make against this monster. However, if you defeat it, draw your choice of 1 Spell, 2 Common Items, or 1 Unique Item. If you press on into the night, you get lost in the woods. You are delayed.

situation: The light illuminates strange shapes in the sky!
rest: Lose 1 Sanity for each monster in the Sky. Then, if you have not gone insane, choose 1 monster token in the Sky to return to the monster cup.

situation: The light of the moon seems to bend and twist the night around you into fearsome shapes.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: The light of the stars is gathered here, on this distant planet. Curious, you bathe yourself in it and find yourself healed and transfigured. Either restore
rest: your Stamina to its maximum value or discard one of your Injury cards.

situation: The lighthouse is in need of fixing before the sun sets.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to help Basil Elton get it working again in time. If you pass, you feel happy to have helped. Gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, you are delayed while you continue working into the night to get the light repaired. Then, whether you passed or not, Basil gratefully pays you $1 for your efforts.
