situation: The lights and sounds are affecting your senses. Everywhere you look, the carnival workers and patrons alike seem to be wearing grotesque clown makeup and laughing madly at you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity

situation: The lights go out; you hear chanting and feel a knife at your throat. You may: 1) Flee.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina and move to the street. 2) Allow them to cast their ritual upon you. Lose 2 Stamina, but take the Visions card and gain 1 Clue token. 3) Attempt to take control of the ritual with a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, the Lodge offers you a Silver Twilight Membership. (errata: the following was not printed) If you fail, lose 3 Stamina and all of your Spells, then move to the street.

situation: The line stretches on forever. However, you hear two people in front of you whispering something important.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, but stay here next turn.

situation: The lines of businessmen. The tellers at their alters. The communion of the safety deposit room. In a flash of insight, or perhaps madness, you realize that a bank is simply another form of church and that whatever god it is consecrated to is watching you. You may
rest: spend any or all of your Sanity. After spending the Sanity, roll 1 die for each point you spent. If you rolled any successes, you are Blessed.

situation: The loathsome villagers send out their strongest warrior to fight you in unarmed combat.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to defeat him and draw 1 Unique Item and gain 1 Clue token. Otherwise lose 1 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: The longer you
rest: spend in this desolate place, the more it erodes your mind. If you are in the first area of the Underworld, lose 1 Sanity. If you are in the second area of the Underworld, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The mad scientist cackles as he pulls down on the lever of his machine.
rest: Pass a Speed (+1) check to reach the giant gem that powers it in time and gain $4. If you fail, you are thrown through a portal. Draw a Gate card, move to the Other World listed first, and have another encounter there.

situation: The majority of the workers didn't show up today. The ones who did are wandering around in a daze. Take 1 Common Item, as no one is watching the equipment, but
rest: lose 1 Sanity from the strange behavior of the people.

situation: The man at the bar next to you is deep in his cups.
rest: Pass a Luck (+0) check to realize that he's a loan officer from the Bank. He is so drunk that he barely remembers his name. You may gain a Bank Loan from him, or if you have a Bank Loan already, may convince him that you have paid it off, and may discard the Bank Loan card.

situation: The man in the corner asks you for a match. You can tell right away, he's not ordinary.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to be Blessed.

situation: The mariners are comparing coins from different countries. You recognize the runes carved on one of the coins as being from a very early culture.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The meeping of the ghouls in the tunnels echoes in your ears.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The members are extremely concerned about something regarding the celestial bodies being "changed" by some outside force.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check to gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you are pushed out into the street.

situation: The members are extremely concerned about the celestial bodies being "changed" by some outside force, ask you to investigate.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you gain 2 Clue tokens and draw a Spell to aid you on your mission.

situation: The members of the order have identified you as an outsider!
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check. If you pass, you move to the streets before you are caught. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: The men unloading those boxes have stooped postures and wide, staring eyes. If you try to investigate what they're doing,
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you find 1 Unique Item in a crate. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: The mi-go have transported you to Yuggoth!
rest: Pass a Lore (+0) check to gain 1 Clue token but lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: The mi-go offer to take your brain on a journey to the far reaches of space... but your body will have to stay here. If you accept,
rest: gain 3 Clue tokens but you are delayed.

situation: The mi-go question you about the Dynasty of America, ruled by "Emperor Castaigne." You must
rest: lose 2 Sanity or be delayed.

situation: The mi-go swarm up out of a hole in the black ground. It seems to be a mine of some kind, as they are carrying large bins of metallic ore. One of them has discovered something strange buried in the ground. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check to steal it. If you pass, gain a Unique Item, but if you fail, lose 1 Stamina and you are delayed.

situation: The mists of Carcosa link the city with a risen isle.
rest: Move to R'lyeh and have an encounter there, then immediately return here.

situation: The mists settle around you, then depart, leaving you in a dark cavern.
rest: Move to the Abyss and have an encounter there, then immediately return here.

situation: The moaning winds in the cave whisper your name.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The money you've just withdrawn is not from any country you know.
rest: Gain $3, but pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The monster's corpse lies before you, and to your horror, you find your mouth watering. If you consum it,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check. If you fail, lose Stamina equal to the number of dice rolled. If you pass, gain Stamina equal to the number of dice rolled.

situation: The mood in the tavern is jovial tonight, and you join in singing a chorus of rousing songs. Restore
rest: your Sanity to its maximum.

situation: The more corrupt Dunwich becomes, the more this area rots the minds of those who encounter it.
rest: Make a Will (+2) check. If the number of successes is less than the total number of monster tokens in Dunwich locations and Dunwich street areas, draw a Madness card.

situation: The more time you
rest: spend with them, the more their ramblings make sense. Gain up to 3 Clue tokens, but for every Clue token you take, you lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The more you can tell Basil Elton about the plot of "The King in Yellow," the more he can explain what's actually happening.
rest: If the Act I card is currently in play, gain 2 Clue tokens. If the Act II card is currently in play, gain 3 Clue tokens instead.

situation: The morning sun shines through the stained-glass windows, warming your spirit.
rest: Gain Sanity equal to the number of locations with sealed gates.

situation: The mottled green stone that the city is carved from seems to whisper to you of the vastness of space and the horror of the things that live therein.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The mystic energies of this place seem to have the power to rejuvenate you. You may
rest: discard 1 Spell or 1 Unique Item to restore your Stamina to full

situation: The natives capture you for medical experiments!
rest: Make a 'Luck (-3) check to escape. If you fail, exchange your current Stamina and Sanity totals (any Stamina or Sanity in excess of your maximums are lost).

situation: The night sky is clear when you get away from the city. As you watch, a shooting star crosses the sky and you make a wish.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you are Blessed.

situation: The night stars change and the brazen temple doors open, pouring forth a vast, black corpulence.
rest: Roll a die and lose that much Sanity.

situation: The obsidian door refuses to open.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or stay here next turn, struggling with it.

situation: The odd plant has you in its clutches.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to break free. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity as it partially digests you.

situation: The old boards of the bridge creak alarmingly beneath your feet.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or plummet into the icy waters of Bishop's Brook, losing 1 Stamina.

situation: The old boys have lured you into a game of high-stakes cards.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you not only keep your money, you gain 1 Unique Item in the process. If you fail, discard all of your money to a maximum of $5.

situation: The old man behind you in line hands you a folded paper oracle. "Lucky five. Trust me." Folding it back and forth five times, you lift the paper flap to see what it says.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, it says, "Fortune favors you." You are Blessed. If you fail, it says, "Too bad." You are Cursed.

situation: The old man refuses to open the door for you. When you plead with him, you hear him muttering something.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, you've learned a charm from him. Gain 1 Spell. If you fail, he's Cursed you.

situation: The old man standing outside the bank looks into you face hopefully. "Spare some change?" If you give him $2 or
rest: discard a Whiskey card, he whispers a few words of power in your ears. Draw 1 Spell. If you do not give him $2, nothing happens.

situation: The old man who lives here glares out at you from behind a curtain.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you feel he has placed some supernatural hex upon you. Take the Tainted card if it is available.

situation: The old train hand Bill Washington sits on the train platform playing his guitar as he awaits the next train. As you listen to his singing you feel yourself healing inside.
rest: Gain 2 points divided between Stamina and Sanity however you choose.

situation: The only empty seat is next to a strange, diminutive man. He has no ears, and is missing all of the fingers on his left hand. If you
rest: pass a Luck (+0) check, he cackles, says "You did well, though you knew it not," and hands you $2.

situation: The only way forward now is a terrifying leap off a cliff.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or stay here next turn.

situation: The onyx Castle of the Great Old Ones looms horrible in the distance, Wisely, you turn away, and have
rest: no encounter.

situation: The path up to the Wireless Station is being carefully watched. You are politely but unambiguously told to stay away.
rest: Move to the Causeway.

situation: The path winds back and forth, providing a very pleasant afternoon's walk. Nothing happens.
The peculiar William Bain regretfully tells you there is little he can offer you.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you notice the small stack of gold coins next to his books. While William is not certain what help those will be, he happily gives them to you. Gain $5. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: The people in the building regard you strangely. If you are
rest: Blessed, they hiss and flee from you, leaving a Unique Item behind. If you are Cursed, they welcome you as one of their own. Draw one Innsmouth Look card.

situation: The phone at the front desk is ringing, but no one seems to be answering it. If you pick up the receiver, an unearthly voice whispers awful secrets to you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but make a Will (-1) check and gain 1 Clue Token for each success.

situation: The phosphorescent fungus make this cavern appealing to rest a moment... but the toxic spores they emit prove dangerous!
rest: Make a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: The pinkish rays nearly get you.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+0) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: The poison from the purple spider's bite courses through your veins.
rest: Roll 3 dice. If you roll no successes, draw 1 Injury card. If you roll at least 1 success, nothing happens.

situation: The police are desperate for leads and are offering a reward for information.
rest: Gain $1 for each Clue Token in your possession.

situation: The police department is decommissioning one of its paddy wagons and empties its trunk into the garbage.
rest: Pass a Luck (+1) check to draw a number of Common Items equal to the successes rolled. Choose one Item and discard the rest.

situation: The pool is extremely cold, but clean and pure, allowing you to scrub away some of the grime from your adventures.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: The porter went into that train car half an hour ago, and he hasn't come out. If you investigate, you find his mutilated corpse clutching an item!
rest: Lose 2 Sanity but draw 1 Common Item.

situation: The priest's back is turned! Now's your chance!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you are moved to the street.

situation: The primitives are entranced by your equipment. You must
rest: discard one Common Item worth at least $2 or lose 3 Stamina. If you pass a Will (+0) check, you convince them to give you their idol in exchange: You may search the Unique Item deck for the Obsidian Statue and take it.

situation: The professor has set up an experiment to transfer knowledge from one person to another. You may
rest: choose another investigator and give him one of your Skills. He must then give you a different Skill back, if he has one.

situation: The professor of arcane studies tells you of a sealed tomb that only the enlightened may open.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to flip over the top three mythos cards and choose one of them. If there is an open gate at the gate opening location on that card, that gate is sealed.

situation: The professors are willing to try some radical procedures for your condition. For every $3 you
rest: spend you may return one of your Corruption cards to the box.

situation: The proprietor asks you to clean out the old shed and offers you your choice of money or whatever you find inside. You may either
rest: gain $1 or draw 2 Common Items, keeping one and discarding the other.

situation: The puzzle-shape consumes you.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you succeed, draw a Unique Item. If you fail, you must discard a Spell, a Common Item, a Unique Item, and 2 Clue tokens, or else you are devoured.

situation: The railroad bulls don't trust the influx of foreigners with the visiting museum exhibit, and are distracted. If you'd like to try to jump on board a freight train as it pulls out,
rest: make a Sneak (+0) check. If you pass, you may move to any Arkham location and end your turn. If you fail, you are caught and warned not to show your face around here again. Lose 1 Stamina and place a Patrol marker on the street area of Northside.

situation: The residents of Dunwich have gathered in a large barn for a dance. They insist you join them.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to keep up with the fiddle playing. Gain 1 Sanity for each success

situation: The rickety bridge collapses as you cross it.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to hang on, finding a relic on the other side. Draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you plummet into darkness. you are lost in time and space.

situation: The rings on a tree stump become a swirling pattern, and you feel a headache coming on. You rub your eyes, then open them to discover that you have been transported-- somehow-- to an entirely different place!
rest: Choose another investigator and swap locations with him. You have an encounter in your new location, but he does not.

situation: The river's washed out the bridge.
rest: Move to the streets.

situation: The road divides here.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to decipher the signposts. If you succeed and are in the first area of the Plateau of Leng, move to the second area. If you are in the second area, return to Arkham. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: The rock crumbles beneath you, and you slip and fall.
rest: Move to the Harborside streets.

situation: The roof caves in, but instead of a ceiling above, a swirling pool of shadow hurtles down towards you.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check or become lost in time and space.

situation: The room is filled with glowing bubbles! You are having a hard time
rest: gaining your bearings and finding the door. Lose 1 Sanity and you are delayed, but then gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: The rope seems to extend upwards forever, but it's the only way out of the crevasse you find yourself in.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to climb it and return to Arkham. If you fail, you fall, losing 2 Stamina and staying here next turn.

situation: The sailors warned you not to ask too many question.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. If you gained 3 or more Clue tokens, add 1 Uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track]].

situation: The school is selling some of its old texts. You may
rest: spend $2 to search the Common Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: The science professor beckons you into his office. He points at a strange device on his workbench. "Want to try it out?"
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to return all monsters in the Sky and the Outskirts to the monster cup. You may choose one of them to keep as a monster trophy.

situation: The screams of the insane drive you out of the Asylum... but then you realize that you can still hear them in your mind, praising the coming of the Dark Pharaoh!
rest: Take the Psychic card, but you cannot stand to be near the Asylum: You are Barred from Downtown.

situation: The screams of the insane seem to permeate the Asylum... and you realize that you are hearing the voices in your mind! You cry out to silence voices only you can hear. Passers-by stare at you suspiciously.
rest: Place a Patrol marker on the street area of Downtown Then take the Psychic card, if it is available.

situation: The sea laps at the island's shore, reflecting strange stars above. You can make out a constellation beneath the waves.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The seclusion on the island is making you more withdrawn and paranoid.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check to keep your wits. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The shadow tries to force its way between your lips.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and stay here next turn.

situation: The shadows of men's thoughts lengthen in the afternoon.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain Clue tokens equal to the number of successes you roll.

situation: The shadowy entity gives up the chase.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina from exhaustion.

situation: The shantak claws at you as it swoops past overhead.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina as its claws rake your chest.

situation: The shattered remains of an unusual object lie here. With some perseverance and luck, you might be able to reassemble it.
rest: Stay here next turn to make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail the check or choose not to attempt it, you have no idea how to reassemble the item. Nothing happens.

situation: The shop seems to be closed early. You peer through the windows and see... something your mind cannot comprehend!
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The shopkeeper at the General Store thinks that transients living in the caves are scaring his customers. He asks you to chase them off.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to intimidate them. If you pass, the shopkeeper gives you a free Common Item. If you fail, they pelt you with rocks, and you lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The shopkeeper entreats you to cover for him. "My wife was in an accident; can you mind the store for me for a few hours?" If you do your job honestly, he pays you $2. However, you could skim a little off the top... If you do,
rest: gain $5 and make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail you are arrested.

situation: The shopkeeper eyes one of your possessions. "I have need of that object. Will you sell it to me?" You may sell any one of your Unique Items for twice its listed price.
The shopkeeper has a terrible headache, and yells at you for stepping on all of the squeaky floorboards.
rest: Make a Sneak (+1) check. If you pass, he accidentally rings you up with a credit, and you gain $2. If you fail, you may search the Skill deck and take the Sneak card.

situation: The shopkeeper has heard of your recent exploits and is terrified that you'll bring bad luck down on his store!
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, he throws money from the till at you, and begs you to leave. Gain $2. If you fail, you are moved to the street.

situation: The shopkeeper has purchased a display of kitschy Egyptian items to drum up business.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. If you fail, it looks realistic to you. If you pass, you point out a few items that are set up improperly, and help him rearrange the display. In return, he offers you any one non-Weapon Common Item at half price.

situation: The shopkeeper motions you over. "I've got something real special in stock today. Interested?" You may
rest: draw the top 2 Unique Items and purchase one of them for list price, discarding any items you don't purchase.

situation: The shopkeeper notices one of the items you're carrying and his face lights up. "Say, I've been looking for one of those. You wouldn't mind parting with it, would ya? I can pay well." You may sell any of your Common Items for twice its listed price.
The shopkeeper offers you $2 to watch the shop for the rest of the afternoon. If you accept,
rest: gain $2 and stay here next turn.

situation: The shopkeeper opens a fresh barrel of flour only to have thousands of beetles crawl out an quickly cover the floor.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The shopkeeper opens up the secondhand section of the store. You may sell any Common Items or Unique Items you have for half list price (round up).

The shopkeeper points out a table containing items that are on sale for today only. You note that most are labeled with their original prices, and bring it to his attention. He apologizes profusely, but proceeds to raise their costs even further!
rest: You may search the Common Item deck and buy an item of your choice for $1 more than its listed price.

situation: The shrunken old man smiles toothlessly and offers you a choice of two gifts- either a gilded book or a small box. If you choose the book,
rest: draw 3 Spells, plus 1 additional Spell for each Clue token you spend. Keep 1 Spell of your choice and discard the others. If you select the box, you open it, only to find nothing inside. Confused, you look up, only to find that the man is gone. However, if you are Cursed, you are Blessed. Otherwise, you may discard 1 Madness or Injury.

situation: The sky is spinning.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or pass out and stay here next turn.

situation: The smoke here burns your eyes and you begin to see things that couldn't possibly be real.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, it was nothing more han a terrifying mirage. Lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, it's no hallucination. A monster appears. Treat this monster as if it has the Nightmarish 1 ability if it doesn not already have the Nightmarish ability.

situation: The snake charmer's mesmerizing dance leaves you in a trance.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: The society is
rest: discarding what it calls a "taxidermist's trick." Draw a monster from the cup and claim it as a monster trophy, even if it has the Endless ability.

situation: The society's latest treasure, an ancient cask from Europe, is not altogether harmless. A monster appears when it is opened, attacking you.
rest: If you pass a Combat check against the monster, you find it was entombed with an ancient scroll. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: The sonorous wind of a sleeping leviathan echoes around you. You rest, but you do not rest easy.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina, but lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The sound of chanting fills the night air, poisoning your soul. you may resist the effect by
rest: passing a Will (-1) check. If you fail, draw a Corruption card.

situation: The spores that the alien creatures implanted beneath your skin are changing you... Return to Arkham, but
rest: keep this card. Each time a new gate opens, draw 1 Spell and place a Clue token on this card. If there are 1-3 Clues on this card, you gain a +1 bonus to all Fight and Lore checks. If there are 4 Clues, treat all Sanity costs for spells as 0. If there are 5 Clues on this card, you are devoured.

situation: The staff asks you to consider making a donation to the retirement home. If you
rest: spend $2, their gratitude warms your heart and you gain 1 Sanity.

situation: The staff asks you to take a box of unclaimed lost-and-found items to the new church for the benefit of the poor. As a reward, you're encouraged to claim something from the box for yourself.
rest: Draw 3 Common Items, choose 1 to keep, and discard the others.

situation: The staff is looking for exhausted or unhealthy subjects for medical experiments. If you are
rest: currently at less than your maximum Stamina, you may choose to gain $3. You must then make a Luck (+0) check. If you succeed, you are restored to full Stamina. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The staff of the Advertiser are uncharacteristically closemouthed. As you leave, you find yourself surrounded by sallow-skinned ruffians.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check and lose 3 Stamina. This loss is reduced by 1 for every success (minimum 0).

situation: The staff of the visiting museum exhibit puts on an educational show in the park, but it is rather confusing.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you gain Clue tokens equal to your focus (maximum 3). If you fail, you lose Clue tokens equal to your focus (maximum 3).

situation: The stars above the water appear larger than you've ever seen them before. The skyscape seems strangely alien and threatening.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The station manager offers you a job helping to clean out the storage shed where lost and left-behind luggage is kept.
rest: Gain $3 and make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you may also draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item.

situation: The stench of fecundity and blood surrounds you. A monster appears! If you do not evade it or defeat it on the first round of combat, it replicates, and you must evade or defeat a second one!
The stink of this place is unbearable.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina, 1 Sanity, and your lunch.

situation: The stone arch breaks!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to dive out of the way or roll a die and lose that much Stamina.

situation: The stone creature pursues you.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to escape with the statue, gaining $5 and 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, the creature smashes you off the cliff. You are lost in time and space.

situation: The stone face reveals to you one of the deepest secrets of the Dreamlands.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 4 Clue tokens. If you fail the check, however, the sight claims your last shred of sanity. Lose all your Sanity.

situation: The strain is too much for your mind.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The strange events have prompted a mob of people to empty their accounts and leave town.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to change their minds or the bank closes for the rest of the game. Move to the street.

situation: The strange fungi pour their knowledge into the brain-case where your mind is imprisoned.
rest: Take 2 Clue tokens but you are reduced to 1 Sanity.

situation: The strange, rat-like creature known as Brown Jenkin leaps out of the darkness at you!
rest: Search the monster cup for a Rat-thing. If you find one, battle it with a -1 penalty to your Combat checks. If you don't, Brown Jenkin grabs one of your items and runs. Lose 1 Item of your choice.

situation: The streets of this city are a maze that defies logic.
rest: Make a Speed (+1) check. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: The students seem all too eager to tell you rumors and ghost stories.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to discern the useful from the hyperbole. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, you are delayed by the excess of dubious information.

situation: The sucking mouths drain enough of your blood to leave you dizzy.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The sun is rapidly setting and the terrain is too dangerous to try to climb in the dark.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina and move to the Harborside streets.

situation: The sun is so far away. Everything seems hopeless.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The symbol above the doorway glows.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Stamina and 2 Sanity. If you fail, lose 2 items of your choice.

situation: The teachers claim you are disrupting class and insist that you leave.
rest: Move to the streets.

situation: The teller hands you a safety deposit box key. "This is for you." If you choose to open the box,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique item. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity and move to the street as you flee the bank in terror.

situation: The terrible words of The King in Yellow have been echoing in your ears ever since you left Arkham. But here, the gentle sound of the river helps soothe your mind.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you are Blessed

situation: The text you are reading is accompanied by a gruesome collection of medieval illustrations.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The thick mist has covered the top of the hill. You can't seem to find the house.
rest: You are delayed while you search.

situation: The thing that enters your mind is particularly intersted in your Spells.
rest: For each Spell you have, gain 1 Clue token but lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The threat of bad weather has kept most people at home. With the crowds so small, you're offered a discount on tickets and never need to wait in line.
rest: Spend $3 for an entire day at the carnival. If you do, gain 2 Sanity.

situation: The three moons confound you.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: The tides of time and space collide. You meet your future self, and learn what is in store.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, the pass a Will (+0) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The time you have spent in this alien landscape is altering your perceptions. New, strange knowledge is burning itself into your mind.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. Then, if you are still sane, gain 1 Spell.

situation: The tombs of the dead keep silent as you explore the graveyard. However, you find the remains of something...unnatural.
rest: Draw one monster trophy at random from the cup.

situation: The traders look you up and down appraisingly as you enter their camp. Ask to join them for dinner, or offer to trade? If you ask to join them for dinner,
rest: pass a Will (-2) check to impress them. They share their meal generously with you. Restore your Sanity and Stamina to their maximums. If you fail, they drive you away. Nothing happens. If you trade, draw 3 Unique Items. You may buy one or more of them for either one of your own Unique Items or 5 toughness worth of monster trophies each.

situation: The train that just pulled into the station doesn't look like it's from around here.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to lurk in the shadows. If you pass, you hide from the robed figures that get off the train and gain a Unique Item they left behind. If you fail, you are discovered. Move to the street.

situation: The unending blackness terrifies you.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina from fear and exhaustion.

situation: The unwelcome are shown no mercy.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check or you are expelled from the great library, where a monster surprises you.

situation: The vast desolate landscape gives you no sense of progress. You walk for what seems days and yet you see nothing growing closer, nothing fading away as you move away from it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: The view from the top of the lighthouse is breathtaking. You find it truly inspiring.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: The villagers leap around a bonfire on the hoary plain.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check or you are captured and subjected to terrible rites. Lose 3 Sanity and 3 Stamina, then stay here next turn.

situation: The villagers offer you a little sustenance.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: The voice of Nodens can be heard bellowing across the landscape.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to interpret his words. Gain 1 Clue token for each success you roll.

situation: The waiting room is filled with people complaining about a cough they've developed from a strange dust in the air. If you interview them,
rest: pass a Fight (-1) check to gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you develop the cough yourself and can't stay in the area without hacking and choking; you are Barred from Uptown.

situation: The walls are covered with strange luminescent moss and lichens. You feel prolonged exposure to them is having a bad effect on you.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The walls are vibrating ever so slightly as the barrier between worlds grows ever thinner. Add
rest: 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board. Then draw 1 Spell for each Dunwich Horror token on the board (No more than 3 Dunwich Horror tokens may be on the board.) Choose one of the Spells to keep and discard the rest.

situation: The water in the river is unusually low this time of year. You can see an object buried in the sediment that's usually beneath the surface.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: The water lilies are in bloom on the river. The picturesque beauty moves you.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: The water splashes upwards as a monster appears.
The waves crashing against the reef are enormous.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to keep from being crushed by them. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and choose 1 item to discard.

situation: The way is shut, and more doors close with each passing one.
rest: If there are four or more elder sign tokens in play, take this card. While you have it, during Upkeep, you must discard a Clue token or 1 Item, if you have either. (errata: the following was not printed in the English version, but was in the French and German versions) Put a Clue on that card for each Item or Clue you discarded. Put that card back in the box when there are 3 Clues on it.

situation: The weight of eons bears down with a literal force.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or discard all of your Clue tokens and become lost in time and space.

situation: The weight of the world presses down on you.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: The wide-mouthed men of Leng are curious about your exotic wonders. You may attempt to barter with them.
rest: Discard 1 Common Item and make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, draw a Unique item. If you fail, gain $2.

situation: The willows seem to grow closer and more malevolent the longer you linger.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to make it back to your boat in time. If you fail, you trip over a protruding root and are tangled in grasping boughs. You are delayed.

situation: The willows sway in a wind that you cannot hear or feel, and for a moment, the hatred of these ancient trees for the invader who has come to their island drives you to your knees.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 3 Sanity.

situation: The wind has pinned an odd piece of paper against the fence surrounding the Lodge.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: The wind here is strong enough to pick you up and throw you out to sea.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to keep youself on the ground. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina, move to Y'ha-nthlei, and have an encounter there.

situation: The wind increases, and you feel your feet go numb.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: The word "Reward" on a leaflet gets your attention. You may
rest: spend one monster trophy with a moon dimensional symbol on it to gain $5.

situation: The workers are all elsewhere having lunch. You spot something in the back of one of the trcuks that looks useful. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check to steal the item is you wish. If you pass, draw 2 Common Items, choose 1 to keep and discard the other. If you fail, you are caught and arrested.

situation: The workers yell as they
rest: lose control of a heavy metal pole they were lifting into place. It falls towards you! Pass a Speed (-2) check or you are reduced to 0 Stamina.

situation: The writing etched into the wall is looking more and more familiar.
rest: Gain 1 Spell and draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: The young manager, Brian Burnham, seems like he might believe your story.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to convince him. If you succeed, you use his telephone to call the authorities. Gain a Clue token and place it on any one space of your choice on the Feds Raid Innsmouth track. A bit of dirt has been disturbed here, revealing an oddly shaped skull. Something warns you that touching it could be a bad idea, but it seems to glow with power at the same time. If you decide to touch it, draw 1 Skill and 1 Madness card.

situation: The zoog sages warn you that the knowledge they are willing to impart comes at a steep price, and you reconsider. You may become
rest: Cursed. If so, take 5 Clue tokens.

situation: The zoogs and the cats are at war! You must choose. Either side with the zoogs and
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check or side with the cats and make a Fight (-1) check. If you fail your check, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Their caravan passes into the trackless desert, leaving you lighter of step but wiser. If you wish, you may
rest: discard any number of your items, taking a Clue token for each.

situation: There are gypsies camped in the park.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check if you wish to interact with them. If you pass, an old man has spread several items on a blanket for sale. Draw 1 Unique Item and you may buy it for $1 less than the list price. If you fail, a hag comes up to you and tells you that death shadows you. You scoff at her and she cuts the side of your face with her fingernail, drawing blood. Lose 1 Stamina and you are Cursed.

situation: There are gypsies camped out in the park. They are master thieves and you are their target.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 1 item of your choice.

situation: There are mysterious forces watching over the keeper of this lighthouse.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, these forces are pleased with the kindness you have shown him and you are Blessed.

situation: There are no doors leading into the strange old house built on the peak here, but you find an old book leaning against one of the walls, as though someone left it for you. If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, it is a particularly rare book. Take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck. If you fail, it's still a useful book, but not as rare. Take the first Tome from the Common Item deck.

situation: There are some amusing games at the Shoppe to celebrate the opening night of "The King in Yellow."
rest: Correctly guess the cost of the next Common Item in the deck, and you get to keep that item! Otherwise, discard it.

situation: There are some real bargains in the classified ads. You may
rest: draw a Common Item and purchase it at half price, rounding up.

situation: There are two flasks here. You may drink one to
rest: gain 1 Sanity and lose 1 Stamina or drink the other to gain 1 Stamina and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: There are two paths for you to choose between. One of them leads home, while the other could lead anywhere.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to return to Arkham.

situation: There is an inscription above an alcove.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to understand it. If you do, it reads "Place herein a thing mundane, it will become a thing of fame." You gain 1 Clue token and may draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item. If you discard a Common Item of your choice, you may keep the item drawn; otherwise, discard it.

situation: There is an old, locked trunk for sale for $5. If you buy it,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) Empty! 1) Gold coins! Roll 2 dice, add them together, and gain that much money. 2+) Jackpot! Draw 2 Unique Items!

situation: There is no sound but the stony echoes of your footsteps.
rest: No encounter.

situation: There is nothing here but barren wastes.
rest: No encounter.

situation: There is something buried in the ice.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to pry it free without breaking it. Draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: There it is! The stairway! But you must remain hidden for a while longer from these accursed ghouls...
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you succeed, return to Arkham. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: There! Behind the mausoleum you see a swirling vortex of energy. If you're lucky, perhaps you can turn this to your favor. You may
rest: spend a gate trophy to draw and keep four monster trophies at random from the cup.

situation: There's a growling behind you. Quickening your pace, you fail to notice a gaping pit obscured by the darkness. If you fail to
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, draw the top gate marker, move to the first area of the Other World shown, and discard the gate marker, a process which causes you to be delayed.

situation: There's a hideous shriek outside. You may
rest: move to the street, where - if the Sky contains any monsters - you find some poor fallen soul, still clutching a weapon. Search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. Otherwise, nothing happens.

situation: There's an inscription on the back of this mirror! If you
rest: spend $3 to purchase it, you can attempt to translate it. Pass a Lore (-1) check and draw 1 Spell if you pass.

situation: There's been a rash of pickpocketing in the train station.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose all your money!

situation: These beings knew of senses beyond the five you possess.
rest: If your maximum Sanity is higher than your maximum Stamina, take the Psychic card. If your maximum Stamina is higher than your maximum Sanity, take the Visions card.

situation: These creatures don't want you to leave just yet.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-3) check or be delayed.

situation: These loathsome beings are certainly not friendly.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to avoid them and gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina as you flee!

situation: These rocks are slick with slime and seawater.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to keep your balance. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina, move to Y'ha-nthlei, and have an encounter there.

situation: They may be retired, but these old sailors are happy to make a little money from the occasional return to the water. You may
rest: pay $2 to move to any aquatic location.

situation: They say there are hidden messages in the newsprint that can only be seen halfway through the printing process.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-3) check to catch a glimpse and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you are arrested.

situation: They've been collecting people!
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to determine how to release the victims. If you pass, you may search the Ally deck and take any Ally of your choice. If you fail, you are taken captive yourself, and are delayed.

situation: Thick-looking men catch you where you don't belong. The work you over and toss you into the street.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Things seem to just disappear here. Choose 1 Common Item and
rest: discard it. If you do not have a Common Item, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: This alien city seems recently abandoned.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to find a Unique Item the former inhabitants left behind. If you fail, you discover why they abandoned the city, instead. Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: This area has always smelled foul, but today something in the river smells absolutely noxious.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to reach fresher air. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. Whether you pass or not, move to the street.

situation: This area is filled with
rest: discarded antiques from Earth. Most of it is junk, but some of it might be worth something. Gain $3.

situation: This is a mystic place, where meditation may have strange effects. If you wish to try to meditate,
rest: make a Will (+0) check. if you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and take the Tainted card.

situation: This is a place not meant for humans. To remain here, you may have to sacrifice your very humanity. Will you remain? If you stay here,
rest: make a Will (+1) check. If you fail, gain 2 Corruption cards. If you choose to leave, make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, return to Arkham. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: This location seems to have particular occult significance.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass and have a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership, gain 3 Clue tokens. If you pass but do not have a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership, gain 1 Clue token instead.

situation: This place is alive with malevolent intent. It likes it when you inflict pain upon yourself.
rest: Discard any amount of Stamina, all at once; for each Stamina token you discarded, pass a Will (-1) check to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: This place looks familiar, like something from a dream in your childhood. With horror, you recall a nightmare of dying in such a place.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: This place seduces you into madness with hints of escape.
rest: Discard any amount of Sanity, all at once; for each Sanity token you discarded, pass a Fight (-1) check to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: Those lands outside the time and space known to men strip king and peasant equally.
rest: Discard all of your items, except those for which you either discard a Clue token or pay $3.

situation: Those things you have tossed aside chew the flesh from your bones.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina for each card you possess that is currently exhausted.

situation: Though the whirling blizzard on the night-face of this nightmare peak swirls around you, you grasp tightly to the object of your desires.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and 2 Stamina. If you succeed, draw a Unique Item.

situation: Though your mind's eye closes to that material blackness, your weak flesh yet succumbs.
rest: If you have only 1 Stamina, you are devoured.

situation: Three men claiming to be professors at Miskatonic University inquire if you know the way to Sentinel Hill. Grateful for the assistance, they give you $1
Through one of the fissures in the stony ground, you see something shining.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, you manage to free the object. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Through one of the windows, you catch a quick glimpse of golden jewelry from some ancient sea-faring culture. You're certain you've never seen it before, but it calls out to something hidden deep within you.
rest: Draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: Through the haze and mist, you make out human forms and hurry toward them, seeking rescue.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, they are an expedition from Miskatonic U. Gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity and return to Arkham. If you fail, they lower their hoods and remove their goggles, revealing themselves as something other than human! Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Through the mist, you see a misshapen silhouette lumbering across the bridge. It drops a peculiar artifact as it crosses. Rushing to investigate, the two of you struggle over the dropped object.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, the figure wrests the object from your grip before disappearing into the night.

situation: Through the shutters you see a book lying open on a table inside. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check to enter undetected and examine it. If you pass, draw 2 Spells, keep 1 and discard the other. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and move to the street as you are evicted from the building.

situation: Thrown back millions of years, you find that you have swapped bodies with an alien being.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check to try and find a way to switch back. If you pass, return to Arkham. If you fail, you are devoured.

situation: Time and space bend around you.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, return to Arkham. If you fail, stay here next turn.

situation: Time and space distort around you. A gate and a monster appear!
Time passes differently in the Dreamlands, and you've needed to learn a few things to survive.
rest: Gain 1 Skill.

situation: Tired and sore, you warm yourself by the stove for a while and let the chatter of the locals wash over you.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Clue token.

situation: Tired, you sit down in a waiting room chair and accidentally doze off. When you awaken, you find out that several hours have passed.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: To pass the time you have been having a conversation with yourself out loud. You are alarmed when you respond to you own questions in a language you have never heard before.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to interpet what you just said. If you pass, gain 1 Spell. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: To your horror, the unearthly geometry of the place is starting to make sense.
rest: Take a number of Clue tokens equal to the difference between your current Sanity score and your maximum.

situation: To your horror, you discover a grave bearing today's date and the name of someone you know well.
rest: Choose one of your Ally cards to discard. If you don't have any, choose a random card from the Ally deck and return it to the box. If there are no Ally cards available, there is no effect.

situation: Today's special is a turkey dinner with all the trimmings. You may
rest: spend $3 to gain 4 points split between your Sanity and Stamina however you like.

situation: Today's special is the lumberjack breakfast;a huge pile of eggs, bacon, sausage, and hash browns. If you'd like to try it,
rest: pay $2 and gain 2 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: Tonight, the old Yankee fishermen who frequent the tavern are trading long, rambling tales of the sea. You listen for awhile, but although the tales are entertaining, they are uninformative. Nothing happens.
Too slow- too slow!- is the fleeing mind encumbered by the thoughts that sane men think in such places!
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or immediately draw and resolve a mythos card.

situation: Touring the perfumed jungles of Kied, you come across an ancient ivory palace.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to explore it without getting caught. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail the check, lose 1 item of your choice.

situation: Tree branches and scrubs have all been flattened in this area and you find evidence of butchered livestock.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. Then make a Will (+1) check and add 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board if you fail.

situation: Tripping as you climb down a steep incline, you roll a bit and smack up against an ancient stone statue.
rest: Gain 1 Spell, but lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Troubles weighing heavily upon your worried brow, you drink rather more than you intended.
rest: If your current Stamina is 3 or less, you are delayed and lose 1 item of your choice.

situation: Try as you might, you are too tired to go on.
rest: Stay here next turn.

situation: Tucked in a crevice, you find 1 Common Item.
Two archaeology students have fallen asleep over tomes on loan from the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit.
rest: Make a Sneak (+1) check. For every two successes (round down), you may draw 2 Spells, select one of them, and discard the other.

situation: Two businessmen are arguing over who will pay the bill, and both have put several dollars on the table. If you can sneak one of the payments off the table, each of the businessmen will think the other relented and will drop the argument. Plus, you'll make a little money.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check and gain $3 if you pass.

situation: Two men in strange robes are having a heated argument about obscure rules of imperial succession.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, they are impressed with your acumen and offer you a gift. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Two monsters surface from the island's dark waters. If you kill both them, you are
rest: Blessed.

situation: Two of the creatures walk past you carrying a large chest.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you follow them and discover where they leave it. Gain 1 Unique Item from inside the chest once the creatures leave. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as they roughly toss you aside.

situation: Two paths diverge in darkness.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you are delayed unless you spend a Clue token. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: Underneath some papers in the archive, you see a glint of light.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: Unfortunately, due to Prohibition, the quality of liquor isn't what it used to be. You get a bad batch and wind up vomiting in the alley.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. A box full of documents in the closet has grown damp and moldy. Make a Luck (+1) check to see if anything of value has been spared. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Up ahead, the tunnel branches to the left and to the right. If you go left, the tunnel slopes down into the darkness, and you hear the strange barking of ghouls up ahead.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the ghouls are friendly enough, and show you a way out of the tunnels. Return to Arkham. If you fail, they lock you up in a cage. You are delayed. If you go right, the tunnel slopes upward towards a reddish light. Make a Lore (-2) check to notice a magical pattern in the dim light. If you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: Upon discovering a severed - but twitching - hand, you find yourself trapped in an interminable time loop.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Upon entering the church, you are attacked by Father Michael with a giant cross, who for some reason believes you to be in league with the devil.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, you escape. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina. In either case, move to the street.

situation: Velma asks you to sample her new Egyptian barley soup recipe.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to gain Stamina equal to your number of successes. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Velma comments on how skinny you look and gives you a sandwich on the house.
rest: You may search the Common Item deck for a Food and take it.

situation: Velma decides to treat you to a hero's feast.
rest: Roll a die for each gate or monster trophy you have. For each success you roll, gain 1 Stamina.

situation: Velma is brewing up a fresh pot of her famous coffee.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Velma reads the tea leaves left in your cup.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the formation of the leaves indicates hope, you are Blessed. If you fail, the future looks bleak, you are Cursed. Velma's got a fire in the kitchen! Make a Speed (-2) check to extinguish it before any damage is done. If you pass, Velma's grateful expression inspires you and you recover 1 Sanity. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina from some bad burns. Velma's hot turkey sandwich with potatoes and gravy hits the spot! Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: Volunteers for art therapy are requested. The inmates' paintings are a window into their madness.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Wading out into the water, your feet feel something metallic beneath them. You discover a handful of gold coins!
rest: Gain $2. Then make a Luck (+0) check. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: Walking across the Commons, you pick your way through brambles, shrubs, and other underbrush until you come across a large, charred stump. Sitting down on it for a moment, you are paralyzed as a vision of an angry lynch mob and a defiant victim overwhelms your senses. When you recover, you find that hours have passed.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and stay here next turn.

situation: Walking along a narrow path through the woods, you duck to avoid some low-hanging foliage. The leaves brush the back of your neck.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or something warm and moist slides down the back of your shirt. Lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Walking along the beach, you find an old crate that has be washed ashore. If you decide to open it,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item. If you fail, you are delayed, and the contents of the crate prove worthless.

situation: Walking along the beach, you spy a hermit crab with a strange design on its shell. Looking more closely, you realize that the weird mottling spells out secrets.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check and take 1 Clue token per success.

situation: Walking along the dock you see something floating in the water near the edge of the dock. You reach for it -
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you dredge up something useful. Draw 1 Common Item. If you fail, you pull to the surface the tentacle that immediately wraps around your neck and drags you under the water and out to sea. Lose 1 Sanity and 3 Stamina before you break free.

situation: Walking along the river at night, you bump into a man smoking a stoagie and wearing a trenchcoat. "You look like a person with problems. It just so happens that my business is making problems go away." You may
rest: pay $6 to automatically defeat any 1 non-Spawn monster on the board.

situation: Walking down a narrow hallway, you bump into a young man carrying various chemicals used for the printing presses. He drops one of the jars he's carrying and it breaks, sending burning fumes up into your face.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: Walking down a shaded lane, you are astonished to see an item that you lost years ago.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: Walking down into the basement, you are startled when the light turns itself off just as you start to place your foot on the next step.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or you fall down the stairs, badly injuring yourself. Draw 1 Injury.

situation: Walking down the hall to your room, you hear a banging from the other side of a door that is bolted shut. Opening the door, you discover a terrified man who can't stop trembling.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to calm him down. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity as you assure him that he's safe now.

situation: Walking into a clearing, you feel that you are at the center of a web of enormous magical energy. You may return
rest: one gate token in play to the bottom of the gate token pile, replacing it with a new gate token from the top of the pile. Monsters are returned to the cup as though you had closed the gate you returned to the pile.

situation: Walking through the garden outside the lodge, you come across a small, ugly statue of some horrific tentacled creature. It seems to awaken an irrational fear in you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Walking through the graveyard near the hospital, you overhear two gravediggers gossiping about some strange things that happened nearby recently.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Walking through the graveyard, you are frightened by a strange green fire that seems to flicker off in the distance between the graves.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: Walking through the graveyard, you find a crucifix hanging on a headstone. Thinking that it might come in handy, you pick it up.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, you are Cursed. In either case, you may search the Common Item deck for a Cross card and take it.

situation: Walking through the graveyard, you see a faint glow ahead. Following it, you discover an ancient tombstone covered in luminescent wormwood. Reading the tombstone by the light of the strange fungus, you discover an important fact.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Walking through the town, you are unnerved by the number of hostile stares
rest: you receive. However, one young man comes up to you and whispers something in your ear before running off. Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: Walking up the path towards the Whateley farm, you come across the carcass of a dog that someone has shot. Rethinking your visit, you turn right back around and leave.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: Wandering the labs at night, you are surprised by a strange, winged, crab-like creature. It attacks!
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check and encounter a Mi-Go from the monster cup. If you fail the check, it seems to move with preternatural, and you may not use any investigator cards in this encounter.

situation: Wandering through the house, you peer into the attic. Inside, a filthy woman squats on the floor like an animal and growls viciously at you before leaping to attack.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to escape or lose 1 Stamina. In either event, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Wandering through the neighborhood, you run into a little old lady out watering her roses. Talking to her, you find that her name is Gladys Pickman, and before you know it, hours have passed in a fascinating conversation about Kingsport's history.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Wandering through the red-lit desert, you come across a great tree, at the root of which is a great stone. Looking at the stone, you find that it is inscribed with your full name, the date of your birth, and -- God in Heaven-- the date of your death!
rest: Draw 1 Madness card, but gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: Watching the waves wash in and out, you drift off to sleep.
rest: Move to the first area of the Dreamlands, have an encounter there, and then return here immediately.

situation: Water begins to flood your immediate environment!
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to prevent yourself from being swept away by the waves. If you fail, choose any aquatic location, move there, and do not take an explored marker.

situation: Water damage! In order to unload damaged books, the shop is holding a sale. For every $1 you pay, you may
rest: draw 1 Unique Item. You may keep any Tomes that you draw, and must discard the rest. You must pay the total up front, before you draw.

situation: Wearily, you sit down on one of the benches near the rails. It seems as though the weight of the whole world rests upon your shoulders. If only you could just give up. You're just about ready to buy a one-way ticket as far from here as you can go when the sound of two giggling children
rest: draws your attention. A little boy and girl are playing together under their mother's watchful gaze. As you watch them play, you're reminded of why you're doing all this. Gain either 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina.

situation: Weary of your travels, you lean back in one of the comfortable chairs for a while and rest.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: Wedged beneath a fallen stone is a scroll.
rest: Draw 1 Spell.

situation: What are these strange disks? If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, they are tok'l coins worth $3! If you fail, they are hazardous Mi-Go artifacts; lose 1 Stamina.

situation: What luck! There's a way home here that you almost overlooked. Return to Arkham.
What was that!?
rest: Make a Sneak (+3) check or you will find out as you are devoured by it.

situation: What was that?
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: What's that behind you!? A monster appears.
What's that? Another Gate? Hurry!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you fail, you are lost in time and space. If you pass with 1 success, nothing happens. If you pass with 2 or more successes, return to Arkham.

situation: Whatever else might be wrong in Arkham, you feel safe here.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: When paranoia and fear set in, accidents are more common.
rest: Make a Speed check with a penalty equal to the current terror level. If you fail, your Stamina is reduced to 0 in a lab accident.

situation: When the donation tray comes around, you find yourself guiltily contributing. You
rest: lose $1.

situation: When the nurse returns your clothes after a routine exam, something's not right.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, one of your items has gone missing (your choice). If you pass, gain $2.

situation: When the workers showed up this morning, the beams were bent and twisted completely out of shape. You can't imagine what it was that was strong enough to do such a thing.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: When you arrive, you discover that the members of the Society are on their monthly outing to Independence Square. The janitor, who's heading there shortly, offers to give you a lift. You may
rest: move to Independence Square and draw two cards, encountering one of your choice, and discarding the other.

situation: When you finally reach the house, William Bain is inside making a thick stew and happily invites to join him for a meal.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you fail, the stew is merely invigorating. Gain 1 Stamina. If you pass, its unique ingredients have a strange effect on you. Gain 1 Stamina and you may take the Psychic card if it is available.

situation: When you inquire about membership, the lodge members get a gleam in their eyes.
rest: If you have an Ally, you may discard it to take both a Silver Twilight Membership card and a Unique Item, but you are Cursed. If you do not have an Ally or do not wish to discard one, pass a Fight (-3) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: When you open the wardrobe in your room, you discover a message written on the inside of the door. It warns of threats against your life and tells you how to avoid them.
rest: Take the Stealth card from the Skill deck if it is available. If not, gain a Clue token.

situation: When you sit down at the checkers board, a clearly disturbed stranger sits down opposite you. As you play, he begins telling you about the play he saw, "The King in Yellow."
rest: Make a Will (+0) check to maintain your sanity. If you fail, gain a Madness card.

situation: When your mind returns to your body something seems to have happened to you while you were away.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, lose 1 Stamina. If you fail, draw an Injury card.

situation: Where all worlds converge, the fibers of Atlach-Nacha spins ensnares you even from the cavern where it spins. If Atlach-Nacha is the Ancient One, you must return to the first area of the Plateau of Leng, and
rest: you are delayed.

situation: Whether you are still on earth or not is impossible to say... it may be the wind that threatens to sweep you into the sky, or it might be a lack of gravity!
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: While discussing magic with Miriam Beecher, you mention a spell she doesn't know and is eager to learn! You may
rest: discard 1 spell to draw 2 unique items. Choose 1 to keep, discarding the other.

situation: While eating your pork chops, a pale stranger comes out from the kitchen and whispers in your ear what you are actually eating. The stranger disappears into the night and you
rest: lose 1 Sanity.

situation: While going through the archives, you find a yellowed collection of Innsmouth Courier newspapers.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: While in the Inner Sanctum, you examine a scroll concerning the aspects of gates.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check, rolling one extra die for each open gate. Take a Clue token for each success you roll.

situation: While lost at sea, you are overjoyed to see the twin lighthouses Thon and Thal, and you know that you have come to the island of Oriab.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: While researching, you find a story about a series of disappearances that occurred in the earliest days of Arkham. Coincidentally, you notice a newspaper reporting a similar disappearance just last week.
rest: Return 1 Ally at random from the Ally deck to the box. Then gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: While searching the card catalog for something else, you stumble across a forgotten card with crabbed, egnimatic scribbling on the back. You follow the lost clue to a most wondrous treasure. If you wish, you may
rest: discard a Tome to search the Unique Item deck and take the Necronomicon.

situation: While the workers are in the factory, you're able to look through their lockers.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: While trudging through the rocky terrain, a stone slips out from under your foot.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or you tumble to the bottom of the hill. If you are in the second area of the Dreamlands, move to the first area. If you are in the first area, stay here next turn.

situation: While wandering the phosphorescent woods, you are surrounded by hungry zoogs!
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, they take a liking to you and give you a gourd of moon-tree wine. Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Clue token. If you fail, the zoogs close in around you, their teeth gleaming. You are lost in time and space.

situation: While you are climbing a high cliff, you begin to slip.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or crash down the mountain, losing 2 Stamina.

situation: Whoever is sitting at the table behind you is having a fascinating conversation.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to eavesdrop, gaining one Clue token for each success.

situation: Whoever sat here before you had been scribbling on his napkin.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain a Clue token.

situation: Whoever was sitting here before you used a knife to carve a horribe symbol into the surface of the table.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check and lose 1 Sanity if you fail. Then, whether you passed or not, search the Common Item deck for the Knife and take it.

situation: William Bain is here, and he takes you to visit the Dreamlands.
rest: Move to the Dreamlands and draw 2 cards, encountering one and discarding the other, then return.

situation: William Bain is here, dressed in his curiously outdated clothing, and he teaches you a spell.
rest: Gain 1 Spell.

situation: William Bain isn't here right now but a Nightgaunt is! You must immediately
rest: move to the open gate of your choice and enter it.

situation: William Bain offers to lend you a hand. You may immediately
rest: move to the open gate of your choice and enter it.

situation: William Bain tells you that Nodens has sent one of his Nightgaunts to help you, but the journey will be dangerous. If you wish to accept the help,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, move to the second area of any Other World you choose. If you fail, the Nightgaunt has left you lost in time and space.

situation: Wiping the sweat from your brow, you stop to rest on a rock for awhile.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: With a crack, one of the grave markers - a beautiful angel - falls towards you. If you are
rest: Cursed, then you are devoured. If not, it slams into the ground next to you and cracks open, revealing something useful. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: With all the strange outsiders coming to see the visiting museum exhibit, Sheriff Engle worries about Arkham's safety.
rest: If you have a Physical weapon, he gives you some training, and you may search the Skill deck for the Marksman card and take it. If you do not have a Physical weapon, search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find.

situation: With the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit in town, folks are crazy for faux-Egyptian trinkets.
rest: Pay $3 if you'd like to buy one, then make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, it's actually a real item! Draw 1 Exhibit Item or Unique Item.

situation: Within the cave, you find the remains of a fire, candles, and other signs that a ritual has been attempted here. Whoever it was left some handwritten notes.
rest: Make a Lore (+0) check. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: Within the opulent rooms of the palace you find Mr. Darke gazing out a window.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you fail, he pushes you out the window and you are lost in time and space. If you pass he's delighted to see you and you are Blessed. If you are already Blessed, you may discard your Blessing card to turn the Darke's Blessing card faceup. If you are already Blessed and pass the check, but do not wish to discard your Blessing (or the Darke's Blessing card is already faceup), nothing happens.

situation: Within this spiritually attuned chamber, you find that if you open your mind to the spirit world, the spirits will bestow eldritch knowledge upon you.
rest: Gain up to 3 Spells and then lose 1 Sanity for each spell chosen.

situation: Without warning, lightning begins to strike the beams of the station.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check. If you fail, you are touching one of the beams at the wrong moment. Take an Injury card as the lightning courses through you.

situation: Words are the nourishment of the mind. You
rest: lose 1 Stamina, but make a Speed (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Sanity.

situation: Workers load some of the gold bars into a closet and then lock them inside. Once the coast is clear, you may
rest: make a Fight (-1) check to break the lock. If you pass, gain $2. If you fail, you must quickly escape out to the streets.

situation: Yellow-robed actors are re-enacting some sort of battle in the woods... or are they rehearsing for a battle yet to come?
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, you are attacked and lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Yes! You think you have a use for this item.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item.

situation: You
rest: e Osborn greets you as you enter his General Store, but lets you look about the shop in peace. you notice a stack of mail meant to be delivered to Dunwich's inhabitents. You may make a Sneak (-1) check to look through some of the letters. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, Joe doesn't take kindly to snooping and you must move to the streets.

situation: You accidentally bump into a basin of water, dumping it all over yourself. You feel a strange acidic burn on your skin.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to resist the effects of this liquid. If you fail, draw a Corruption card.

situation: You accidentally bump into a glass bottle filled with a strange grey powder.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to catch it before it breaks. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as you break out into a fit of unexplained sneezing and itching.

situation: You accidentally bump into one of the performers in the freak show and knock him to the ground.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, your apology is accepted and no harm is done. If not, he takes it as a personal attack and warns you that you'll never have a moment's peace again. Take the Harried card, if it is available. If it isn't, lose 1 Sanity instead.

situation: You accidentally tip over a bottle of ink and are aghast at the pattern the ink forms on the newsroom floor.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You admire a new stained-glass window from the pews, but if you could peer directly through it, how illuminated life would seem!
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to climb up to it safely. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity. If you fail. lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You admire the artifacts donated to the Society over the years. One in particular catches your attention, and as you examine it, your hairs prickle.
rest: If there are three or fewer elder sign tokens on the board, draw a Skill. If there are four or more, you are Cursed.

situation: You advance a pawn, hoping desperately that the Creeping Chaos will not notice your vulnerability.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or choose an elder sign token on the board and discard it.

situation: You agree to map out the caves for the local land grant office.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check to find a cache of stolen goods. Draw 2 Common Items.

situation: You agree to undergo an experimental treatment.
rest: Roll a die. On a 1-3, gain that many Stamina. On a 4-6, nothing happens.

situation: You ambush several monsters emerging from a secret tunnel!
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check and consult the table below. Successes:  0) Three monsters appear! 1) Draw 1 monster trophy from the cup, but 2 monsters appear! 2) Draw 2 monster trophies from the cup, but 1 monster appears! 3+) You tear aside the sub-window's curtain, revealing the dawn's light and all of the monsters disintegrate! Draw 3 monster trophies from the cup.

situation: You approach a tunnel only to feel a terrible tromping shake the ground from below... and then an unearthly screech rends the sky.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, 1 monster appears! If you fail, 2 monsters appear!

situation: You are able to rescue a beautiful piece of art from the distant past.
rest: Gain $5.

situation: You are allowed into the vault of Silver Secrets.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to steal a very unusual item. Search the Unique Item deck and take any one Unique Item you want.

situation: You are asked to speak to the students regarding Lost Carcosa.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain $1 for each success you roll.

situation: You are attacked by a hideous bald creature that leaps out of the bushes at you.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the creature is weak and easily slain. If you fail, its sharp teeth tear into your neck. Lose 2 Stamina. In either event, you lose 1 Sanity as you realize that thise abomination was once an ordinary rabbit.

situation: You are attacked by a shadowy being, but a large man leaps out of the darkness and drives it off. He introduces himself as Tom "Mountain" Murphy.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check, or discard a Whiskey card to pass it automatically. If you pass, he joins your investigation. Take his Ally card if it's available, otherwise he gives you something to protect yourself with. Search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: You are attacked by some unseen force.
rest: Lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You are beginning to understand the strange creatures here.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You are bewildered.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or stay here next turn.

situation: You are bushwhacked by the Sheldon Gang.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to avoid their trap. If you fail, lose 2 items of your choice and 2 Stamina.

situation: You are called in for questioning about missing artifacts from the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, the Sheriff believes you are innocent, and his questions tip you off about a few things; Gain 1 Clue Token. If you fail, he doubts your word, and accuses you of a crime! Choose between being arrested and taking the Wanted card.

situation: You are convinced you can see glints of gold beneath the water's surface. You feel compelled to dive in after it.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to recognize this as a hallucination. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity, move to Y'ha-nthlei, and have an encounter there.

situation: You are disturbed by unsettling echoes.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to quiet them or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You are filled with an unnatural vigor.
rest: Your Stamina is restored to its maximum. In addition, you gain 3 extra Stamina above your maximum that cannot be restored once lost.

situation: You are in a maze of twisty passages, all alike.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check or become lost. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and stay here next turn.

situation: You are in ancient Egypt among the Dark Pharaoh's treasures! They are well-guarded, but you think you could steal one artifact. If you attempt to steal an item,
rest: make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you may search the Exhibit Item deck and take one card of your choosing. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as the guards remove you forcibly. If you do not attempt to steal anything, you notice the walls are adorned with paintings depicting the future. Make a Lore (-1) check and gain a Clue token for each success.

situation: You are in the Congregational Church during December of 1722. An angry mob has gathered outside while those within are racing to hide a strange collection of artifacts.
