rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, the people inside the church turn on you. Lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You are invited to take the first Oath of Dagon. If you refuse,
rest: lose 1 Stamina and move to the street. If you accept, lose 2 Sanity and make a Lore (-1) check, gaining a Clue token for each success.

situation: You are looking around behind the Whateley farm when you discover the foundation of an old building. Carved into the foundation is a list of names that you recognize from your occult researches and several you've never heard before.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You are looking over an unusual item when Oliver Thomas, the shopkeep walks up behind you. "Oh, you don't want that," he says. "Of course, if you'll take it off my hands, you can have it for free."
rest: You may search the Unique Item deck for any one card and take it. If you do so, you are Cursed.

situation: You are lost in a labyrinth of high walls.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or stay here next turn.

situation: You are lost in the darkness.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or lose 1 Sanity and stay here next turn.

situation: You are mistaken for an inmate. Doctor Mintz has the guards subdue you and conducts an experiment.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to discover the results. If you pass, the injections seem to increase your capacity for learning. Draw 1 Skill. If you fail, his memory drug fails miserably, resulting in lost knowledge. You must discard one of the following (your choice), if able: 4 Clue tokens, or 2 Spells, or 1 Skill.

situation: You are not safe here. A monster appears!
You are not welcome here! Some invisible force lifts you up and flings you through the sky.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, return to Arkham. If you fail, move to the first area of the Dreamlands and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: You are overcome by the echoing chants of the long-gone witches who have lived and died here - you pass out.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you learn an ancient spell in your dreams. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you are missing half your items when you wake up. Discard half of your items (your choice, round down).

situation: You are overcome with a sense of fate, knowing that it was your destiny to be in this strange place.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you realize that you will play a special role in saving the world. You may take the Anointed card if it is available. If you fail, you fear that you are doomed to die here. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You are retrieving some papers from the safety deposit vault when a portal to another place and time suddenly opens, nearly sucking the guard in! If you push him out of the way, you are
rest: Blessed, but must immediately move to the Plateau of Leng.

situation: You are reunited with your relatives in a pleasant dream.
rest: Regain your choice of either 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina.

situation: You are shocked to discover a genuine ancient Egyptian treasure among Neil's trinkets. Stranger still, he seems eager for you to take it off his hands at no charge. You may
rest: gain 1 Exhibit Item if you wish. If you you, take the Tainted card if it is available.

situation: You are startled to discover a door you never noticed before leading down to the cellar.
rest: Move to the first area of the Underworld, have an encounter there, and then return here immediately.

situation: You are startled to hear a screech of pain from one of the labs, and you rush in just in time to see a large saw blade slice into a monkey's brain. It seems that a vivisection is in progress. Staggering back outside, you are violently ill.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: You are startled to notice a primitive idol of the god Dagon on the mantle.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to decipher the writing on it. If so, gain 2 Clue tokens and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You are stunned to discover a mysterious man in exotic looking robes. He claims to have been waiting for you. If you are
rest: Cursed or have any Mask items, he tells you that he is called The Messenger and is meant to aid you. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You are suddenly plagued by a vision of yourself inside a cell at the asylum hallucinating a journey to another world.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check. If you fail, move immediately to Arkham Asylum and draw a Madness card.

situation: You are surprised to bump into acquaitances who have decided to vacation here in Kingsport. They believe you have knowledge of the best places to visit and are keen to tag along.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to politely discourage them. If you fail, take the Local Guide card.

situation: You are surrounded by thousands of tiny blue men.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check (or discard a Whiskey card to pass it automatically) to talk them out of robbing you, or lose all your Common Items. They seem oddly uninterested in your Unique Items and money.

situation: You are swept away by a river of some dark substance.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: You are taken to a prehistoric monastery, where a high priest in a yellow silken mask questions you.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to answer him to his satisfaction. Gain your freedom and 1 Spell. Otherwise, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You are unsure if you are back in Arkham or not.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you succeed, return to Arkham. If not, lose 2 Sanity as the landscape twists and warps in a nightmarish way.

situation: You are winded from the hard climb and stop to rest.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: You aren't the only one interested in "The King in Yellow." All Maniacs and Cultists in Arkham, the Sky, and the Outskirts
rest: move to your location. You must immediately evade or defeat them.

situation: You attempt to get some first-hand accounts of Arkham history from some of the older members of the society.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you're able to glean several vital facts from their stories. Gain 1 Clue token. Whether you fail or not, stay here next turn.

situation: You attend a ceremony in which the order opens a gate and a monster bursts out of it before the gate closes once more. A monster appears!
You awaken briefly and stare at your hands, which are the hands of another.
rest: Choose another investigator and take all of his Clue tokens. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You awaken on a steel table, only to find a strange insect creature performing surgery on you. "Your form is so inefficient," it buzzes, "This one will improve it. Should this one improve your mind or body?" If you answer "Mind,"
rest: draw 3 Skills, keeping 1 and discarding the others. However, your maximum Sanity is reduced by 1. If you answer "Body," your maximum Stamina is increased by 1, but you must discard 1 Skill and all of your Spells.

situation: You become tangled in the damp seaweed.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to pull free before something finds you while you're helpless. If you fail, roll a die and lose that much Stamina.

situation: You become very suspicious when you see a masked figure passing through the halls. Following him, you end up somewhere very strange.
rest: Move to the first area of Lost Carcosa, have an encounter there, and then return here immediately.

situation: You begin pumping the "Legacy of the Pharoahs" exhibit curator for information. He of course denies that the exhibit has anything to do with the strange occurrences in Arkham lately, and offers to pay for your meal to make sure you tell the same to anyone you work for.
rest: If you have the Retainer, Deputy of Arkham, or Silver Twilight Lodge Membership cards, you may discard one to gain 2 Stamina and $5.

situation: You believe you are alone in the building, but then you hear the sound of something large moving around.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to avoid panicking. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens as you look around. If you fail, move to the streets.

situation: You bite into a biscuit and find a plump, white grave worm writhing inside!
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check to keep your lunch down. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You black out somewhere in Southside and wake up to find yourself in the Boarding House.
rest: Regain 1 Stamina, then make a Fight (+1) check. If you fail, you regain another Stamina, but you fall back asleep and are delayed.

situation: You bump into Abner Weems, the local drunk. Leaning on your shoulder, he cries as he tells you how his wife and daughter were taken away by a black, three-eyed creature one night. He then babbles for a while, talking about ways to fight such monsters.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, his babbling is helpful. Gain 2 Clue Tokens.

situation: You bump into Abner Weems, the local drunk. You help him find a place to sleep for the night, and he mumbles something to you over and over.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, his mumbling is a magical chant. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, it's gibberish. Nothing happens.

situation: You bump into Eric Colt. He tells you a horrible tale of the Mythos to test your nerve. If you listen,
rest: lose 2 Sanity. If this doesn't drive you insane, take his Ally card if it is available. If it is not available, you may pump him for information instead. Gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: You bump into a friend who's returned from London with his financée. They've brought back the most delightful souvenirs!
rest: Draw 3 Unique Items, keep 1, and discard the others.

situation: You call around for a story, asking about mysterious occurrences related to the visiting museum exhibit.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. For each success, you may take 1 Clue token from any locations in Arkham and add it to your pool. If there are not Clue tokens in Arkham, you may not gain any.

situation: You can barely see anything in the dim lighting, but you can hear something large and threatening nearby.
rest: Make a Sneak (+0) check. If you fail, the creature pounces. Draw an Injury card.

situation: You can feel bleak despair taking over your mind.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, regain 1 Sanity. If you do not, you leap blindly into the yawning darkness and are lost in time and space.

situation: You can hear it breathing...
rest: make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you scream in terror, giving yourself away. Lose 1 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: You can hear terrible sounds inside the Order, including many angry inhuman voices.
rest: Move to the streets and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You can hear the engine of a boat passing. You shout to attract their attention.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you are rescued by federal agents. You may spend 1 Clue token to place it on any space on the Feds Raid Innsmouth track. Then move to Falcon Point and immediately have an encounter there. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You can see a message written high on a cliff face. If you wish, you may try to scale the rock wall to read it. If you do,
rest: make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, you gain 1 Spell. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You can't begin to fathom how old William Bain really is. He tells you the history of Kingsport as if he had witnessed the whole thing firsthand.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You can't see it, but you know something exists on this farm that is horrible. You can feel this malevolent force watching your every move.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. You may add 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board. If you do so, gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: You can't understand the alien creatures, but they seem upset over what's happening in Arkham and intend to send you back as soon as possible using a machine.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, you are unable to block out the searing pain the machine inflicts upon you and you lose 2 Stamina. Then, regardless of whether you passed or failed the check, you may return to Arkham.

situation: You catch Joe Osborn just as he's locking up his store for the night. Letting out a sigh, he leans against the door for a moment before noticing you. "Oh, whoops. Heh, sorry about that. I've had a long day. Say, I feel like getting out of Dunwich for a bit. You know anyplace good around here?" You mention Hibb's Roadhouse to him and he smiles. "That sounds perfect. Why don't you come along and give me directions, and I'll buy the first round?" If you accept,
rest: gain 1 Sanity and move to Hibb's Roadhouse, then have an encounter there.

situation: You catch a glimpse of a tall, robed figure wearing an unearthly gold tiara. Something about the figure haunts you, but you try to block it from your mind...
rest: Pass a Will (+1) check or lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You catch sight of one of the professors chanting quietly over talismans she had hidden in her desk.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check or she Curses you!

situation: You catch sight of yourself in a reflective surface and realize that you are no longer inside your own body. In fact, you body is no longer that of a human being.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You check out a book of essays on the infamous "The King in Yellow."
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, you find a Spell scribbled in the margins. If you fail, you lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You climb a long stone stair towards Sarkomand.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check. If you pass, move to the Dreamlands. If you fail, you become exhausted and must stay here next turn.

situation: You climb and climb, ascending into the clouds.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check to make your way through the dense mist. If you fail, you come out of the clouds somewhere else. Move to the first area of the Plateau of Leng.

situation: You come across a blasphemous idol sitting innocently on a shelf.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You come across a cringing dog.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to catch him and calm him. If you have Food, you can discard that to automatically pass the check instead of rolling. You see by his collar that he is named Duke. Take his Ally card. If it isn't available, gain $3 as a reward for returning him to his owner, instead.

situation: You come across a deserted boat.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you succeed, you may travel to any aquatic location and have an encounter there. If you fail, the boat was abandoned for a reason. You sink beneath the waves to Y'ha-nthlei. Move there and immediately have an encounter.

situation: You come across a human skull with a star-shaped hole in it. Oddly, it seems to have been ruptured from the inside. Shivering, you replace the skull where you found it.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You come across a large pile of human bones under the boughs of one of the willows on the isle.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but find a scroll among the bones. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: You come across a man examining some old bones.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to get close enough to see what he's doing. He finally notices you and is impressed with your skills, introducing himself as John Legrasse. Take his Ally card if it's available, otherwise he shares a meal with you. Restore your Sanity and Stamina to their maximum value.

situation: You come across a man in a tweed suit staring somewhat forlornly at one of the houses. Sighing, he says, "That woman just doesn't understand how much I need that journal for my research." Looking up, he notices you. "Maybe you could help me out?" If you
rest: pass a Sneak (-2) check or discard Old Journal, Professor Morgan thanks you. Take his Ally card, or if it's not available, take the first Weapon from the Common Item deck.

situation: You come across a pleasant, white-haired young man. He introduces himself as Dr. Hamlin Hayes and tells you about the Wireless Station they're building here. "When it's completed, we'll be able to send and receive wireless messages all the way to Antartica!"
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina from the rest and pleasant conversation.

situation: You come across a slaughtered creature.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to claim a monster trophy from the cup (even if it is Endless) and gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You come across a sleeping horror with a tentacle draped across a small gold idol. Silence is of the essence as you attempt to gently ease the idol out from under the creature's pseudopod.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, gain $3. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You come across a small bridge across a ravine, guarded by a knight in rusted armor riding a zebra. He demands either a story or rare knowledge to let you pass. You may
rest: spend 1 gate trophy, 5 toughness worth of monster trophies, or discard 1 Skill to pass. If you do so, you are Blessed and return to Arkham. If you decline to pay the toll, the rusted knight attacks you. Pass a Combat (-3) check to defeat him and cross the bridge, returning to Arkham. If you fail, he knocks you into the ravine, and you are lost in time and space.

situation: You come across a strange monolith, and a vast shape disturbs the water nearby. If Father Dagon or Mother Hydra are Heralds this game, you must
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check or be devoured. In any event, if you survive, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You come across a wizened old creature who debates with you for some time. If you
rest: pass a Lore (-1) check, the creature is amused by your discussion and you are Blessed.

situation: You come across an abandoned onyx quarry whose chiselled vacancies are so vast that it staggers your mind.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to avoid awakening anything here, or else lose 3 Sanity.

situation: You come across an odd book of poetry entitled Dreams and Fancies. If you read it,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check and consult the following chart: Successes:  0) You are reduced to 0 Sanity. 1) Gain two Clue tokens and lose 2 Sanity. 2+) Gain 3 clues and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You come across an old brass lantern, lying on its side deep within the cave. Miraculously, it is unbroken.
rest: You may search the Common Item deck and take a Lantern card.

situation: You come across old Harney Jones resting in the rocking chair on his porch. He is sitting very still, and when you shake his shoulder, he seems to have passed away. After a moment of silence to show your respect, you close up the shack and go to notify his next of kin down the road. In thanks, they give you a gift to remember him by.
rest: Draw 1 Common Item. Harney Jones' Shack is closed for the rest of the game.

situation: You come across some familiar tracks in the snow. Someone you know was here before you.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to recall who it was. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You come across some strange, rubbery bones, and a featureless skull.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, then gain 1 Unique Item, as you find something the creature was carrying when it died.

situation: You come upon a cavern filled with human brains. If you were to eat them, maybe you could also consume the knowledge they contain!
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you may lose Sanity to take Clue tokens, at a rate of 2 Sanity each.

situation: You come upon a tree that has grown, cancer-like, around an ancient prayer plaque.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check or exhaust the Wither spell, Shrivelling spell, or the Axe item to automatically pass. If you pass, draw Spells equal to your focus.

situation: You come upon the ashes of an old fire. Someone camped here and scrawled runes with the ashes.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to decipher them and draw 1 Spell. If you fail, a monster appears!

situation: You come upon the borderlands.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity and return to Arkham. If you fail, move to the Plateau of Leng and your turn ends.

situation: You could swear a drain pipe gargoyle moved.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You cross a great stone bridge and are suddenly overwhelmed with a horrifying despair.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, draw a Madness card.

situation: You curse your wet matches, knowing for certain that in the light, much would be revealed.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens if the terror level is 5 or less.

situation: You desperately flee from pursuing deep ones and, with no other choice, leap into a dark, unexplored cavern.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, move to Devil Reef. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You discover Joe Sargent wiping blood off of his hands. He tells you he hit something on the way here that got stuck on the front of the bus.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you may choose 1 monster token in the Outskirts to return to the monster cup.

situation: You discover a chamber filled with scrolls, ancient tomes, and engraved stonework.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you stumble upon useful ancient knowledge. You may draw 2 Spells, choose 1 to keep and discard the other. If you fail, you stumble upon a terrible ancient evil. You are Cursed.

situation: You discover a complex series of glass tubing, flasks, and beakers. You may choose to sample one of the chemicals flwoing through this array. If you do,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the concoction strangely changes you. Gain 1 Skill. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You discover a copy of your favorite childhood story book.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: You discover a dimensional rift, bleeding macabre energies into your home world. Choose 1 open rift. You must then either
rest: discard 3 Clue tokens and close the rift or move to the rift's current location, without gaining an "explored" marker. If no rifts are open, return to Arkham.

situation: You discover a dusty machine in a lab that hasn't been used for several years. It appears to still be in working condition. If you wish, you may pull either the white or the black lever on the machine. If you do, all non-spawn, non-flying monsters in Arkham move in the direction of the arrow that is the same color as the lever you pulled. Monsters move normally in this fashion regardless of their actual movement type (i.e., all monsters are considered to be black-bordered for this purpose).
You discover a famous escape artist shopping for props and memorabilia. If you give him
rest: 2 of your Spells (discarding them), he introduces himself as Erich Weiss; take his Ally card if it's available. If it's not available, he shows you a trick instead, and you gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You discover a large chamber filled with hideous creatures, in numbers too vast to count. Your only hope is to pass undetected.
rest: Pass a Sneak (+1) check or be devoured.

situation: You discover a local man unconscious by a broken fence.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to administer first aid. If you pass, gain a Clue token as he tells you what happened. If you fail, you are delayed waiting for a doctor.

situation: You discover a mutilated corpse, the victim of some creature that seems to have escaped.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, and a monster appears in the Miskatonic U. street!

situation: You discover a secret trail.
rest: Move to the Wireless Station and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: You discover a series of heiroglyphics, barely visible afters eons of ocean water washing across the stone face. Upon examination, they begin to make sense to you. You may choose to
rest: lose 2 Sanity to make a Lore (+1) check. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You discover a yellowing edition of the Innsmouth Courier from 1846. It is quite fragile and requires delicate handling to read. If you do so,
rest: you are delayed, but you gain 2 Clue tokens for your effort.

situation: You discover an incredibly vital piece of information in one of the dusty old books in the library.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token for every open gate on the board.

situation: You discover an ornate goat mask lying forgotten on a chair. You may try it on, if you like. If you try on the goat mask,
rest: gain 2 Stamina and then make a Will (-1) check as it attempts to revert your mind to a primal state. If you fail, draw a Corruption card. If you do not put on the goat mask, it seems to move of its own accord, turning to look at you. Suddenly a monster appears. If the monster is defeated, you may return to Arkham.

situation: You discover that the patient you've been looking for has been lobotomized. He can't answer your questions now.
rest: Draw one Ally card from the Ally deck and return it to the box.

situation: You discover two men struggling, each claiming that he is a doctor and that the other is an inmate.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you succeed, you assist the real doctor in subduing the patient and regain 2 Sanity as you reaffirm your ability to discern between the rational and the mad. If you do not succeed, lose 2 Stamina as the real maniac stabs you in the back.

situation: You discover you are able to hear the thoughts of an individual in Arkham.
rest: Roll a die and consult the following table: 1) These are not the thoughts of a human being. Lose 1 Sanity. 2-3) The thoughts are preoccupied with trivial matters. No effect. 4-5) You discover something vital! Gain 1 Clue token. 6) These are thoughts of a powerful wizard. Gain 1 Spell.

situation: You discuss the opportunity to sell a monograph with the President of the University.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to make the sale and gain $5.

situation: You disturb one of the antiques in the shop and a large cloud of dust rises from it. Coughing, you go outside for some fresh air.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: You don't know where that boa is going, but you have an opportunity to jump aboard.
rest: Make a Sneak (+0) check. If you pass, move to the North Point Lighthouse and have an encounter there.

situation: You don't notice right away, but Velma has accidentally given you too much change.
rest: Gain $1.

situation: You don't see anyone in the shop, and yet a small army of wind-up toys wheel their way across the floor towards you.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You don't understand why but the door is warm to the touch. You may choose to
rest: gain up to 3 Stamina. (You may not exceed your maximum Stamina.) Then, for each point of Stamina you gained, draw a Corruption card.

situation: You doze off and enter the Dreamlands. Have
rest: an encounter there, then immediately return here.

situation: You drift through tranquil fields that others have created as they sleep.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to gain a Clue token.

situation: You drink impure water from the River Kra.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina and stay here next turn due to illness.

situation: You earn a hefty fee for a story and get a ride with Doyle Jefferies, the editior.
rest: Gain $2 and move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: You encounter a bespectacled young man named Donald Stoll and make the mistake of asking him about the Wireless Station. He subjects you to a long-winded, technical explanation.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: You encounter a friendly old professor from Miskatonic University. If you
rest: spend 1 Gate trophy, he introduces himself as Professor Armitage and offers to join forces with you. Take his Ally card if it is available; otherwise, draw 1 Unique Item.

situation: You encounter a gentlemanly old man strolling down the street with a limp. He introduces himself as Squire Sawyer Whateley and gives you $2. "I don't mean to offend, but you look like you could use it."
You encounter a lovely young lady visiting her old school. She smiles at you, and something intangible passes between the two of you. If you add
rest: 2 Rift progress tokens to any spaces on the Rift track, she introduces herself as Asenath Waite. Take her Ally card, or if it's not available, gain 1 Retainer and 1 Spell.

situation: You encounter a stranger who looks like a much older version of yourself. You are told, "Press on, you will succeed."
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: You encounter a student trying unsuccessfully to get a refund on tuition he overpaid. He's having a hard time getting anyone to listen to him.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to help him out. If you pass, he gets his refund and gratefull gives you $2.

situation: You encounter people you know and places you are familiar with, but no one recognizes you. It is as if you'd never been born. Seeing how unhappy everyone here is, you realize what a positive impact you've made on those around you.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You encounter the talking cats of Ulthar.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check to draw 1 Spell.

situation: You end up in a childhood dream, but it now seems dark and cold.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You enter a "friendly" card game.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you win $5. If you fail, you lose $3. If you lose and can't pay, the boys rough you up and throw you outside. Lose 1 Stamina and move to the street.

situation: You enter the chapel, unnoticed by a stranger who prays aloud for the health of her husband. Some of her words contain shocking information.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You enter the confessional. "Bless me, Father, for I have sinned."
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) "Father? Are you there?" You hear a scream in the next compartment! Lose 3 Sanity and move to the street. 1) "Father?" There is no answer. Sighing, you leave. Move to the street. 2+) "I don't remember my last confession." Raise your Sanity to its maximum value.

situation: You examine an obscene statue.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check or else you feel a cold dread spread through your body as you hold it. You are Cursed.

situation: You examine strange glyphs and begin to understand their purpose.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain 1 Spell.

situation: You examine the frescoes and find them both informative and repellent.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token per success. After that, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You explore an ancient crypt in the cemetary and come across a giant mass of white grave worms.
rest: Lose 2 Sanity. In addition, any Crawling Ones in Arkham (including the Sky and the Outskirts) move here and encounter you.

situation: You fall asleep waiting for your train.
rest: Move to the Dreamlands and have an encounter there, then (unless you are lost in time and space) return immediately. When you awake, you are holding a strange artifact. Draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item.

situation: You fall into an open grave and land upon a corpse that you're certain is not human.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You fear you won't survive the night if you can't start a fire, but you'll need to burn something. If you
rest: discard an item, gain 1 Sanity from the warmth. If you don't, lose 1 Stamina from the cold.

situation: You feel a moment's guilt at wandering into a restricted area, but something's just not right in this place. Unfortunately, before you can get far, Nurse Heather steps up behind you and injects something into your arm. "Come with me. You shouldn't be back here." Your head swimming, you easily agree with her. The next thing you know, you're standing outside the gates with no memory of what happened.
rest: Move to the street and gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You feel a powerful pulse of malevolent intelligence. It wants to tell you secrets.
rest: For each point of Sanity you sacrifice, you may gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You feel a sudden sharp pain in your ankle and see that you've been bitten by a snake!
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to treat the wound. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina and move to the Harborside streets to get help.

situation: You feel an outside intelligence trying to take over your body, replacing your identity with its own. You fight it off with great difficulty.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you gain a specialized knowledge from that intelligence. Draw 1 Skill. If you fail, you lose part of yourself in the struggle. Discard all of your Clue tokens.

situation: You feel as if this desolate area is draining you of your life.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. Then, if either the Act I or Act II card is in play, you must additionally discard 1 Skill if you are able.

situation: You feel as though being in these underground caves is reinvigorating you.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina and draw one Innsmouth Look card.

situation: You feel lucky to have bumped into Harney Jones and discovered his gentle humor and generous nature. You feel much better about the world you're trying to save. You are
rest: Blessed.

situation: You feel other minds trying to contact you and warn you of something.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You feel that all the answers are here, if only you can find them.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens, but you are delayed.

situation: You feel the darkness pulling at your very soul. Resist the effects by
rest: passing a Will (-1) check or draw a Corruption card.

situation: You feel the house actually breathe and speak your name.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You find William Bain's company helps to calm your thoughts and heal your mind. You may either
rest: discard 1 Madness card if you have one or restore your Sanity to its maximum.

situation: You find a $5 bill on the ground here, with no possible explanation for its presence.
rest: Gain $5.

situation: You find a Gug lying motionless, apparently dead. You may examine the body if you like. If you do,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you discover what killed the monstrosity. Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, the thing still has a little fight left in it. Lose 1 Stamina as it lashes out with the last of its strength.

situation: You find a banquet laid out in the dining room and feel compelled to sit down and eat.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check and consult the following chart: Successes:  0) You suddenly realize what you've been eating. Lose 3 Sanity. 1) You gorge yourself, unable to stop eating. Stay here next turn. 2) The food makes you feel sick. Lose 1 Stamina. 3+) The meal refreshes you. Gain 3 Stamina.

situation: You find a body floating upon the waves. Can you revive it?
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to draw a random Ally.

situation: You find a book in a familiar language.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the book is useful! Gain 1 Skill. If you fail, it's useless and poorly-written.

situation: You find a book with two of its pages stuck together.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to pull them apart without damaging them. Between the two pages is a magical incantation. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail the check, you tear the pages and ruin the incantation.

situation: You find a cipher for interpreting old texts and hieroglyphics! You may immediately use any Tome or other item that requires an expenditure of movement points to use.
You find a curious collection of loathsome and alien jewelry. Could this be what the refined gold is derived from? If you choose to investigate more closely,
rest: make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: You find a curious doorway.
rest: If you pass through it, move to the Esoteric Order of Dagon and have an encounter there.

situation: You find a dead cat on the front stoop of the shop.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to find the weapon that killed it in the grass nearby. Search the Common Item deck and take the first Weapon you find.

situation: You find a decaying scroll, weighted down with a rock.
rest: Gain 1 Spell.

situation: You find a doctor's bag sitting unattended. Inside, there's bandages, rubbing alcohol, and medicines.
rest: Gain 2 Stamina.

situation: You find a footlocker washed up on the shore.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check as you open it and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) The aquatic horror within is still alive! With a fishy stench and a revolting aspect, it oozes into the water and vanishes. Lose 1 Sanity. 1-2) Gain a Common Item. 3+) Gain $5.

situation: You find a fresh water source that replenishes you.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: You find a group of students cramming for exams. Help them by
rest: making a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you realize that the students have no idea what they're truly studying. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: You find a half-buried corpse of a strange being.
rest: Draw a monster from the cup and take it as a monster trophy, even if it has the Endless ability.

situation: You find a human corpse... which then sits up!
rest: Make a Lore (+1) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. If you pass, you realize that it is a zombie and may draw an Ally. Place tokens on it equal to the number of successes rolled. Discard 1 token from it during each Upkeep Phase. If it has no tokens at the beginning of the Upkeep Phase, discard the Ally instead.

situation: You find a jeweler who crafts talismans, who asks you if you know anything about real magic. He's willing to pay for a lesson.
rest: If you currently have a Spell, gain $2. If you do not currently have a Spell, nothing happens.

situation: You find a journal so compelling that the author seems to live in your mind!
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. If you pass, draw an Ally and place tokens on it equal to the number of successes rolled. Discard 1 token from it during each Upkeep Phase. If it has no tokens at the beginning of the Upkeep Phase, discard the Ally instead.

situation: You find a key to a locker on the ground, but the tag that shows its number has been removed.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check to find the right locker. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: You find a man painting a picture on one of the horrible gargoyles lining the walls of the graveyard. Seeing you, he introduces himself as Richard Upton Pickman, a painter visiting from Boston. If you
rest: spend monster trophies that have a total of 5 toughness, Pickman takes a liking to you. Take his Ally card. If it is not available, he teaches you an incantation instead. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: You find a map of this strange place. The streets are laid out in a horrible pattern!
rest: Pass a Will (+1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You find a muscular, bored-looking man who challenges you to an arm wrestling match.
rest: Lose 2 Stamina if you accept. If this does not knock you unconscious, Sir William Brinton laughs and slaps your shoulder, offering to join your investigation. Take his Ally card. If it is not available, gain $5 instead.

situation: You find a number of old barrels, lost from some bygone century.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you discover something worthwhile. Gain a Common Item. If you fail, the barrels' rotten contents nauseate you. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You find a painting of your grandparents wearing strange occult pendants.
rest: You may search the Skill deck for the Expert Occultist or Lore card and take it, but if you do so you must also take the Tainted card.

situation: You find a penny with a strange sigil carved into it. Amused, you flip it in the air, but then gasp as you feel the sudden gathering of magical forces around you.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the penny comes up heads. You are Blessed. If you fail, it comes up tails. you are Cursed.

situation: You find a penny with a strange sigil carved into it. Amused, you flip it in the air, then gasp as you feel the sudden gathering of magical forces around you.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the penny comes up heads. You are Blessed. If you fail, it comes up tails. You are Cursed.

situation: You find a poorly boarded-up passage in the basement that opens into a winding tunnel. If you venture into it, you exit in the Silver Twilight Lodge.
rest: Draw 2 cards and encounter one card of your choice, discarding the other.

situation: You find a quiet spot to rest and recuperate.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina.

situation: You find a room containing strange artifacts on towering pedistals. You may choose to
rest: make a Fight (-1) check to climb the smooth surfaces to reach one of the objects. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina from your fall.

situation: You find a scattered pile of familiar objects, each one something you have lost at some point in your life. Some of them may prove usefull now.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you may look at the bottom of the Common Item deck and then draw 1 Common Item from either the top or the bottom of the deck.

situation: You find a sheltered area, a veritable oasis in this strange place.
rest: You may take the opportunity to rest. If you do, you are delayed and gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: You find a sleeping Sheldon Gang member near the still.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to try to swipe the shotgun he has dropped on the ground. If you pass, take a Shotgun from the Common Item deck if there is one. If you fail, the guard awakens. You are caught and beaten, losing 2 Stamina, but you escape with your life. Move to the street.

situation: You find a small gem that you plan on selling when you get the chance.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: You find a statue of Dagon, as large as a house, covered in strange writing. You fear that just being in its presence is dangerous.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check as you look at the writing. Gain 1 Clue token for each success. If you gained 3 or more Clue tokens, you are Cursed.

situation: You find a strange, distorted mirror, and looking inside, see the visage of a fellow investigator!
rest: If another player agrees, your and his investigators may switch locations.

situation: You find a student pounding on a strange device that he has hooked up to massive machinery. He states that it is a dimensional beam machine. If you offer to help him,
rest: make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, beams shoot out in all directions, disrupting the gates open throughout the board. Roll a die for each open gate one at a time. On a success the gate is closed. However, you may not take it as a trophy, but instead return it to the pile of gate markers. If you fail, the machinery overheats and explodes. Roll a die and lose that much Stamina, then move to St. Mary's Hospital.

situation: You find a terrible collection of human remains with the walls.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You find a tiny corner of placidity, and remain there for a moment.
rest: Gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: You find a wrinkled scroll laying on the woodpile. If you
rest: pass a Luck (-1) check, it turns out to be mystical in nature: Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, the scroll contains the rantings of a madman: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You find an abandoned temple. At the front, resting on an altar is a copy of the Ponape Scripture.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain some useful insight from the book. If you succeed, you may close one gate to R'lyeh anywhere on the board. Keep the gate trophy and remove monsters with the matching dimensional symbol as normal.

situation: You find an old bit of rope leading from the reef to somewhere under the water. Pulling it, you can tell something heavy is on the other side.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you eventually pull up an object wrapped up in oiled canvas. Gain a Unique Item. If you fail, the rope breaks and whatever it was attached to sinks.

situation: You find an old book. If you read it,
rest: make a Lore (+0) check and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) Evil forces assault you. Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. 1) You find the diary of a lost soul who died in the caves long ago. Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token as you read his horrible tale. 2+) The book is a spellbook. Take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck.

situation: You find an old journal, largely devoured by vermin.
rest: Make a Luck (-3) check to see if certain vital pages remain intact. If you pass, draw 2 Spells and keep 1.

situation: You find an old parchment in the study.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to draw 2 Spells and keep one of your choice.

situation: You find an unusual book that radiates evil at the touch. You begin to read and are
rest: drawn to it. Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you obtain vast knowledge of the eldritch threat. Roll a die and gain that many Clue tokens. If you fail, the book consumes you-- mind and soul-- lose 2 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: You find carvings on a standing stone etched in an ancient tongue but by a modern hand.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token per success.

situation: You find it difficult to navigate the University's bureaucracy.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: You find one of the older Innsmouth residents huddled in a corner. The thing is barely still human and quickly sufficating as its fish-like features no longer allow it to breathe air.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. If there were no successes rolled, lose 2 Sanity as you gaze into its bulbous eyes.

situation: You find plates of a strange flat bread. If you choose to sample some,
rest: gain 2 Stamina and then make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, you forget where you were going and are lost in time and space

situation: You find precious golden jewelry, far more than you can carry. You may stop to collect some. If you do,
rest: make a Fight (+1) check and gain $1 for each success. You are delayed as you gather up all the loot.

situation: You find secret lore hidden in the mosaics on the wall.
rest: Make a Lore (+2) check and gain Clue tokens equal to your successes.

situation: You find some money on the floor under the back booth. If you take it,
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, roll a die and gain that much money. If you fail, Velma sees you pick up the money. She comes over and swipes it out of your hands screaming, "Stealing my tips!" so loudly that you flee the diner. Move to the street

situation: You find some strange medicine labeled "Dream Enhancers" in a dusty cabinet. If you choose to take it,
rest: make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, your visions show you how to perform a ritual. Draw 1 Spell. Otherwise, nothing happens.

situation: You find some valuable items that you can sell back in Arkham.
rest: Gain $3.

situation: You find something that looks to be valuable, broken into many small pieces. If you wish,
rest: draw a Unique Item and stay here next turn as you reassemble it.

situation: You find that Gladys Pickman loves to hear stories of the unusual, even if she doesn't particularly believe them. You may
rest: discard 2 Clue tokens to provide interesting stories for her. If you do, she shows you an odd book she found in her house. Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: You find that tipping well gets the proprietor talking. For every $1 you
rest: spend, gain 1 Clue Token, to a maximum of $3.

situation: You find the body of a long-dead explorer.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. For each success, you may draw and keep one card from the Common Item deck.

situation: You find the body of someone who was left handcuffed on the reef.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you discover the man was still clutching something in his hands. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You find the carcass of a deer laying in the clearing. While it doesn't appear to have any injuries, blood has erupted from its nose and eyes. Deciding that discretion is the better part of valor, you
rest: move to the street.

situation: You find the corpses of a party of cultists.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to drag their bodies from the pit. If you pass, take a number of Cultists as trophies from the monster cup equal to the number of successes you rolled.

situation: You find the remains of a fire where someone attempted to burn incriminating evidence, but didn't finish the job.
rest: You may search the Common Item deck for the Research Materials card and take it.

situation: You find the remains of a small fire. Among the ashes you find a few scraps of paper that didn't completely burn.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check and consult the chart below. Successes:  0) You are Cursed. 1) Gain 1 Clue token. 2+) Gain 1 Spell.

situation: You find the rotting body of a foreign grifter that followed the museum exhibit into town.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or become nauseous and move to the street. If you pass, you find his wallet and gun nearby. Gain $2 and you may search the Common Item deck for the .45 Automatic card and take it.

situation: You find the shopkeeper dead on the floor!
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. Successes:  0) The Sheriff walks in and finds you at the scene. Take the Wanted card. 1-2) Lose 1 Sanity. 3) There's an invitation to the Silver Twilight Lodge in his pocket. Take a Silver Twilight Lodge Membership card.

situation: You find the wrecked remains of a small rowboat. You can see wide claw marks and large fish scales throughout the debris.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You find this place is corrosive to your belongings. Metal rusts, wood rots, and cloth grows thin.
rest: For each Common Item you have, roll a die. If the result is a 1, discard the item. You grasp at the thing, but sense that even if you are unable to hold it, the reaching itself will teach you. Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw a Unique Item. If you fail, take a Clue token.

situation: You find what appears to be the
rest: discarded skin of a human being. Lose 1 Sanity, then draw a monster at random from the cup and place it in the outskirts.

situation: You find your way into the office of Jacob Marsh and begin examining his accounts.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You find yourself
rest: Lake Hali, you can see the dreams of people you know. You find yourself unconsciously manipulating the dreams. Make a Will (+0) check. If you pass, choose 1 rift progress marker and turn it facedown if its associated rift is open, or discard the token if its associated rift is closed. If you fail the check, raise the terror level by 1.

situation: You find yourself compelled to leap into the water.
rest: Draw one Innsmouth Look card.

situation: You find yourself engrossed in a conversation with the Dean. He has to get to a fundraising event, but he offers you a ride on his way.
rest: Move to any location or street area in Arkham. If you move to a location, immediately have an encounter there.

situation: You find yourself faced with a difficult decision. The ancient being has offered you power, but warns that it comes with a price. If you accept,
rest: draw 2 Spells and 1 Madness card.

situation: You find yourself in Victorian England, but a man tells you he has a machine that can return you to your own time.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to see if the machine works. If you pass, return to Arkham. If you fail, you are delayed as the machine sends you to the wrong time.

situation: You find yourself in a beautiful garden. Wandering through its lovely paths, you realize that this is the lost Hanging Garden of Babylon.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity for witnessing one of the lost wonders of the world.

situation: You find yourself in a small New England colonial town. On the door of one of the buildings is a symbol you recognize from the Silver Twilight Lodge. As you examine it, you overhear voices inside.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you learn the secrets of their initiation. Take a Silver Twilight Lodge Membership. If you fail, the people inside discover you. Lose 1 Stamina as they drag you away.

situation: You find yourself in a small New England colony that suspects that you practice witchcraft.
rest: Make a Sneak (+1) check to avoid capture. If you fail, draw an Injury card as you endure their rigorous questioning.

situation: You find yourself in an ancient and abandoned temple.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to find a golden statue worth $10. However, if you take it, you are Cursed.

situation: You find yourself in the recent past, just before a terrible hardeship is about to befall one of the investigators. Will you attempts to interfere? If you choose to interfere,
rest: make a Speed (-1) check to act in time. If you pass, you may choose any investigator and restore either his Sanity or his Stamina to full. If you fail, you are Cursed for trying to interfere in the natural order of things. If you choose not to interfere, make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success as you are able to analyze events as they unfold.

situation: You find yourself in the trenches of the Great War.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check to keep yourself from harm. If you fail, draw an Injury card.

situation: You find yourself nearly fainting in exhaustion during the hard climb.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. You lean against a wooden railing that protects visitors from falling off the cliffside accidentally and just gaze out to sea for awhile. Nothing happens.

situation: You find yourself on a rise overlooking an intricate hedge maze with a fabulous temple at its center. You may enter and
rest: make a Lore (-1) check to find the center. If you pass, gain 1 Unique Item from the temple within. If you fail, stay here next turn.

situation: You find yourself reliving a moment in your past that you have always regretted, only this time everything goes as well as you could ever hope.
rest: Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: You find yourself sliding down a shear sheet of ice!
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you land on 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You find yourself surrounded by clay tablets and scrolls.
rest: Search the Unique Item deck and take a Tome of you choice, then regain 1 Sanity as you realize that you've seen the Great Library of Alexandria.

situation: You find yourself surrounded by unblinking cats.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to pass by unharmed. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You force yourself to approach the alter of Dagon, despite your misgivings. You see that someone had tried to carve a warding symbol into the stone but did not manage to finish.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you know how to complete the symbol. Search the Unique Item deck and take an Elder Sign card if one is available. If it is not available or if you fail the check, you are Cursed.

situation: You forgot to pay for your meal.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, you realize it later and Velma tells you not to worry about it, so nothing happens. If you fail, she sends Deputy Dingby after you. You are taken to the Police Station and arrested, unless you're the Deputy.

situation: You get a chance to try out some of the radio equipment. You hear a strange mechanical voice reciting numbers.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to decode any kind of meaning from what you hear. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You get caught in an unexpected downpour of freezing rain.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to find shelter or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You get food poisoning!
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You get into a debate with the shopkeeper regarding the value of material wealth vs. knowledge, and he challenges you to prove your point. If you
rest: pass a Will (-1) check, you may discard a Common Item or any number of Clue tokens. If you discard a Common Item, draw a number of Clue tokens equal to its value. If you discard Clue tokens, search the Common Item deck and take any number of items with a total value equal to or less than the number of Clue tokens discarded.

situation: You go into the University President's office for a chat. Upon entering, you learn that another investigator has recently been here interrogating the President about the same activities that brought you here.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to choose another investigator; each of you gains a Clue token.

situation: You grope blindly in the darkness, desperately avoiding razor-sharp shards of stone.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check. Lose 4 Stamina, reduced by 1 per success.

situation: You have a horrifying vision of yourself on an operating table, horribly wounded.
rest: Make a Will (+1) check to convince yourself it's only an illusion. If you pass, lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, the pain feels very real to you. Lose 1 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: You have a long talk with Principal Miles.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token, otherwise move to the street.

situation: You have a pleasant little chat with some of the students.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You have definitely been affected by the unearthly energies of this place.
rest: Draw 1 Corruption card.

situation: You have inadvertantly stumbled into a dangerous area. From the shadows, a monster appears!
You have stumbled on a still owned by the Sheldon Gang.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, skulk away without being seen. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina as the Sheldon Gang works you over while escorting you from the woods. In either case, move to the street.

situation: You have the opportunity to consult the Oracle at Delphi in Ancient Greece. If you wish,
rest: make a Lore (-1) check to interpret their message. Gain 1 Clue token for each success. If you fail the check, you are Cursed.

situation: You head up the steps as a bank robber in a mask dashes out, running into you and dropping a sack full of money. If you would like to return the money,
rest: gain 1 Sanity. If you want to keep it and run away, gain $10 but lose 1 Sanity and take the Wanted card.

situation: You hear Nurse Heather use your name in a discussion with an orderly. They must know you're here!
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to eavesdrop. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, you're thrown out. Move to the street.

situation: You hear a child's cries for help from deep within the cave. If you ignore them, a witness recalls seeing you in the area where the youngster disappeared.
rest: Place a Patrol marker on the street area of Rivertown. If you try to rescue the child, make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find her in a chamber covered with strange occult inscriptions and may draw 2 Spells. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You hear a child's cries for help from deep within the cave. If you ignore them, the guilt haunts you whenever you are nearby, and you are Barred from Rivertown. If you try to rescue the child,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find her in a chamber covered with strange occult inscriptions, and may draw 2 Spells. If you fail, you are lost in space and time.

situation: You hear a clatter and a curse. Rushing to the sound, you find Oliver Thomas rubbing a bruised elbow among spilled curios. "Damned rubbish!" he seethes. "Take it away and any that's not broken is yours!"
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you succeed, draw 3 Unique Item cards and keep any that cost $4 or less. Discard the rest.

situation: You hear a distant chanting being carried on the wind. The words are strange and the voices are inhuman.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you are able to find a menaing in the words. Gain 1 Spell. If you fail, the sound chills you to your bones. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You hear a horrible sound an instant before a sanity-shattering image appears in front of you.
rest: Make a Speed (+0) check to avert your eyes. If you fail, your mind suffers a terrible shock. Discard all of your Clue tokens.

situation: You hear a monstrous roar behind you and a voice within tells you to run and not look back.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to do exactly that. Otherwise you give into temptation and glance back at the creature. losing 2 Sanity and becoming lost in time and space.

situation: You hear a multitude of whispered voices calling out to you from inside the house.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to try to make sense of what they are saying. If you pass, gain 1 Spell. If you fail, it's nothing more than a nightmarish cacophony. Lose 1 Sanity. You hear a rumor from a passerby that someone else was sneaking around here last night, but hasn't been seen since. Draw the top card from the Ally deck and return it to the box.

situation: You hear a panicked cry from inside a nearby cloud of brownish smoke. If you rush to help, you pull someone inside the cloud to safety, but hurt yourself badly doing so.
rest: Draw 1 Ally and 1 Injury card.

situation: You hear a panicked cry from inside a nearby cloud of brownish smoke. if you rush to help, you pull someone inside the cloud to safety, but hurt yourself badly doing so.
rest: Draw 1 Ally and 1 Injury card.

situation: You hear a scream from the other side of the reception area. Right before your eyes, a perfectly healthy orderly begins to age and shrivel, ultimately turning to sand and being swept out of the room by a gust of wind.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You hear a strange singsong voice that says, "The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon the rock."
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token

situation: You hear distant chants. You feel you may learn more if you stop to listen. If you wish, you may
rest: gain 1 Spell, but you will be delayed.

situation: You hear gurgling voices echoing from somewhere in the darkness above you. At first, the sound is unnerving, but soon you realize they are unaware that you are listening.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to get what information you can without alerting the speakers of your presence. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You hear one of the sailors talking to a caretaker about having seen "The King in Yellow" in its original French. He explains how some of the passages were altered in translation.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You hear screaming. When you open a heavy cell door to investigate, a dark shape leaps out at you! It's an insane man in a straightjacket babbling about invisible horrors.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to glean some useful information from him. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as he attacks you.

situation: You hear scurrying and squeaking of a horde of rats from inside the walls. Abruptly, you realize that they are moving to surround you.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to make it to the front door first. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You hear the call of a hunting creature in the sky above.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check or you become its prey and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You hear the quiet sounds of an intruder. If you investigate, you find a woman dress in black.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to subdue her long enough to explain your investigation. You find out that her name is Ruby Standish and that she was robbing the Lodge. However, upon hearing your tale, she agrees to join you. Take her Ally card. If it is not available, draw a Unique Item instead.

situation: You hear the quiet sounds of an intruder. If you investigate, you find a woman dressed in black. She attacks you as soon as she sees you.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check to subdue her long enough to explain your investigation. You find out that her name is Ruby Standish and that she was robbing the Lodge. However, upon hearing your tale, she agrees to join you. Take her Ally card. If it is not available, draw a Unique Item instead.

situation: You hear the sounds of a violent struggle from within the house, including the cries of men in agony. Abruptly, there is silence.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You hear the voice of Eric Colt from the next room.
rest: Drawing nearer, you see his back to you, as he listens to a haunting tune from a radio whose cord has been cut. If you wish to rescue him from the music's grasp, lose 2 Sanity. If this does not drive you insane, take Eric Colt's Ally card or, if it's not available, take 3 Clue tokens.

situation: You help a professor clean his classroom, and later on are shaking the chalk dust out of your clothes.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail, you cough and gag on the dust, losing 1 Stamina. If you pass, you realize that the dust is actually a mystical powder! You may search the Unique Item deck and take the Powder of Ibn-Ghazi card.

situation: You hide in a hollow of the rock to eavesdrop on the horrible croaking conversation of the Innsmouth folk and their strange allies.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check to gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You hide yourself in a storage shed. Among the shelves are all kinds of strange items.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find something useful. Gain 1 Common Item. If you fail, you knock one of the shelves over, making a terrible din. You are escorted to the streets.

situation: You hope, desperately, that the creature pursuing you is afraid of sunlight.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check. If you fail, a monster appears. If you pass, nothing happens.

situation: You hoped to get near enough to the gypsy camp to eavesdrop, but a dog bark has alerted them that there is an intruder.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to escape! If you fail, you are Cursed.

situation: You inadvertently fall into one of the pools of water.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to get out before you are swarmed by Deep Ones. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina before you pull yourself back into the air.

situation: You inadvertently summon the Haunter of the Dark to carry you through the void. You must
rest: lose Sanity equal to your current Stamina, or Stamina equal to your current Sanity, but gain 2 Clue tokens for each monster in the Sky.

situation: You interrupt an arguement between Father Michael and a member of the Esoteric Order of Dagon. If you join in on the side of Dagon,
rest: gain 2 Clue tokens as you urge the man to talk. If you join in on the side of the Church, Father Michael's grateful smile restores 2 Sanity.

situation: You join in the morning mass.
rest: Spend 1 Clue token to ask for heavenly aid. If you do so, roll a die. On a success, your prayers are answered. Remove 1 doom token from the Ancient One's doom track.

situation: You jump onto the train just as the cars begin to move. "All aboard for Kingsport Station!" To remain at this location,
rest: make a Speed (-1) check to leap off before the train gets up to speed. If you fail, or do not wish to roll, move to the Central Hill streets in Kingsport.

situation: You just have one last chasm to cross, but it looks rather dangerous.
rest: Pass a Fight (-1) check or move to the Wireless Station.

situation: You knock on the door of the shack, but it appears that Harney is out.
rest: No encounter.

situation: You know what you are looking for, but the trick will be finding it.
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to search the Unique Item deck for the Livre d'Ivon card.

situation: You learn that cultists are bribing the mayor with stolen items from the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit, and often drop them off on his doorstep. If you would like to reappropriate them,
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check. If you fail, you are arrested. If you roll 1 success, you get away, but empty-handed. If you roll 2 successes, you get away with the packages: Draw 1 Unique Item or Exhibit Item.

situation: You light a candle in prayers for those souls believed to be lost.
rest: You may choose one Ally card that has been returned to the box and reshuffle it back into the Ally deck. If no Ally cards have been returned to the box, gain 1 Sanity instead.

situation: You loiter around Osborn's General Store for a while, but the locals concentrate on their game of checkers, giving you the silent treatment.
rest: No encounter.

situation: You look into a pool of water and see someone!
rest: Choose another investigator and make a Will (-2) check. Successes:  0) He is drawn into the Abyss. 1-2) You and he switch places. 3+) You move to his location, and the gate through which you entered the Abyss is sealed.

situation: You look up and everyone's gone - you must have fallen asleep at the bar. Unnerved by the eerie silence of the previously hopping establishment, you grab the bottle in front of you and skedaddle.
rest: Search the Common Items deck for a Whiskey card.

situation: You look up to see Abigail Foreman leaning over you with hands on hips and a frustrated look on her face.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, she helps you find the book you were looking for. Take the first Tome from the Unique Item deck. If you fail, you've made too much noise. She escorts you out of the Library. Move to the street.

situation: You may
rest: born greets you as you enter his General Store, but lets you look about the shop in peace. you notice a stack of mail meant to be delivered to Dunwich's inhabitents. You may make a Sneak (-1) check to look through some of the letters. If you pass, gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, Joe doesn't take kindly to snooping and you must move to the streets.

situation: You may choose to
rest: eful or get out of here!" You may choose to help load papers onto trucks. If you do, make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, gain $2. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. If you choose not to help load the trucks.move to the streets.

situation: You may choose to help an anthropology professor and his students decipher an ancient stone tablet. If so,
rest: make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you correctly interpret it, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you mispronounce a word and are Cursed.

situation: You may choose to try and infiltrate one of the angled structures. If so,
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, draw 2 Unique Items and keep 1 of them. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You meet Anna Kaslow, a fortune teller who may have some insight into your investigation.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, you persuade her to help you. Take her Ally card if it is available. Otherwise, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: You meet Cindy Fleming, a young geology professor at the University. She offers to show you some interesting formations at the Black Cave. If you accept,
rest: move to the Black Cave and draw 2 cards, encountering one card of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: You meet a research assistant who is quite taken with you.
rest: Roll a die. You gain that many free movement points, to be used immediately on any Tome or other item that requires an expenditure of movement points to use.

situation: You meet an old wise man in the grove who offers to share his wisdom with you. If you accept,
rest: lose your next turn and make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you may draw 1 Skill, or draw 2 Spells, or gain 4 Clue tokens. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: You might be smarter than the Mi-Go realize. They've left you alone with some alien documents.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check to gain a Spell.

situation: You must face the guardian to claim your prize. A monster appears! If you defeat it, you do not collect it as a monster trophy, but you do
rest: gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: You must have been sleepwalking!
rest: Move to Falcon Point and have an encounter there.

situation: You must have fallen into the water. A passerby managed to pull you out and resusitate you. He claims you were dead for a brief time. Perhaps you did go to the other side and returned with new knowledge.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to recollect your experience. If you pass, gain 2 Spells. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You must have that device if you are to escape from this accursed city.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-1) check to draw 1 Unique Item and return to Arkham. If you fail, your captors are none too kind. Lose 3 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

situation: You need to trade something for a warm coat or the icy winds will overwhelm you.
rest: Lose 3 Stamina, but reduce the amount of Stamina lost by 1 (to a minimum of 0) for each Common Item or Unique Item you discard.

situation: You negotiate with a salty old fisherman to get word to the outside.
rest: Spend $4 to gain a Clue token and place it on the space of your choice on the Feds Raid Innsmouth track.

situation: You never know what you'll find in the lost and found box.
rest: Spend up to $5. For each $1 you pay, draw one card from the Common Item deck. You may keep one card, but you must discard the rest.

situation: You note several items of interest behind the counter and approach the shopkeeper, but as you
rest: draw near, he disappears into the stock room. After waiting for a few minutes, you decide that his is not coming back. Nothing happens.

situation: You notice a creepy man watching you as you peruse the books. With a feeling of dread you try to slip out without being followed.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you lose the man. If you fail, you are accosted in the street. He is a wizard and he casts a dark spell on you as you flee. Lose 2 Stamina, move to the street, and you are Cursed. A brass band plays some soft music from the veranda. Tapping your feet along with the catchy tunes, you feel better than you have in a while. Gain 2 Sanity.

situation: You notice a creepy old man dragging a sack near the graveyard. If you want to investigate his suspicious activity,
rest: pass a Sneak (-2) check to gain 1 Unique Item and 1 Spell. If you fail, roll 2 dice and add them together. You lose that many total points of Sanity and/or Stamina, split up however you like.

situation: You notice a glint of light in a crevice. If you reach in,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you feel a sharp pain as teeth clamp down on your hand. You manage to pull free, but you lose 2 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: You notice a man trying to steal one of Neil's items.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, you find he's been stealing several things around town. You return Neil's merchandise but you gain $3. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You notice a piece of wood floating in the water; carved into it is the name of a ship long since sunk. As you touch it, visions of the drowning passengers' last moments of life flood through your mind.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to hurl it away from you. If you fail, you fall to the ground with a cry. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You notice a rare and ancient artifact sitting atop a sea chest.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to convince the old salt who owns it to give it to you. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: You notice a small music box for sale for $2. If you buy it,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you fail the check, the music box plays lovely, but ordinary music. If you pass, however, the song that the music box plays is magical. Draw 1 Spell.

situation: You notice a strangely bound manuscript as you scan the titles of books on a shelf. When you attempt to pull it from the shelf, it tilts slightly and then pulls you into itself! Go to either Unknown Kadath or the Plateau of Leng (your choice) and have
rest: an encounter there before returning.

situation: You notice an odd piece of metallic ore on the ground. If you touch it,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, it smoothly transforms into an odd item. Take the first Unique Item from the deck that isn't a Tome. If you fail, it is absorbed into your skin and assaults your mind. Draw 1 Madness card. "Care for a pickled egg?" If you accept the shopkeeper's offer, make a Luck (+1) check. Gain 1 Stamina per success. If you do not roll any successes, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You notice an odd ship docked by the shore, but no one else seems to pay it any mind. If you decide to swim out to the ship,
rest: roll a die to see how you are received. On a success, move to the second area of any Other World of your choice, even if there isn't currently an open gate leading there. On a failure, you are lost in time and space. "Haven't had time to bring him out to the asylum," Sheriff Engle explains when he notices you eyeing a straitjacketed lunatic ranting in one of the cells. That's when you realize what the madman's saying. You are delayed as you jot notes about his ravings, but gain 2 Clue Tokens.

situation: You notice an odd symbol carved into a tree. It leads you to another tree with a symbol carved into it.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check to follow the path of symbols. If you pass, you discover it leads to an unusual object hidden under a rock. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as you become increasingly exhausted.

situation: You notice that a collection of patients in for some sort of skin condition share a loathsome commonality of appearance.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, but gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You notice that a piece of driftwood looks to have letters of some kind carved into it.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to decipher the coded message. If you pass, gain 1 Spell.

situation: You notice that some of the locals have an odd, fish-like quality that sets your teeth on edge. The shopkeeper notices your gaze and nods. "Marsh stock, from over in Innsmouth. Watch yourself around them." Shivering, you
rest: lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You notice that some of the locals have an odd, fish-like quality to them that sets your teeth on edge.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You notice that the back door of the Whateley home is open. If you go inside,
rest: make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you learn the secret of the Whateley gold, and you may search the Spell deck for an Alchemical Process card and take it. If you fail, Lavinia Whateley catches you and Curses you.

situation: You notice that the graveyard is in terrible disrepair and consider donating money for its upkeep.
rest: For each $1 you donate, you may roll one die. Count the number of successes and consult the chart below: Successes:  0) You are thanked profusely. 1-2) You gain a number of Clue tokens equal to your number of successes. 3+) You gain 2 Clue tokens and may take the Anointed card.

situation: You open a door, and quickly discover that the atmosphere outside cannot sustain human life!
rest: Pass a Speed (+0) check to seal the door again or lose 3 Stamina.

situation: You open some crates on the dock. Inside you find some useful things.
rest: Draw 2 Common Items. Next, make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you get away without being seen. If you fail, you are arrested and taken to the Police Station.

situation: You open what seems like the hundredth file whose contents bear no relation either to each other or the
rest: drawer where you found them. You are delayed.

situation: You overhear Constable Ropes speaking to someone on the phone. Although you only get one half of the conversation, you think you can fill in the details.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You overhear a doctor confessing that he has no idea what's causing the strange symptoms his patient is suffering.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to recognize the problem. If you pass, the doctor asks permission to call on you for future help. Take a Retainer card.

situation: You overhear a history student complaining to his friend about a lack of materials for his Civil War thesis. If you attempt to enlighten him, he pays $1 for each Clue token you are willing to
rest: discard. Also, if you have the Cavalry Saber, Ancient Tome, or Old Journal Common Items, he will pay you double the listed cost for them.

situation: You overhear a man threatening an elderly woman with blackmail. He shows her an envelope, smiles, then returns it to his pocket and heads for the door.
