rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to lift the envelope from his pocket. If you pass, you may either look inside to gain a Clue token or sell it back to the woman for $1.

situation: You overhear the engineer talking. "I swear to you we hit something just outside of town. Something unnatural. And it weren't dead when we left it!"
rest: Draw a monster and place it in the Outskirts.

situation: You overhear two men whispering about the visiting exhibit at the museum. "They cannot discover our plans. We must destroy their tomes." One of them pulls out a lighter and begins to burn the books!
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, you chase them off. If you fail, they escape and you are blamed for the arson; place a Patrol marker on the street area of Miskatonic U.

situation: You own copies of some of the books being used this semester.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check to find students willing to purchase your used copies of the texts. If you pass, gain $2.

situation: You participate in a warding ritual led by Carl Sanford. You may
rest: spend 2 more Clue tokens than it would normally cost you to seal a gate in order to place an elder sign token on any unstable location without an open gate. If you do not spend the Clue tokens or cannot currently seal gates, then nothing happens.

situation: You pass a room where a muscular, bored-looking man stands before a pile of groaning, fallen men. "What about you?" he calls out to you. "Can you take a punch?" If you allow him to drive his fist into your gut,
rest: lose 2 Stamina. If this does not knock you unconscious, take Sir William Brinton's Ally card, or, if it's not available, take $5 instead.

situation: You pass the night in animated conversation with an old man sucking on a clay pipe. When you awaken, the man is gone without a trace, but you do
rest: gain 1 Clue token from his wisdom.

situation: You pass the strange house and find yourself face to face with a foreign man with a penetrating gaze.
rest: If you have any Exhibit Items or your Will is 2 or lower, he seems to approve of your simpering manner, and he introduces himself as Dr. Ali Kafour. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, listen to him expound upon the ancient Egyptian pantheon as it compares to that of Native American myths: Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You pause to look over the construction site, marveling at man's ability to encroach even here, in this isolated, haunting place. Nothing happens.

You pause to watch a large bearded man sculpt in his front yard. His name is Ted Covey, and he proves to be loud, boisterous, and a good joke teller. You talk with him a while longer, then move on with a smile on your face.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You peek into the back room and see Miriam Beecher, the shopkeeper, unwrapping a mummy stolen from the visiting museum exhibit! If you turn her in, the Sheriff rewards you with a license to investigate as you see fit; take the Private Investigator card, if it is available. However, Miriam's neighbors think you betrayed her.
rest: Place a Patrol marker in the street area of Uptown.

situation: You peek into the back room and see Miriam Beecher, the shopkeeper, unwrapping a mummy stolen from the visiting museum exhibit! If you turn her in, the Sheriff rewards you with a license to investigate as you see fit; take the Private Investigator card. However, Miriam's neighbors think you betrayed her, and you are Barred from Uptown.
You peer through a strange machine of glass and stone, its lenses pointed towrds the dark, sunless sky. There, impossibly far away, you behold the Earth.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens, but make a Will (-3) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You pick up a chestnut, and it begins to writhe in your hands.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to fling it away. If you fail, the grub inside bursts forth, grows to impossible size, and attacks you. A monster appears!

situation: You pick up a shock-white feather from the cracked ground, sensing something strange about it.
rest: Keep this card. You may discard it to prevent any investigator from losing up to 3 Sanity or Stamina.

situation: You plead with William Bain for assistance. If you
rest: pass a Will (-1) check, he agrees and works a powerful spell. Remove all rift progress tokens from 1 rift, closing it immediately. If you fail, he refuses explaining that he cannot interfere with the world of man without endangering himself.

situation: You plunge into the icy waters. Even drowning is better than seeing that terrible form again. If
rest: your Stamina is 3 or less, you are lost in time and space.

situation: You push yourself to the limit.
rest: Roll one die for each point of Stamina you have. Lose 1 Stamina for each die that does not roll a success. If you do not fall unconscious, gain 1 Clue token for each die that rolled a success.

situation: You quickly determine that you are in Kingsport in 1685. To your amazement, you are greeted by a man you know to still be alive in 1926, William Bain.
rest: If you pass a Will -2 check or discard an Ancient Tome, he offers you his help. Take his Ally card. If it isn't available, you are Blessed.

situation: You reach out and touch a great pillar of darkness, anchoring your lost allies.
rest: If there are any investigators lost in time and space, you return to Arkham and they are moved to the street location nearest you.

situation: You read a book in the library about some horrible Polynesian rituals.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You read a detailed description of humanity's extinction.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You realize that an old book that Neil has just received has been serving as a nest for a multitude of biting insects.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to get it outside before they start spreading. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You realize that the Hound has seen you as you gazed at it across the ages.
rest: If there is a Hound of Tindalos in the monster cup, it appears.

situation: You realize too late that the train you boarded is empty.
rest: Draw the top gate marker and travel to that Other World and replace the gate marker on top of the gate marker pile.

situation: You realize too late that you've walked into a trap. A horrifying monster appears!
You recognize an odd object tucked inside a bird's nest.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to remove the object without attracting the attention of any of the large birds nearby. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item.

situation: You recognize an old, dilapidated building as your home. On a hunch, you search the house to see if you've written a letter to yourself, knowing that you would be here at some point in the future.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find a very informative letter from your future self. Gain 3 Clue tokens. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as there is no sign that you ever returned to this place.

situation: You recognize one of the Lodge Members as a friend from years ago.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to convince him to help you in some way. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. Whether you pass or not, move to the street. "A strong soul must be willing to make sacrifices," Father Michael says. You may discard a single beneficial Investigator card (a Spell, Item, Ally, etc.) to make a Luck (+1) check. If you pass, you are restored to full Sanity. If you fail, you gain only 1 Sanity.

situation: You recognize several members of the Sheldon Gang in line.
rest: If you have a Sheldon Gang Membership, you keep silent as they run a classic con on the bank teller, and they slip you $4 on the way out of the bank. If you do not have a membership, knowing that they've got to be up to no good, you warn the bank guard and directs them to leave. However, you get punched in the stomach by one of the Sheldon boys on their way out. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You recognize the building you are in as a library, but it is necessary to operate strange machines to find the books you seek.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens and then search the Common Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: You recognize the landscape as being Dunwich, but you see no recognizable buildings. A group of Vikings stand near a large stone covered in glyphs and are speaking a language you don't understand. When the discussion is over, they begin to bury the stone.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to memorize the location. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You recognize the man asking after a room as a wanted murderer.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check to stop him from getting away and to collect a $5 reward from the police. If you fail, he fights his way free and you lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You recognize this landscape from a painting you saw recently.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to remember the details of the artwork. If you pass you recall a strange object depicted and can find that location. Gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: You recognize this place from your childhood. You used to play here all the time.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You rest a bit beside a small, glowing pool filled with black, blind fish.
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to notice an unusual object in the water. Fishing it out, you draw 1 Unique Item and gain $3.

situation: You rest and dangle your feet in the cool brook.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. A cave-in blocks the path you came in! Your only hope is to find another way out. Stay here next turn.

situation: You run for the boat.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to reach it in time. If you do, you escape with vital information. Gain 5 Clue tokens. If you fail, stay here next turn, hiding from your pursuer.

situation: You run into the Dean and try to convince him to let you write a manuscript for the college.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to take a Retainer card.

situation: You scrabble for the thing briefly after fumbling it, but it spins and bounces from your fingertips, falling away into the faint light radiated by the Throken Peaks themselves.
rest: Discard your least expensive Weapon. A monster appears, as uncaring as the wastes.

situation: You scrounge up some painkillers.
rest: Regain 2 Stamina.

situation: You see Carl Sanford covertly trying to find a place on the island to recite a ritual.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you get close enough to hear what he is saying and gain 3 Clue tokens.

situation: You see Joe Sargent facing the shoreline, muttering something to himself.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to listen to the strange language he's speaking and gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You see a child dancing among the graves. Following her, you find that she has vanished, but she's led you straight to something interesting.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, draw 1 Common Item.

situation: You see a customer going into seizures. If you want to try to help,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check to restrain him and keep him from hurting himself or a Lore (-2) check to correctly sedate him. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina as he lashes out. If you pass, the convulsions subside and a nun rushes to you side, saying, "Bless you, good sir, for helping." You are Blessed.

situation: You see a dog sniffing and digging at the ground beneath a particular tree. After a few minutes of excavation, you unearth the remains of some victim of a brutal attack.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. But the contents of his wallet remain intact, providing his name and some cash. Gain 1 Clue token and $1.

situation: You see a door marked "Private" leading down to a small storage room. You may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check to go through undetected. If you pass, you discover a number of historical documents and photos concerning the old church that used to be here. Gain 1 Clue token. If you fail, you are escorted out. Move to the streets.

situation: You see a familiar face about to get on a train leaving Arkham.
rest: Draw an Ally card and then make a Will (-2) check. If you pass, you've convinced your friend to stay and may take the Ally card. If you fail, the Ally card is returned to the box.

situation: You see a flier looking for investors in a new plan to establish a railroad across the country.
rest: Pay $3 if you want to invest. If you do, gain a Retainer card and a Rail Pass.

situation: You see a group of masked Egyptian cultists performing a hideous ritual in a clearing. If you wish to get closer and listen,
rest: make a Sneak (+0) check. If you pass, draw 1 Spell. If you fail, the look up as one and point at you, and you know that you are marked. Place a Patrol marker on the street area of the Merchant District, as an aura of unnaturalness surrounds you.

situation: You see a half-crumpled sketch lying next to a bench. It strikes you as interesting because it is clearly your face that was being sketched. When you unfold the paper, you are horrified to see it is a depiction of you being murdered horribly.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You see a horrid shape descend from the sky, carrying a body.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity. If you pass, you watch it descend toward the Black Cave. If you follow it, gain 2 Clue tokens and move to the Black Cave, where you immediately have another encounter.

situation: You see a large painting that you recognize as a map of the ocean floor. You can identify the city of Y'ha-nthlei on the map and see several other similar cities represented as well.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success. If you get no successes, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You see a light on in the house!
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to eavesdrop on what's going on inside. If you pass, gain 1 Spell. If you fail, you race away before you are caught. Move to the streets. "Hey! Get out of here!" Hiram Grumbacher, the construction foreman, angrily runs you off the construction site. Move to the Causeway.

situation: You see a man being pursued across by hideous half-human, half-bestial creatures. If you help him fight them off,
rest: lose 3 Stamina. Even if you are knocked unconscious, the man, David Packard, owes you his life and intends to pay his debt. Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, he gives you something "for protection." You may search the Common Item deck for Dynamite and take it.

situation: You see a painting of a rural landscape with dark clouds on the horizon. You can see the faint image of monstrous appendages hidden among the clouds.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity. If you had a Madness card before you failed the check, add 1 Dunwich Horror token to the board.

situation: You see a poster on the wall with your picture on it. There is a reward offered for your capture.
rest: Make a Sneak (+0) check to make yourself scarce. If you pass, take the Wanted card if it is available. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and you are arrested.

situation: You see a priest glaring angrily at the Order's building. If you are
rest: Cursed or either your Stamina or Sanity is 2 or lower, he introduces himself as Father Iwanicki, and says, "This place is abhorrent and you are righteous to stand against it." Take his Ally card or, if it is not available, you may search the Unique Item deck for the Holy Water card and take it. "Fish teem in the waters past Devil Reef, but off Falcon Point? Barely any!" The old man spits. Pass a Will (-1) check to keep him talking and gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You see a prim and proper girl in puritanical attire, but there is something hungry in her eyes. "Would you like to see?" she asks, demurely. If you agree, she reaches forward to touch you. You feel a terrible cold, then the burning heat of the pyre! You realize that she is the ghost of Keziah Mason, who was burned at the stake for witchcraft over a century ago!
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. You may gain 1 Clue token for each success or 1 Spell for every two successes.

situation: You see a reflection of yourself and realize how much your experiences have changed you. You believe the knowledge you've
rest: gained is worth the sacrifices you've made. If your Sanity is at full, you may discard 3 Clue tokens to be Blessed. Otherwise, if you are not at full Sanity, for each Clue token you discard, gain 1 Sanity

situation: You see a richly dressed man making a large withdrawal. On the way out, he lights his cigar with a piece of green paper which he then drops on the ground.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check to stub it out with your toe before it burns up. You discover it to be a slightly singed two dollar bill. Gain $2.

situation: You see a small boat carrying a few fishermen approaching the reef. In the water, you see dark silhouettes swimming quickly toward the boat.
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to warn the men in time. If you pass, they manage to escape back toward Innsmouth. Gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity as you see the men pulled into the sea.

situation: You see a strange young man dickering with Neil over the price of a musty book. "Blast you, man! Just set a price, already!" It turns out that Neil's more interested in a couple of your items, however. If you
rest: discard 2 Common Items the young man gives his name as Charles Dexter Ward. Take his Ally card, or if it's not available, draw the top 5 Spells and keep one of them.

situation: You see a sudden green flash of light somewhere ahead of you on the path. Racing to get there, you find a smoldering, scorched book. If you wish, you may try to
rest: gain what knowledge you can from it before it is reduced to ashes. If you do, lose 1 Stamina as it burns your hands and then, if you are still conscious, gain 1 Spell.

situation: You see a trunk on a rock below that has apparently fallen and split open. If you wish you may try to climb down and retrieve it.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to reach it safely. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina. Then, whether you passed or not, if you are still conscious, gain 1 Unique Item.

situation: You see a veteran, blinded by gas during the Great War, come into the diner.
rest: Spend $2 to buy him dinner or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You see a warped mirror. If you look into it, you see yourself in another time and place, holding an ankh in one hand and a sacrificial blade in the other.
rest: Your number of Clue tokens doubles, but if you gain more than 3 Clue tokens in this manner, you are Cursed.

situation: You see a woman pouring blood on a field of flowers. When you move closer, she is gone.
rest: Make a Luck (+1) check. If you pass, she left her jewelry among the blood, and you gain $3. If you fail, the strange combination of blood and flowers is toxic and you lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You see a young man weeping over a marble statue of a beautiful young woman. The curses he cries out against the gods chill your bones.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You see a young woman sneak out of a window.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you fail, she's disappeared into the night. If you pass, you catch up to Sarah Danforth, an archaeology student from Miskatonic. She tells you that important archaeological finds are being melted down for gold inside that refinery. Take her Ally card. If it is not available, gain 1 Clue token instead as she tells you everything she discovered in the refinery's files.

situation: You see an apparently confused old man, asking strangers if they've seen his mommy and daddy. To help him, you find the proprietor. Mr. Darke tells you that he'll take care of it and then asks the elderly man if he's learned his lesson about little boys sneaking where they're not suppose to be.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token. "You look a mite lost!" A fisherman has found you. If you are willing to spend $3 or discard an item in exchange, he's willing to offer passage off this rock. If you accept the offer, move to any aquatic location aand have an encounter there.

situation: You see an interesting book sitting open on Miriam Beecher's desk.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check or you peer closely at its pages only to realize too late that the book is Cursed... and now, so are you. A pool in one of the rooms reveals many figures swimming beneath the floor you are standing on. You then see the shadow of something very large swim past. Make a Will (-1) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You see an older man gazing out at the city of Kingsport, reminiscing about the changes the town has seen.
rest: If you currently have 3 or more Clue tokens, much of what he says makes terrible sense and gives you insight into the inner workings of the town. you may choose any rift progress marker to either discard (if its associated rift is closed) or turn face down (if its associated rift is open).

situation: You see flashlights in the darkness. The constables are here looking for you!
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to elude them. If you fail, you are arrested and taken to the Innsmouth Jail.

situation: You see men of questionable character guiding one of the visiting museum curators toward the edge of the dock...his hands are tied! He pleads to you for help with silent eyes. If you aid him,
rest: make a Fight (-2) check. If you pass, you wrest the weapon from one and chase them off; you may search the Common Item deck and take the Tommy Gun card. If you fail, lose 2 Stamina.

situation: You see primitive, hunched figures burning meat upon an altar. They chant in a language you do not recognize but the repetition begins to insinuate the words into your memory. Would you like to memorize the chant? If you do,
rest: make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, gain a "One of the Thousand" Membership card. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity. If you choose not to, the words affect your subconscious, shaping your dreams against your will. Lose 1 Sanity and gain 1 Clue token.  A book that you thought contained useful information has suddenly turned into a vivid description of methods of torture. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You see runes carved on the cave wall, but then... is it a trick of the light, or are the walls dripping silver?
rest: Make a Speed (-2) check to copy the runes in time. If you pass, draw a number of Spells equal to the number of successes rolled. You may keep one, and must discard the rest.

situation: You see someone battling a monster and rush to help. A monster appears! If you fight and defeat it, you may roll a number of dice equal to its toughness. If you roll a success, you may
rest: draw a random Ally. If you do not roll any successes, you may draw a Unique Item.

situation: You see the constables leading someone whose face is covered with a black bag down to the water. While they're preparing their boat, you may
rest: make a Sneak (-1) check to release their prisoner. If you pass, gain 2 Sanity. If you fail, you are arrested and taken to the Innsmouth Jail.

situation: You see the corner of some worn antique trunk poking up out of the ground where the workmen have been digging.
rest: Make a Sneak (-2) check to dig it up and reveal the contents. If you pass, gain 1 Common Item. If you fail, move to the Causeway A car has smashed into a tree. The driver, a member of the Sheldon Gang, is unconscious and a bag of stolen valuables sits next to him. You can hear other members of the gang coming through the woods looking for him. Make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, gain $3. If you fail, you are delayed While hiding from the gang.

situation: You see the debris of some wrecked boat floating in the water.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, you spot something useful amid the splintered wood and torn canvas. Gain 1 Common Item.

situation: You see the faint glimmer of an object poised on a precipice.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to climb your way out to it safely. If you succeed, draw 1 Unique Item. If you fail, the precipice crumbles and you are lost in time and space.

situation: You see the mountains move.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity from the terror.

situation: You see what looks like a deer walking toward you, seemingly unafraid. You then see that eating the grass near this place has mutated it.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to defend yourself. Lose 1 Stamina if you fail.

situation: You sense powerful, ancient voice attempt flood your mind with terrible thoughts.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You share a train car with a foreign visitor. When you step off and open your valise, you realize you grabbed the wrong one!
rest: Discard a Common or Unique Item if able, then make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, draw a number of Unique or Exhibit Items equal to the number of successes rolled, and keep one. If you fail, follow the instructions as above but draw from the Common Item deck. (Clarification: you will need to discard a second item before you make the second Luck check. You receive nothing if you fail this second check.

situation: You sigh loudly, folding an archive copy of the Advertiser shut, no wiser than when you opened it. The reporter on the other side of the room looks up. "Help you find something?" he asks. "I've got nothing but time...for a price."
rest: Buy as many Clues as you like for $3 each.

situation: You sit and chat with the pleasant, if old-fashioned, William Bain. He seems to be very poorly informed of the outside world, but extremely knowledgable of more exotic subjects. Nothing happens.
You sit next to a small boy in the waiting room while his mother is in surgery. He tells you that his mommy protected him from a big monster with scary fangs. You tell him everything will be fine.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token and lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You sleep, fitfully, and awaken to the sound of your own voice, chanting something.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you are able to retain what you are saying. Draw 1 Spell and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, the chant attracts something unsavory. A monster appears!

situation: You slept more soundly than you anticipated and wake up suddenly as you are being lifted out of your bed.
rest: Make a Fight (+0) check to wrestle free from your captors. If you fail, immediately move to Devil Reef and have an encounter.

situation: You slide down a muddy hill and strike your head against a rock. Half-conscious, your mind fills with images of horrific gods. When you awake, a bizarre chant still echoes in your thoughts.
rest: Gain 1 Spell and lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You slowly clamber up the stone formation known as the Face of Neptune.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina and move to Harborside streets.

situation: You sneak a peek at the medical records for a recent admission who was involved in a cult ritual.
rest: Pass a Lore (+0) check to learn something about the cult's methods Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You sneak down to Ma's kitchen for a midnight snack.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check to see if there's any leftovers waiting for you. Gain 1 Stamina per success.

situation: You sneak into a finger-painting session.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity. "Come on, love. Let's go back to my place and I'll paint your portrait for you." A tall, dark-haired lothario presses his affections upon a reluctant young lady nearby while holding onto her arm. If you wish, you may interfere. If so, pass a Fight (-1) check or a Will (-2) check to drive him off and gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as he backhands you cruelly before storming off.

situation: You sneak into the back of a lecture on New England Coastal Folklore and Its Similarities to That of the South Seas Islanders.
rest: Gain 2 Clue tokens, then pass a Will (-1) check or lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You spin a yarn to a group of assembled reporters.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to see how many of them believe you. Gain $1 per success.

situation: You spot a prowler trying to break in through a kitchen window.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to scare him off. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. "Jazz" Mulligan, the college's head janitor, is here, mopping something up. "You shouldn't look in that room, now. It's not a sight for decent folks, and the police are already on the case." Despite his warning, you take a peek and lose 1 Sanity as you see the red mess he's cleaning up.

situation: You spot a rat leaving the kitchen.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to convince Velma to bribe you $5 not to tell anyone.

situation: You spy a suspicious-looking man attempting to sneak a rare book out of the building.
rest: Make a Fight (+1) check to stop him. If you succeed, a grateful Abigail Foreman offers you $3 as reward. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You stand before the gatekeepers Nasht and Kamen-Tha.
rest: Pass a Lore (-2) check or return to Arkham, but do not receive an explored token.

situation: You stand before the massive citadel and feel baleful forces inspecting you.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you roll no successes you have been Cursed!

situation: You stand inside the door, surveying the crooks, drunks, and miscreants. Would anyone even be able to notice if a greater evil arose among this scum? The only way to ensure Arkham's safety is to act now.
rest: If you have an Elder Sign, you may discard it to seal this location. "After my husband passed away, I thought the Society would be interested in his documents. He was very influential in Arkham." Make a Luck (-2) check to see if the curator recognizes their arcane significance. If you pass, gain 1 Spell as the Society passes these papers off to you.

situation: You stand on a street corner listening to a talented violinist play beautifully.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity. Then, if you pay $1, gain 1 additional Sanity. "Have you come to empty out your safety deposit box?" One of the tellers hands you a key. "This way, please." Confused, you follow her as she leads you down into the vault, where you retrieve a small box and open it up with the key. Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find an odd object inside. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, the box contains only a stern warning for you to flee Arkham immediately, never to return. Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You stare into the face of madness.
rest: Roll 1 die for each point of Sanity you have. Lose 1 Sanity for each die that does not roll a success. If you do not go insane, gain 1 Clue token for each die that rolled a success.

situation: You stare into the river, contemplating its currents and depths.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, you realize that time, fate, all of reality, are like a river; take the Visions card. If you fail, a pair of dock workers knock you into the river as a lark, and you catch a cold. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You start digging in a patch of grond where, as long as you can recall, no grass has ever grown.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens as you unearth a pocket watch inscribed with the name of a man who went missing decades ago. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina for exhausting yourself fruitlessly.

situation: You stealthily watch an old man place something in a hollow tree. Waiting for him to leave, you may reach in to retrieve the item.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check if so. If you pass, draw 1 Common item. If you fail, something in the tree savages your hand. Lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You step out onto a balcony overlooking thousands of these fish creatures, all chanting and bowing before an image of Dagon.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity.

situation: You step up to a waiting cab just as a well-dressed traveller does. "I'm headed that way, too," says the other man. "The fare's on me."
rest: Move to any street or Arkham location and have an encounter there. A group of hooded cultists are having a meeting among the standing stones on the island. Pass a Sneak (-1) check to overhear some of what they have to say. Gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You stop by to say hello when you hear an argument from Sheriff Engle's office. "But why would a killer perfume the body with lavender and peppermint?"
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you recognize those herbs as being used in an ancient Egyptian embalming practices. Gain 1 Clue Token and the Sheriff rewards you with the Private Investigator card.

situation: You stop to smell an unusual flower in the woods, only to feel your memories fading. You must
rest: pass a Will (+0) check or discard all of your Clue tokens.

situation: You strike up a conversation with a man digging a grave. He's got a wry wit that puts all the doom and gloom you've experienced into perspective.
rest: Gain 1 Sanity. A couple of students have snuck outside, behind the school. Make a Sneak (-2) check to overhear what they say to each other when they think no one else is listening. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You stumble across a hidden pocket of lava.
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina from the burns.

situation: You stumble across a wormhole-riddled corpse lying beneath a gravestone.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. Mustering your courage, you turn it over to see who it was. If you pass a Luck (-2) check, you don't recognize the man, but he was clutching an odd item. Gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail, you don't recognize the man, but he has nothing of value.

situation: You stumble across an ancient stone table. It has several deep groves carved into its surface and stained dark brown. If you
rest: spend 1 monster trophy with a moon dimensional symbol, the ancient beings here are pleased. Any one investigator you choose (even yourself) is Blessed.

situation: You stumble across an excerpt from the Necronomicon in the archives.
rest: Pass a Lore (-1) check to search the Spell deck and take a spell of your choice. "Fancy two such nice folks comin' for a visit the same day. Allow me to make some introductions." Gain 1 Ally.

situation: You stumble across the Sheldon Gang experimenting with a still. One of them threatens you, but you convince him that a nip from the still will keep their whereabouts a secret as far as you are concerned.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to search the Common Item deck for a Whiskey card.

situation: You stumble down a twisting passage and a monster appears!
You stumble through the doors, desperately seeking peace. But then you realize that the powers you face care nothing for morals, or hope, or humanity.
rest: Lose an amount of Sanity equal to the number of gates currently open.

situation: You stumble upon a discussion of the Ancient Ones. If you continue on your way, nothing happens. If you stop to listen,
rest: pass a Lore (-3) check or lose 4 Sanity. If you pass, take this card. If the Ancient One awakens, you may discard this card to cancel its entire attack for one turn.

situation: You stumble upon a nightmare, and must relive your past battles with horrible creatures. One of your monster trophies, chosen at random, returns to life and surprises you!
You stumble upon a pocket of bad air. Coughing, you struggle to stagger free.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you pass, nothing happens. If you fail, lose 3 Stamina.

situation: You stumble upon an autopsy room and see something on the table that looks like a man... but with the head of an alligator!
rest: Pass a Lore (+1) check to gain 1 Clue token, then pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You stumble upon an autopsy room.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check to stay calm while you investigate. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina as you cut yourself on one of the autopsy implements.

situation: You stumble upon an old shack, but it looks like animals got inside and have torn up just about everything.
rest: Make a Luck (-2) check to see if any reading material survived. If you pass, search the Common Item deck for the first Tome you find and take it.

situation: You suspect you may be carrying too many things to make this climb!
rest: If you have 4 or more items you must either discard 1 or lose 1 Stamina.

situation: You suspect you would travel more quickly if you weren't carrying so many things.
rest: Discard 1 item or you are delayed.

situation: You take a job working in the diner for tips, and you'll never disparage a waitress again.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check. If you succeed, gain $2. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina but you may search the Skill deck for the Speed card and take it. A folded note addressed to "Wilbur" pokes out from under the door. Having a look at it, you discover it is written in some sort of code. Make a Lore (-2) check to decipher it. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You take a renowned visiting escape artist on a tour of the witch house. If you give him
rest: 2 of your Spells (discarding them), he introduces himself as Erich Weiss; take his Ally card if it's available. If it's not available, he shows you a trick instead, and you gain 2 Clue tokens.

situation: You take careful notes of all of your experiences. You are certain they will come in handy later.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token.

situation: You talk with William Bain for a time, and he grows increasingly nervous. If you are
rest: Cursed, you find yourself suddenly overwhelmed with terror and hurl yourself out the only door to the small house. As the door opens directly over the cliff, you fall to the sea below and are devoured. If you are not Cursed, you control yourself, and nothing happens.

situation: You think a man in the waiting room is having a more serious emergency than he realizes.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to make a correct diagnosis. If you pass, gain 1 Sanity. If you fail, move to the streets as you are curtly asked to leave.

situation: You think you could reach the Wireless Station by scrambling up a steep incline. If you wish to give it a try,
rest: make a Fight (-1) check. If you pass, move to the Wireless Station. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and move to the Harborside streets. "Sorry folks, it's midnight. Time to close up." Move to the street.

situation: You think you've found valuable information in this reference book, but a loud conversation near you is making it hard to concentrate.
rest: Make a Will (-2) check and gain 2 Clue tokens if you pass. A couple of workers are walking with a half-hopping gait to the back of the building. One of them stumbles and drops a large canvas bag, spilling several strange objects on the ground. He tries to gather them back up quickly, but may have missed something. Make a Luck (-2) check. For each success, you may draw 1 Unique Item. Choose 1 to keep and discard the rest.

situation: You touch Founder's Rock.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, there is an electrifying shock that opens your mind to the elder things of eons past. Lose 1 Stamina, but gain 2 Clue tokens and draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you find a strange carving. As you finger the grooves, a gate opens here and you are drawn through it. "Admiring our library?" Carl Sanford asks you. "Membership has privileges. Borrow one of our texts if you wish." Search Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: You touch the altar and a bright light flashes.
rest: Draw a mythos card and go to the gate location shown. Draw four location cards and choose one of them to encounter, discarding the others. "Sorry folks, it's time for lights out! You can come back tomorrow, but for now you'll all have to leave!" Move to the street

situation: You tread water, looking for any sign of land, when something brushes against your leg.
rest: Spend 1 gate trophy, 5 toughness worth of monster trophies, or 3 Clue tokens. If you cannot, you are devoured.

situation: You trip over a bloodstained axe that had lain hidden beneath a tangle of brush. If you
rest: pass a Luck (+1) check, it isn't too badly rusted: You may search the Common Item deck for the Axe card and take it.?

situation: You trip over a stack of books obviously undisturbed for years, if not decades.
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you succeed, search the Unique Item deck and take the first Tome you find.

situation: You trip over a stone outcropping that shouldn't be there.
rest: Pass a Speed (-1) check or you are lost in time and space.

situation: You trip over an object which turns out to be a rusty lockbox. If you open it,
rest: make a Luck (+0) check and consult the following chart: Successes:  0) A rotted human foot. Lose 1 Sanity. 1) Draw 1 Common Item. 2) Draw 1 Unique Item. 3+) $10 in jewelry.

situation: You try talking to the elderly locals gathered around the potbellied stove playing checkers, but you
rest: gain nothing but stares and few befuddled grunts for your trouble. Apparently they don't like outsiders. No encounter.

situation: You try to pump the people of the neighborhood for information about the Terrible Old Man, but they prove reluctant to talk.
rest: You are delayed.

situation: You try to recall every scrap of information you learned about this place to prevent these creatures from running rampant.
rest: If you have 2 or fewer Clue tokens, add 1 Uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track.

situation: You try to rouse a man from a coma brought on by a visit to the Black Cave. Awakening, he begins to ramble. If you are lucky, you will be able to make out some of the words before the nurse comes.
rest: Gain a number of Clue tokens equal to your Luck. A window opens, and a strange, gentle man dressed in archaic clothes smiles at you. If you pass a Will (-2) check or discard Ancient Tome, he introduces himself as William Bain and offers you his help. Take his Ally card. if it isn't available, you are Blessed.

situation: You turn a corner and come face to face with a hideous beast!
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, you faint in horror and hit your head, suffering a mild concussion. Discard 1 Spell or Skill of your choice. If you succeed, you realize that it is just a statue on loan from the "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit, and your turn ends.

situation: You turn to flee from the monster, but as it pursues you the crumbling house gives way beneath it!
rest: Pass a Luck (-2) check to either gain 2 Clue tokens or claim 1 monster trophy at random from the cup, ignoring the Endless ability. If you fail, move to the street. "Excuse me, stranger, but have you ever seen this symbol before?" A man standing near the house holds up an occult symbol. Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, the man introduces himself as Thomas F. Malone, a police detective visiting Arkham on a case. He's impressed with you and offers to join you. Take his Ally card. If it's not available, he tells you some valuable information instead. Gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, nothing happens.

situation: You turn to see a small furry form dart quickly out of the room, making off with one of your possessions.
rest: Discard 1 item of your choice. If you have no items, then nothing happens.

situation: You visit with the strange, otherworldly William Bain for awhile, when suddenly he hushes you, frantically locks the door and all the windows, and then douses the light. The two of you crouch in silence as a chilling shadow makes its way around the house, trying every door and window before leaving.
rest: You are delayed and lose 1 Sanity. A couple of Kingsport children got stuck on a rock outcropping while looking for a rumored treasure. Make a Luck (-2) check. If you pass, the rumors are true. Gain a Unique Item. Regardless of whether you pass or not, you are delayed rescuing the children.

situation: You wake in the night hearing inhuman sounds getting closer.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the sounds grow more distant and nothing happens. If you fail, you escape out the window. Move to the streets and take the Harried card if it is available.

situation: You wake up suddenly after terrible dreams, unsure of how long you have been here.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity, and you are delayed. "Hey, buddy, you forgot your bag!" You didn't, but before you can object, the man is gone. You open the bag and find a Common Item inside.

situation: You wake up to find your bed burning!
rest: Pass a Speed (+0) check to escape. If you fail, you are lost in time and space. In any event, there is no sign of the fire afterwards.

situation: You walk around the shores of Lake Hali, seeking to reach the distant and shrouded sity that sits there. However, no matter how far you walk, it always remains on the far side of the lake.
rest: Stay here next turn. "I am demoiselle Jeanne d'Ys," she says, her beautiful eyes and charming accent piercing your heart. If you stay with her, gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity, but you are delayed. If you leave her, pass a Luck (-1) check or lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity.

situation: You walk in on a grisly sight. The constables are dragging a brutally beaten figure out of a cell. "A tragic suicide," they explain.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity. A black hood is thrown over your head, and you are taken to the docks, where you are placed on a small rowboat. After some time, your bonds are removed, and you are pushed roughly out of the boat and onto the ground. "Have fun!" the guards say, laughing. Pulling off your hood, you find yourself far out to sea on top of a reef. Move to Devil Reef and have an encounter.

situation: You wander for several hours, then emerge in a clearing some time after dark. Looking up at the vast, starry sky, you are struck by just how insignificant mankind is within this cold, uncaring universe.
rest: Lose 1 Sanity.

situation: You wander in the frozen wastes.
rest: No encounter.

situation: You wander into the Enchanted Forest.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you find succulent fruit that restores 1 Stamina. If you fail, you get lost and are delayed.

situation: You wander past the bank after hours, and see the night watchman convulsing on the floor!
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to restrain him. If you fail, you lose 1 Stamina. If you pass, he begins speaking in tongues, and some unknown power Blesses you. "You lookin' fer Wilbur? I seen hin here. On his way to Sentinel Hill." A local farmer sees you examining the bridge. Make a Lore (-2) check to learn what you can from the man. Gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: You wander the empty streets of the city.
rest: No encounter.

situation: You wander the frozen wastes.
rest: No encounter.

situation: You wander through endless rows of tablets, scrolls, and tomes. If you wish, you may
rest: spend 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina to make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, you may search the Common Item, Unique Item, or Exhibit Item deck for any single Tome card and take that card.

situation: You watch some workers cleaning the presses with rages while the machines are still running, and you wonder if that's safe. A moment later, your thought proves prophetic as one of them screams, his arm caught in the press. Several workers rush to his aid, while others clear the room. You are moved to the street.
You watch the creatures operate a device which seems to transport things to and from Earth.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to learn how to operate it. If you pass, return to Arkham.

situation: You watch two women walk the island while they speak of the Hyades, Hali, and Lost Carcosa.
rest: Gain 1 Clue token, then make a Sneak (-2) check. If you pass, you hear further details, gaining 1 more Clue token. If you fail, they see you and call upon protection. A monster appears!

situation: You watch, disturbed, as two students immerse a live rabbit in fluid, instantly transforming it to marble!
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check to take the fluid before they can do anything dangerous with it. If you pass, search the Unique Item deck for Petrifying Solution and take it. If you fail, they catch you in the act and splash some of the fluid on you. You are delayed. "Care to join the order?" asks Carl Sanford and his henchmen. If you accept, pay $3 and take a Silver Twilight Membership. If you decline, pass a Will (-1) check or lose 3 Stamina as the henchmen assist you to the door. Whether you pass or not, move to the street.

situation: You weed through piles of junk looking for something useful.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to see what you find. If you pass, your search has resulted in success. You may look at the top cards of both the Common and Unique Item decks. You may purchase one, both, or neither at list price. If you fail, there is little of interest here, but you may look at the top card of the Common Item deck and purchase it for its list price. "All the answers to life's mysteries can be found at the center of the Maze of Mirrors! Enter if you dare, my friend. Only $1!" You may pay $1 to make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, you find a strange inscription at the center of the maze. Draw 1 Spell. If you fail, you wander aimlessly. Stay here next turn.

situation: You were told the book you were looking for was on one of these tables, but there's hundreds of books stacked in random piles!
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check to find it and gain 2 Clue tokens if you pass. If you fail, you are delayed.

situation: You were told the old man who dwells within lives alone, but you can distinctly hear him talking loudly to someone.
rest: Make a Sneak (-1) check. If you pass, you overhear him sharing arcane secrets. Gain 1 Spell. If you fail you must move to the streets to avoid being caught. As innocent as the house looks, you cannot help but think that a malevolent force once dwelt here that is reaching out to you even now. Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, take the Tainted card if it is available.

situation: You wrestle shadows for what seems like days, only to emerge into a plain of blinding light.
rest: Lose either 1 Stamina or 1 Sanity.

situation: You're called in for your expertise in the unusual to help examine a violent man who attacked cast members of "The King in Yellow."
rest: Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue Tokens. If you fail, Sheriff Engle demands that you stay and sort out the case. Stay here next turn.

situation: You're conversing with some fishermen down by the water, your back to the waves, when their eyes go wide with fright and they begin to flee.
rest: Make a Speed (-1) check to follow them, else strong and rubbery arms grab you from behind and drag you out to Devil Reef. Move there and immediately have an encounter.

situation: You're dizzy from the strange ray.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or lose 1 item of your choice.

situation: You're getting ready to turn in for the night when you discover a corpse lying in your bed.
rest: Pass a Will (-1) check to keep your cool. If you fail, the terror level increases by 1. In any case, examining the body yields 1 Clue token.

situation: You're invited to a midnight séance. If you attend, you may commune with the spirit realm:
rest: Look at the top two cards of the Mythos deck and replace them, facedown, in any order you like. However Ma Mathison breaks up the séance and says that "yew devil worshippers better not come round no more!" You are Barred from Southside.

situation: You're invited to take part in a Gating ceremony. If you agree,
rest: spend 2 Clue tokens and 1 Sanity to make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, close one gate of your choice. If you fail, nothing happens. A prisoner thinks he can get free if he gets enough money to bribe one of the constables. He offers to sell you the last of his belongings. Draw 1 Common Item. You may purchase it for the list price. If you do not have enough money but have at least $1, you may purchase it by discarding all of your money. If you have no money or choose not to purchase the item, it is discarded and nothing happens.

situation: You're not alone in here.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check or a monster appears! If you defeat the monster, gain $5 as you discover a cache of gold.

situation: You're not sure how, but you find yourself interviewing for a guest lecturer position.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to gain a Retainer. "Everything's going to be fine," says a kindly patient in the lounge, seeming quite lucid. He pats your hand, gets up, and walks off. The strange thing is, you find yourself quite convinced. Gain 3 Sanity.

situation: You're promised the tale of a lifetime, but it turns out to be a long story about nothing.
rest: You are delayed. A medium beckons you into a room full of the bereaved, grieving for the recently deceased. He confides that his power is insufficient to complete his ritual and contact the dead man's spirit. If you will help him, he can tell you many secrets. You may discard a Spell to take 3 Clue tokens.

situation: You're sitting in the reception area when Sheriff Engle steps out of the back. He looks at you intently.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check. If you succeed, he hands you a pair of handcuffs and says "You look like you could put these to good use." Search the Common Items deck for a Handcuffs card. If you fail, nothing happens. "Listen," says Joey "The Rat". "These just fell off the back of the boat, you get me?" Draw 2 Common Items. You may purchase one of them for $1 more than its list price.

situation: You've accepted a fisherman's offer of a boat ride, but in the middle of the trip, the craft suddenly capsizes!
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to swim safely to shore, or be delayed. "Are you visiting family in town?" asks the clerk. Draw one Innsmouth Look card.

situation: You've been down here so long you fear you're losing your sense of reality and your sense of self. You must either
rest: lose 2 Sanity or draw 1 Innsmouth Look card.

situation: You've completed your task, but now you must escape before the portal closes!
rest: Pass a Speed (-2) check to return to Arkham. If you fail, you are lost in time and space. In either event, you automatically close the gate you entered through.

situation: You've experienced some strange things. Doyle Jeffries, the editor, will pay you $5 for an interview. If you accept,
rest: you are delayed. "Wait here, I think I've got an old heirloom that may help you." Basil Elton goes into the lighthouse to look. If you pass a Luck (-1) check, gain 1 Unique Item. If you fail the check, he can't find it.

situation: You've found a most amazing book, filled with everything you could ever want to know-- provided you can endure reading it.
rest: For each point of Sanity you are willing to lose, you may draw a Spell; choose one to keep and discard the others.

situation: You've found yourself in the Fantastic Realms and the terrain twists back upon itself in physically impossible ways.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to navigate your way out again. If you fail, lose 1 Sanity and you are delayed.

situation: You've gone so far into the cave, you fear it will take you a long time to find your way back. There's a small, difficult-to-navigate passage that may be faster.
rest: Make a Fight (-2) check to squeeze through the smaller cave. If you fail, stay here next turn while you go back the long way.

situation: You've got the proof you need, now all you have to do is escape this terrible place!
rest: Pass a Luck (-1) check to move to Falcon Point, then remove all tokens from both the Feds Raid Innsmouth and the Deep Ones Rising tracks. In addition, remove 1 doom token from the doom track. If you fail, you are devoured.

situation: You've heard that strange creatures appear at night in the hopyard. If you wish, you may
rest: spend the night here and observe. If you do so, you are delayed and gain 3 Clue tokens observing the creatures that dwell here in the night. A horse-drawn cart filled with supplies has pulled up outside the General store. If you agree to help Joe Osborn unload the cart, stay here next turn and gain $3.

situation: You've never had such vivid dreams in your life!
rest: Move to the Dreamlands have an encounter there, and then return here immediately.

situation: You've never seen nor experienced anything so awful.
rest: Roll four dice. For each die that is not a success, lose 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina (your choice).

situation: You've seen the creatures use this machine to learn, but you're not sure what effect it'll have on you. If you use it,
rest: make a Luck (-2) check and draw 1 Skill. If you fail the check, however, you also draw 1 Madness card.

situation: You've snuck into the refinery, but now there are workers everywhere.
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to remain calm and stay where you are. If you fail, you are arrested when you try to leave and taken to Innsmouth Jail. "Jazz" Mulligan, the head janitor from the college comes for some of Ma's famous apple pie. While he's visiting, he demonstrates how he got his nickname by playing some soulful blues on his harmonica. Gain 1 Sanity.

situation: You've stumbled upon the Cult of the Black Goat! You may join them if you wish. To do so, you must
rest: on the Cult of the Black Goat! You may join them if you wish. To do so, you must discard at least 2 toughness worth of monster trophies, lose 3 Stamina, or an Ally. Take a "One of the Thousand" Cult Membership card. If you cannot or choose not to join, pass a Speed (-2) check or lose 2 Stamina.

situation: Your captor subjects you to a terrifying array of mental and physical tortures for his own amusement.
rest: You are reduced to 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina. In addition, your maximum Sanity and Stamina are each reduced by 1. Keep this card to remind you. However, you have discovered an inner reserve of strength and willpower as a result of the torture. Gain 3 Clue tokens gain 1 Skill, and increase your Focus by 1.  "And whosoever perseveres in delving its secrets," reads the faded scripture, "will learn untold mysteries." You are delayed, but take a Clue token.

situation: Your discussions on the Mythos lead campus security to conclude that you are off your rocker, and they escort you off campus.
rest: Move to Arkham Asylum and immediately have an encounter there.

situation: Your doctors give you a pill to help you relax.
rest: Move to the first are of the Dreamlands, have an encounter there, and then immediately return. "According to legend, this mirror was once used to travel from our world into the lands beyond. Does this interest you?" If you wish, you may discard any Common Item, Unique Item, or Spell to move to the first area of any Other World.

situation: Your door is locked from the outside!
rest: You are delayed.

situation: Your feet begin to sink into a repulsive goo.
rest: Pass a Fight (-2) check to pull yourself out. If you fail, you are sucked into the unknown and are lost in time and space.

situation: Your feet sink into the soft mud. To your horror, you realize you are continuing to sink.
rest: Make a Fight (-1) check to free yourself. If you pass, you are Blessed and feel as if you have a new love of life. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina and you are delayed waiting to be rescued.

situation: Your focus alone will see you through times of confusion.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check or you are delayed.

situation: Your foot slips on one of the damp ledges and you go tumbling down a steep incline.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, you end up landing right next to a rare and powerful artifact. Search the Unique Item deck and take the first Weapon you find. If you fail, you land on a bunch of rocks. Lose 2 Stamina. A glowing light ahead draws you towards it. Make a Luck (-1) check. If you pass, the glow is a way home. Return to Arkham. If you fail, the light is a trap set by one of the creatures that lives here. A monster appears!

situation: Your footsteps on the wooden dock are echoed by splashing noises below that keep pace with you.
rest: Make a Will (+0) check. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity and move to the street. If you pass, lose 1 Sanity but stay where you are. "It's a simple transference principle, really," the professor explains. "Simply place an everyday item on this platform..." If you discard a Common Item, you may roll a number of dice equal to the item's cost. You may draw a number of cards from the Unique Item deck equal to the number of successes rolled, keeping one and discarding the rest.

situation: Your inquiries have attracted the attention of some locals.
rest: Pass a Will (-2) check to calm them down, or add an uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track. "Testifying" Cooter Falwell latches onto you and rambles on about his spiritual beliefs. Make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, then somewhere in Cooter's words you find a clue to the Mythos threat. Gain 1 Clue token, but lose 1 Sanity. If you fail, move to the street while you listen to Cooter ramble on about pure nonsense.

situation: Your journey through the darkness is slow but restful.
rest: you are restored to your maximum Stamina, but are delayed. Although the future is a frightening and confusing place, you come across a small statue of yourself, proving that, if nothing else, you made a difference to someone. You may discard 1 Madness card.

situation: Your leg is suddenly caught in a bear trap.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. If you are still conscious, make a Fight (-1) check to free yourself. If you fail, you are delayed, waiting for someone to help you. "This was pulled out of the water yesterday. You might want to see it." The doctors show you the body of a deep one. The sight and odor are incredibly repugnant. Lose 1 Stamina. Then, if you are still conscious, make a Lore (-1) check and gain 1 Clue token for each success.

situation: Your mind and body are toughened by your experiences.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check to draw 1 Skill.

situation: Your mind is flooded with knowledge.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass it, draw 1 Spell, but lose 1 Sanity.

situation: Your mind is not your own!
rest: Make a Will (-1) check to endure the experience. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens when you are restored to your body. If you fail, the mind-wipe is successful. Lose 2 Sanity, less 1 for each Clue token you discard. A man steps in front of you with a knife in one hand and a writ for your execution in the other, but he seems to hesitate. Do you attack him? If you charge him, make a Fight (+0) check. If you pass, search the Common Item deck and take the Knife card. If you fail, lose 1 Stamina. If you do not attack him, make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, he introduces himself as Osgood Oswald Vance and tells you where he's hidden a large sum of money. Gain $10. If you fail, he lashes out suddenly. Gain an Injury card.

situation: Your only hope is to steal a byakhee and some space mead!
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check to escape. Return to Arkham and gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you are lost in time and space.

situation: Your only hope: to avoid the attention of this transgression against the knowable.
rest: Pass a Sneak (-2) check or you are reduced to 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity, and are lost in time and space. "Help me!" The voice comes from a cylinder containing a human brain! You may search the Skill deck for the Lore card. If you take it, you lose 2 Sanity.

situation: Your path ends at two identical doors.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you succeed, return to Arkham. If not, you are lost in time and space.

situation: Your peril clears your mind.
rest: Pass a Will (+0) check to restore your Sanity to its maximum value. "Ia! Ia! Cthulhu Fhtagn!" Where is that chanting coming from? Make a Luck (-2) check. If you succeed, gain 2 Clue tokens as you follow the robed figures. If you fail, lose 2 Sanity and 2 Stamina.

situation: Your presence has upset a large number of bats. As they fly about you,
rest: make a Will (-2) check. If you fail, you run blindly through the dark and lose 1 Stamina as you knock into the cave walls. A bunch of kids are down here playing some game you've never seen before and repeating a little musical phrase that you suspect has a deeper meaning. Make a Lore (-2) check. If you pass, you recognize what the children's rhyme really means. Gain 1 Spell.

situation: Your red-eyed reflection in the mirror captures your attention.
rest: Stay here next turn. "Gate-portal?" buzzes its mouths within your head. "All time-places are gate-portals." You grasp at its meaning, the favor of fortune your only defense against an accidental and disastrous misunderstanding. Pass a Luck (-2) check or take this card. While you have it, your difficulty to close gates is increased by 1. Discard this card when you close a gate.

situation: Your room's last occupant left a small shrine to Osiris.
rest: Make a Luck (+0) check. If you pass, a monster appears. If you fail, a monster appears and you must take the Harried card.

situation: Your studies of the Innsmouth threat so far enable you to quickly pick the most relevant item from the crowd of artifacts and jewelry awaiting processing. You may
rest: spend 3 Clue tokens to draw 2 Unique Items, keeping one of your choice and discarding the other.

situation: Your terrible thirst has finally convinced you to try drinking some of the water here.
rest: Make a Luck (-1) check and consult the following chart: Successes:  0) Lose 1 Stamina. 1) No effect. 2) Gain 1 Stamina. 3+) Gain 1 Stamina and draw 1 Spell.

situation: Your travels are endless, packed tight into the space of but a moment.
rest: Lose 1 Stamina. 'Ware the walker of the icy wastes! You must immediately fight Ithaqua! Since there is only one player in this combat, you need one success to remove a doom token. If you reach 0 Stamina, you are devoured. If you defeat Ithaqua, he disperses into an icy wind and you may escape to Arkham immediately. The gate to the Plateau of Leng is sealed behind you, and you may take it as a trophy. If Ithaqua is the Ancient One in play, do not fill up his doom track before this combat; also, successes allow you to temporarily flip over the doom tokens to their elder sign sides instead of removing them. Once the battle is over, regardless of the outcome, flip all of the tokens on Ithaqua's doom track back to their doom token side and continue play.

situation: Your zebra has run off without you. Now,
rest: you are delayed. A ghoul offers you a splendid diadem of blazing gold. Will you accept it? If you do not accept the crown, the ghoul lashes out in rage. Pass a Fight (+1) check or reduce your maximum Stamina by 1. If you do accept the crown, gain $8 and reduce your maximum Sanity by 1.

situation: Zebulon Whateley visits from Dunwich to bring Ma a tonic for her cough. In addition, if your Lore is currently 4 or more, he takes you aside and teaches you a spell.
rest: Draw 1 Spell. "I guarantee you've never seen anything like this!" Neil holds up a jar containing a small white creature. You may pay $1 to examine it and make a Lore (-1) check. If you pass, gain 2 Clue tokens. If you fail, you gain 1 brood token if Eihort is the Ancient One. Otherwise, nothing happens.

situation: in a shadowed section of the library, you find a pair of empty shoes lying near a musty, blood-spattered book. Wisely, you turn and leave.
rest: Move to the street.

situation: one of the staff doctors was fired for very erratic research methods, and Dr. Matthew Harris would like your help in reviewing the records of his work.
rest: Make a Lore (-2) check to make sense of it. If you pass, draw 2 Spells, choose 1 to keep and discard the other.
